The camera also became very temperamental - not turning on right away or shutting off right after just being turned on.  I waited until the end of the summer and finally took the camera back to the store.  They sent it back to Nikon's "repair" department, where it has been for the last five weeks.  We have just been notified that ... wait for it... we "dropped the camera and dented the control panel, which in turn damaged the circuitry, but Nikon will make repairs to the camera for $125"  The camera was never dropped on our watch, but since Nikon has had the camera for TWO of the thirteen months we've owned it, we can't say for certain that it wasn't dropped by someone.  And, since our experience with Nikon has been eerily similar to others, it appears that Nikon has no problem dropping their reputation.We plan to take the $125 Nikon wants in ransom for our lemon camera and use it towards the purchase of a Canon.  Wish us luck!

Reviews.Title: Great photo quality, but durability sucks
Reviews.Author: diamond dave "snowbdr440"
Reviews.Content: I write this review with mixed feelings. On one hand, when my S8100 worked it was a nice camera. The photo quality was top notch.  It takes really clear pictures with nice color balance and tones. The flash quality is good too. And the HD video (720p) is very good for a camera of this size. I also liked the zoom lens - it works well.  I had heard good things about Nikons and I made the switch when my wife lost our little Canon point and shoot. So I went for this one, hoping that I would see a dramatic improvement.  The pictures certainly told a more vivid story.But the reliability of this camera SUCKS.  This camera has broken twice on me. The first time I had owned the camera less than a week. We took it on vacation with us and on the 3rd day I got a "lens error". The camera would not turn off or retract the lends. I couldn't use it the entire trip.  I had to send it back to Nikon for repair, which they did because it was still covered by warranty. Now six months later the lens error has happened again.I am done with Nikon products. I will return to using Canon cameras as they are more durable and of higher quality.

Reviews.Title: Great single package for stills and video
Reviews.Author: sjdave
Reviews.Content: I'm finding I rarely use my camcorder or SLR now that I own an S8100 - it does most everything in a single camera.A FEW NEGATIVES:- Camera is bigger than many compacts. It's OK considering you get a 10x optical zoom, but make sure you are OK with the size.- Focus during video zoom is terrible. If you stay at one focal length during a video, this is no problem of course, but if you need to frequently zoom in and out, this may be a deal-breaker.- Random over-exposure. Occasional shots are significantly over-exposed. A quick glance at the LCD will let you know if you should take another shot, or you can usually fix image on the computer later.- I can't get the SD card to be read by a USB card reader. The same card formatted for my Nikon SLR does work with the card reader. Cable from camera to computer for uploading pictures is OK but a bit slow.- Sound quality accompanying video isn't very goodSOME OF MANY POSITIVES:- Face recognition and focus are great- Flash is very bright for a compact camera once you get used to not putting your finger where it pops up.- Buttons and menus are intuitive.- LCD is easy to see, even in bright sunlight. I thought I would miss a viewfinder, but I don't.- Shutter-lag is very short for a compact. Time between shots is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony Close "EngrMan"
Reviews.Content: Enough has been said on the reviews to add my comments in any detail, but overall this is a great camera - great photos so far in a variety of lighting conditions.  Side by side comparisons with lesser cameras bring out the start difference in color clarity and definition.  Image quality over the large zoom range is a huge plus for this product, even in low light conditions.It is interesting that there are so many negative reviews on this product - but in looking at them most of them are related to the video quality, not still image which is uniformly rated 5, or in only some cases a 4. Have not had a chance to try out the video in detail but the few shots I've taken look incredibly good.  But if your main concern is still images, the S8100 is unparalleled.It is to me misleading for readers to see a 3.5 star rating for this product, IMHO.

Reviews.Title: WOW! This Camera Is More Than I Hoped
Reviews.Author: John Doe "Groomer241"
Reviews.Content: I'm no camera expert, but over the last 30+ adult years I've owned numerous cameras and this one is by far the most exciting and capable of them all.  I'm not going to write a detailed review because people far more qualified than me will do that.  However, I do want to weigh in to say this thing works and I love things that do what they say they'll do.  Apple is known for this experience.  If you are looking to replace your camera this is it.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpixs8100
Reviews.Author: ranger
Reviews.Content: I GOT THIS CAMERA FOR XMAS WITHIN 6 MONTHS THIS CAMERA WAS OF NO USE I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA AT J TO &R; OUT OF NY I STILL HAD A 1 YEAR WARRANTY ON THE CAMERA BUT NIKON WOULD NOT HONOR MY WARRANTY SO I WAS SO PISSED WITH BOTH J&R; AND NIKON THAT I HAD TO GO TO CONSUMER AFFAIRS TO TRY AND GET MY MONEY BACK OR GIVE ME A NEW CAMERA.SO PLEASE BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THIS CAMERA AND ALSO BE CAREFUL WHERE YOU PURCHASE IT. NIKON IS THE WORST COMPANY TO DEAL WITH SO PLEASE BEWARE OF THIS .

Reviews.Title: Best gift I ever got myself
Reviews.Author: Shari Basoff "Shari"
Reviews.Content: I needed a light weight camera to take great shots of my Vintage Jewelry. I have 2 shops on line. This has the most excellent macro feature. I absolutely love the HD video and have already shot video's for both my family and business that look like I am a seasoned pro and I have never done video's before. Three things led me to take off a star. I don't like when any company does not provide a instruction booklet. This only comes with a cheat sheet type. The full one has to be downloaded and printed. Who has the time? I find that cheap and ridicules. A lot of the features are intuitive, but I want to make full use of what the camera can do. Also it has to be charged with the camera attached. I need a lot of shooting time and can't be short on battery's. I tried to circumvent this with the purchase of a charger, but unfortunately it failed to charge the battery's correctly and I was stuck this Christmas with no use of my camera. The software is way to complicated. Otherwise this is worth the money I'm getting quality shots and video and enjoying every minute.

Reviews.Title: Beware of SD card compatibility
Reviews.Author: H Daddy
Reviews.Content: Just now able to use my new camera after waiting a few days to go buy another card so the camera would work. I ordered 2 Transcend 8g and 4G class 6 cards with camera. Neither of these Transcend cards or any of the other 4 SD cards I already had would work in the camera. The screen would show the error code "this card write protected"...I tried all the cards with the (card) slide switches in both positions and the S8100 would not function, only with it's built-in internal memory.I contacted Nikon's helpsite and they said I must use only the recommended cards. I went out and bought a SanDisk card and the camera finally accepted it without error.I was not happy that the camera would not accept any of my 6 cards. They should INSIST in their literature that you must use their short list of 4 SD cards. (SanDisk, Toshiba, Panasonic and Lexar)

Reviews.Title: Nikon s8100
Reviews.Author: richo
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for that right point and shoot camera and finally found this one! It's great even in low light shots. Images are what I was looking for. Nice camera Nikon!!

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy Nikon
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: Bought a Nikon Coolpix S8100. Good camera, but..... It stopped working after less than 2 months. Amazon won't help. Nikon customer service department is based offshore. Totally unhelpful. Don't have a clue. Have to send the camera to California at my expense, won't get it back for 5 or 6 days. Don't buy anything from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE SERVICE
Reviews.Author: F. Hay "green hornet"
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write a review but my experience needs to be stated.After a few months the flash stopped working, it just wouldn't fire.Its odd that the flash would stop working so early int he camera's life.I sent it to them two months ago for repair and I still have not received it back!!!!I have called them a few times and they are rude and don't even care.  I spoke to a supervisor to see if there was anything he could do to help and he was obnoxious.They have been waiting on the flash part from Japan for all this time.Canon would not have treated me this way.

Reviews.Title: another icon bites the dust
Reviews.Author: islandboy
Reviews.Content: The camera has good features but you have to work around its limitations. It has problems with the auto focus for example. My bigest disapointment with the camnera is its lense error frequency.If this happens to you and it will the repair even if  its under warranty will cost you. Nikon will claim there was impact damage and the repair will be half the cost of the camera new. I would suggest anyone considering buying this camera do some research about this issue. I had a lense error on mine and it was kept in a padded case from time of purchase and saw very little use yet Nikon claimed it had neen droped. As I understand it this is a common response from Nikon. The lense problem is always the constomers fault. I told Nikon to just send the camera back unrepaired. I going to buy a Cannon at this point. BUYER BEWARE NIKON OF OLD IS NO MORE

Reviews.Title: Most expensive point & shoot I have owned!
Reviews.Author: Becky "dinkime"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as gift in December.  It is now April and my camera is already back to Nikon for repair.  There is a problem with the USB/AV port on the camera.  After following all of their directions for mailing my camera (costing close to $20), I receive my estimate of repairs.  It is, of course, not covered by warranty -- after 4 months...So, now I have put out an additional $104 for them to correct the problem (that they are saying is impact damage, yet it has never had any impact).The pictures are awesome, and I would not have had it fixed for that price except, if the USB/AV port is bad, you cannot upload photos OR charge the battery.What a waste of time & money -- are the pictures worth it?  I probably could have gotten shots just as nice from a Canon or Kodak (and will in the future).

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good price.
Reviews.Author: D. Corcoran
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for my wife's Kodak Easy Share.  I decided to go with the Nikon as we already own a D60 and love it.  After reading several reviews that talked about poor image quality, especially low light images, I was hesitant to buy.  In the end I decided to go with the Nikon and I was not disappointed.  The image quality is great.  The camera is easy to use and has loads of features.My wife loves the camera.  The camera is a great size and fits in her purse/pocket.  She never reads the instruction manuals for any of our electronics, but picked it up and started using it day 1 w/o issue.  I love the camera.  It has tons of extra features for a p&s; and it the perfect companion to my D60.  If you enjoy "tweaking" settings this camera allows plenty of room to experiment.  The camera is responsive and is able to photograph kids at play w/o trouble.Finally, some people complained about background noise while recording video at 1080p.  I haven't noticed any noise and have taken about 20 hours of video.If you're looking for a mid priced p&s; with great image quality then I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: bikingbabe in MA
Reviews.Content: I sold my Canon A640 and replaced it with this and I am very pleased with the sharpness of the photos.  My husband needed a camera that corrected for shake, and so far, this one is impressive.  I would give it 5 stars but the flash is right where I would normally put my left hand when holding it so you have to adjust how you hold it so that the flash can pop up.  Video is sharp although I have not used it extensively yet.  Also, so far I have found it to be quite fast with little shutter lag and good in low light situations.  All in all, very impressive camera.  However, with Christmas shopping upon us, I have noticed some lower prices being advertised so check around for the best price before you purchase one as a local chain store might be less expensive.

Reviews.Title: 11 months and it quit...
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "YoYo's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 12/10 and now have to send it back to Nikon.  While on vacation last month for a family reunion in Cabo San Lucas the darn lens frozen in the "OPEN" position and wouldn't turn off.  I'll send it back and hope for the best.Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)

Reviews.Title: This camera is a great choice!
Reviews.Author: Niki S
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a digital camera that wasn't too cheap and not that expensive and this seemed like a good choice. I really like this camera , picture quality is great and is very easy to use. Also it's special functions/special effects are easily accessible and you don't have to go from one menu page to another. Even though this is an older model, compared to Nikon coolpix S9100, the picture quality of this one is way better. Some negative things: doesn't have a lot of special effects, and the way you have to recharge the battery. For recharging battery you have to plug in a little cable to the bottom of the camera. I'd rather take the battery out of the camera and recharge it, that way my camera is not lying around and not at risk of harm.

Reviews.Title: Nice but....
Reviews.Author: Not a clean queen "not a clean queen"
Reviews.Content: so far I like the camera. The LCD screen is good.  Well worth the slightly larger overall camera size for the much increased zoom. Takes a while to learn how to use the various features.  The quick reference booklet is sad.  It is confusing and the font size and type face make it very hard to read.  The "complete guide" on CD is not much better.  If you increase the font size you have to scroll side to side-a real pain.  The info is poorly presented and there is much duplication.  The quick guide refers you to pages on the CD guide but the page numbers are not always correct.  If you don't read manuals this will not bother you, but I really bothers me. I tried to turn off the date printing on the pictures and after 30 minutes of reading and experimentation I gave up and it is still printing.

Reviews.Title: Crisp pictures
Reviews.Author: Jule Kijek
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter as a graduation gift. She has only had it a few days. It seems to work very well and takes nice crisp pictures. It was easy to use right out of the box. My only issue is that there is a big shutter lag. I am used to shooting with a Nikon D90 so that may be part of the problem. The S8100 may have the same shutter lag time as any P&S; camera. I had toggled between this one and a Canon S95. I was put off by the lack of zoom on the Canon, only 3.8 as opposed to the 10x zoom on the Nikon. That coupled with the good price on the S8100 made this one the better choice for us.I liked saving $150.00. Money that will be put toward her college.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the camera, until it broke.
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: I have several DSLR cameras and have used this as a convenient backup.  It is light and easily fits in a shirt pocket, I have large hands and this one is very easy to hold. I can't say the same for other small cameras I've used.  Although the image quality is not as good as a DSLR, I've been very pleased with the images this takes.  Almost any point and shoot can take decent images nowadays.  What separates a good one is the ability to take images under less than ideal lighting.  This one does a very good job at dealing with high-contrast or low light situations.  By cranking up the ISO, I've taken some very nice shots under very low light, without flash.  The screen is bright and accurately displays colors.  The camera starts up quickly and has a zoom range tha  is adequate for most needs.  The battery seems to have more than enough life for a day of casual shooting.I do agree with some reviewers that the pop-up flash seems to be right where you want to place a finger when  holding it.  When I first started using it I missed a couple of shots because I was accidently holding the flash down.  You do get used to it and all you need to do is change the way you hold it.  I'm not sure if there would be a better place to put the pop-up flash... and yes all things being equal,  a pop-up will take better pictures than a built in flash.I wish it could record video in something other than MOV format.  This may be a matter of personal opinion but other formats are easier to work with and support by more applications.  The video quality is not great, but on par with other compact point and shoots I've used.  If you want high quality HD video, with great sound, prepare to shell out a lot more money on a dedicated video camera.SO WHY ONLY 3 STARS?  I only used the camera about three months when it started malfunctioning.  It would lock up after taking 1 still shot, the zoom stopped working.  If I tried to take video, it starts to record it but I cannot stop without powering it off.  All of this happened at once. I called Nikon and after trying several things they agree that it was defective and asked me to return it for service.  Of course this happened a few days before our Disneyland trip.  Nikon needs to work on their quality control on this model.

Reviews.Title: My favorite purchase of the year
Reviews.Author: tknocker
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It did take a little bit to learn how to use but what camera doesn't. It was worth the time to learn, the photos are amazing. Doesn't matter what light your in they are perfect. In a darker room the pic' aren't messed up but a bright flash, they come out and to my own amazement, perfect. This is a must buy.

Reviews.Title: SMILE
Reviews.Author: Entropy
Reviews.Content: I am overall pleased with the camera and how easy it is to use. I take a lot of pictures of my granddaughter and she's moving. These are some of her best shots. Great camera for on the go people.

Reviews.Title: Good compromise camera for both pictures and video
Reviews.Author: summithome
Reviews.Content: This review focuses on the low light performance of the camera. We just welcomed our first baby to our family and were looking for a new camera that could do both video and pictures. We have several cameras including a Panasonic 3CCD mini-dv camcorder, a Panasonic FZ20 digital camera and a Sony W150 point and shoot digital. All take video but in standard definition and we wanted to move to an HD camera. We looked at the Flip but didn't like that it lacked a zoom. As far the FZ20 and W150, they are both disappointing when it comes to low light (no flash) situations. The Sony was especially bad with a lot of noise in the pictures. The Panasonic FZ20, even though lower in mega-pixels but with a faster 2.8 lens, did a far better job but still resulted in a lot of blurry pictures most of the time. We went with the Nikon based on the price and promised low light performance compared with other cameras from Fuji, Panasonic and Canon. The comparable Canon is about $100 dollars more. Our friends have the Canon PowerShot SD4500IS. They like the Nikon 8100 better. We compared indoor video and photos and found the Nikon to have less noise and be both sharper and brighter. I do have to state that we compared the cameras indoor using only available light. However, both the Canon and Nikon still produced a lot of blurry pictures when hand held. The best bet no matter what is to use a tripod or some other support. Hand held shots were difficult even at the widest angle. So far, there hasn't been any non-dslr, low range cameras that we've tried that can take perfect picture in low light all the time and still have a reasonable long lens. The video quality on the Nikon is superb by far. Black is true at night and not grainy gray. The camera is good at handling the high contrast of a night video. Auto focus in low light was also fishy on both, but could be managed. The camera settings had a big effect on pictures. When the camera was set to indoors, the pictures tended to be slightly darker, but sharper. In contrast, pictures taken on full auto tended to be brighter, but blurry. To wrap it up, the Nikon performed better then other cameras in bad lighting, but still not perfectly. This keeps the camera in 4 star range for me. I like it, but I don't love it. Almost great, but just misses.PROSSolid constructionSharp lcd screenEasy to useGreat video, zoom works well (1080, 720 and standard def available)Good button / control placementConsidering price, good in low light, but not perfectGood color definition in picturesGood form factorPrice vs competitors.Cheap third party batteriesConventional, Apple friendly mpeg video unlike some...panasonic AVCHD liteCONSIffy plastic covers over HDMI and USB portsStrong flash with awkward placementNo included HDMI cableBattery must be charged inside cameraNo included paper manual (cd only)At four inches long, slightly difficult to find a right-sized camera bag

Reviews.Title: More than handy - dandy little camera
Reviews.Author: shalala
Reviews.Content: I considered the S8000 for several months, read reviews and wondered whether I'd be able to appreciate point and shoot quality when I'm used to the Nikon D90.  But I wanted a camera I could carry in my pocket or purse.  I wanted quality, a strong zoom and low light talent in this little camera.  And honestly, I didn't want to have to think about settings much.  Meanwhile, the S8000 came and went, replaced by S8100, and I went for it.  I love this little camera.  The quality is good enough that I don't hesitate to pull it out often.  I've gotten some amazing photos with it, including the full moon before the eclipse.  Because it's so light, it's easy to hold still for night shots, even without a tripod.  I'm used to a viewfinder, so there have been a few times when I grabbed it fast and couldn't figure out how to see the picture.  My goof.  I also forget to keep my left finger off the flash pop-up once in a while, but I quickly learned to move it off the flash the moment I feel the pressure.  I don't like to shoot with built-in flash and I have to remember to program the flash not to fire when I start the shoot.  I don't plan to shoot videos with this little camera, so I can't comment on that feature.  The controls are very basic and simple - a no brainer camera that can get the good picture as long as I turn the dial, make a menu selection and frame it up.  I got an extra battery to keep charged for backup.  The Coolpix doesn't replace my Nikon SLR, but it's the only camera I have with me at all times.  I recommend Nikon Coolpix S8100 to anyone who wants a great quality point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Greater starter for nature photography
Reviews.Author: Karen K Hielsberg
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a couple of weeks ago, and absolutely love it!  I recently became interested in nature photography, and wanted to start with photos of the birds that visit our backyard feeders.  I was immediately impressed by how quickly I could zoom in on a perched bird and get a great shot, and I haven't even tried it with the tripod yet.  I've mostly used the auto settings, but am experimenting with others to see what I get.  This camera actually works better for what I am trying to do than the SLR I bought last year, and the photo quality is much better.  I haven't tried to shoot much video, but what I have comes out fine.  I do agree that the pop-up flash is in a bad location.  I usually hold the camera with my left index finger over the top corner of the camera, and often block the pop-up for this reason.I've used the camera to take internal shots of my home, and am impressed with the wide angle focus and back lighting features.  I'm still learning, but I think I am going to have a lot of fun with this camera.  For me it's great value for the money, high quality, and easy to use.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Lens error after two short months
Reviews.Author: Stephen L. Cook "pop fan"
Reviews.Content: Facebook was a great medium to show off all the great photos I took with this camera. My trip to Milan, vacationing in the southwest, family photos - all really nice.But, this is an obituary.After a brief two month affair with this little thing, the lens would not retract. I tried all the tips and tricks on line, but no luck. So, my last day of vacation in beautiful Sedona was ruined by a crummy lens.I will not buy another because I simply dont have the patience for this kind of nonsense.

Reviews.Title: best camera in its class by far
Reviews.Author: Frau Dr.
Reviews.Content: Since so many of the reviews mention it, I'll start by saying I don't use the video mode, I don't care about the video mode. I have a video camera for video. I was buying a camera solely for still photography, and, if that's what you are looking for, there is no better in this price class. I did extensive research before buying - I had never had anything but a Canon in the point-and-shoot category before. I tried out the comparable Canon and Lumix before deciding on this one. I could not be more pleased.  No one does true color better than Nikon, and its AUTO mode is off the charts spot-on, even for difficult shots in weird light with subtle effects (sun pooling through a forest canopy, for example, or dusk on a street as the neon lights come on). I like a mix of AUTO and manual - this one has it, and manual is extremely easy to call up and use, unlike that mode for the other two brands. The preset modes can also be manipulated to produce high contrast and backlit effects, among others I have yet to fully explore. Indoor flash photography! Amazing! Soooo tired was I of the washed out deer-in-the-headlights effect of the Canon - finally, I take a picture of my dog, and it looks like my dog, you know? It seems a small thing, but hard to find at this price. The zoom is also fantastic - image stabilization works well with this, unlike the Lumix, supposedly the best rated in this category, but in my try-out, irregular at best. Other complaints in reviews have to do with the location of the flash - not a problem for me. I just don't put my finger there - there's no particular reason to do so. The flash quality is such that I am not going to complain about where it's located. My biggest problem with the camera is that I can't find a camera pouch to suit it. Too many of those advertised on amazon.com say they will fit the somewhat more "square" geometry of the S8100 in point-and-shoot pouches designed for the Lumix or Elph. I've sent two back so far - any recommendations on the best bag for the S8100 are welcome. I wouldn't want anything to happen to this camera. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Not all it's cracked up to be....
Reviews.Author: kj "chicagomom"
Reviews.Content: I really really wanted to love this camera like all the others and even the reviewers on walmarts site.  So I ordered and was so excited.  It did good video and really good shots with auto mode which is so important to me with animals and kids around I need a fast camera with a good all in one auto mode.  My happiness quickly faded when day turned into night.  HORRIBLE indoor shots at night.  I had every light on in the house!!!  The colors were completely off, and the white balance was horrible.  I have white kitchen counters and if they were anywhere in the shot it ruined my whole pick!!!  Also went to a restuarant took some picks inside where is was dimm lighting, and again HORRIBLE!!!  my cheap kodak had awesome pic but nikon was awful with it.  I was 4 feet away and the flash was so bright that my asian husband looks like a ghost!!  I adjusted flash level still horrible.  The colors were all off way too much RED.  Indoor family photos in front of fireplace at night with all lights on had so many artifacts I couldn't even use them, after cropping and editing I had a horrible photo.  I have several digital cameras I know what I'm doing, and this camera is a huge dissapoint for my needs.  I returned it after 2 weeks of trying to fall inlove with it.I have recently purchased the Fujifilm finepix F550EXR, today is day one, so far it is fantastic, but we will see tonight how my indoor shots look, and I will write review for it then.Nikon Pros:  love the red colorbody, nice weight to it, fast recovery between shots, great auto mode, good video mode.Nikon Cons:  Horrible flash way too strong, color for indoor night photos is horrible completely wrong, white balance completely off, too many artifacts on indoor shots.The cons were way too serious for me to ignore on this model of camera, this is something I expect for entrylevel super cheap digital!  Also, when I went to register product, nikon said my serial was invalid, and that it may be a grey maket item.  That sometimes their products come from other sources.  Pretty scary if you ask me, maybe that is why the reviews are so extreme on this product either you got a good one or you didn't?  I bought mine thru walmart.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: Julian Velasco
Reviews.Content: I have had MANY cameras over the past few years, from point & shoots to DSLRs.  Therefore, I feel like I can make fair comparisons.  This camera is not horrible.  In many respects, it's pretty good.  But it is very disappointing compared to the competition.  And therefore, I cannot recommend it.On many of the basics, it's quite solid.  Image quality is good.  Ergonomics are good (if you don't mind the pop-up flash).  And it's reasonably quick and responsive.But ... it's not any better than comparable cameras.  In particular, I got it mostly because it was supposed to be so fast.  But it's really not.  Autofocus isn't any faster than others.  Flash doesn't recharge any faster than others.  And image quality is on a par with the competition.And ... it has a few major problems.  First, it overexposes when you use flash.  A significant number of my shots using flash are entirely blown out and unusable.  That's just unacceptable!  It hasn't happened with any of my other cameras.  Second, it seems to have a slightly less reliable autofocus than other cameras.  It's not horrible, mind you.  But that's a few extra shots that get ruined on top of the flash problem.  And, perhaps not a major problem but still a real headache, it doesn't reliably record orientation information.  If I take a picture in portrait orientation instead of landscape, it only occasionally comes out properly on my computer.  Most of the time I have to rotate the pictures on my computer.  It's a pain.Again, the camera isn't bad by any means.  It's just that, at this price, you can do better.  I sold my Sony HX5V -- a camera with which I was very happy, and which I highly recommend -- to get this.  I did it because this had very good reviews and it was supposed to be very fast.  It is no faster than the Sony, and it has many more problems.  I wish I hadn't sold the Sony, and I may have to buy another one (or another camera).  So do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.I should add that I do not care about the video, so I have not tried it.UPDATE: It seems that if you are patient, you can avoid the flash overexposure problem.  You have to wait until after it has perfectly focused before you take the picture.  If you try to rush it -- which I often do, because I'm taking pictures of fast-moving children -- the flash may overexpose.  I've been taking it slowly for a couple of weeks and it seems to work.  So I've upped the rating by one star.  But it's still disappointing.UPDATE 2:  Well, even with patience, you can't avoid the overexposure problem entirely.  It seems to occur less often, but I definitely still happens, no matter how slow I take it!  I've noticed that it sometimes just picks a ridiculously high ISO level, so I've chosen a reduced ISO range and that seems to help as well.  We'll see over time.  But even if it does, it's still unacceptable.UPDATE 3:  Changing the ISO level to max out at 400 when you use flash really helps.  Overexposure still happens, but it's rare compared to the default setting.

Reviews.Title: exactly what it's purported to be......way cool!
Reviews.Author: G. Powell
Reviews.Content: this compact Nikon arrived today and it took all of 3 minutes to prepare it and turn it on, which is as quick as claimed.  nice, large display, with the flash location not an issue for me at all.  I stepped outside and just snapped about 4-5 photos before coming in and downloading.  they were really surprising SOOC.I do not plan on using the video feature, other than perhaps on a rare occasion, as I bought it to carry around in inclement weather more than anything, rather than expose the D90 or the D300s to winters elements.  It feels very sturdy in my hand.I'll update in 30-45 days if any issues arise, but it is exactly what I felt it should be, and the $$ is fairly set!

Reviews.Title: Crisp Image but Kinda Big and Bulky
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I know we've come a long way in terms of camera size, but this one still feels kinda big too me.  It's definitely not something I could squeeze into my pocket, it's not smartphone sized at all.  And compared with my old Coolpix 7600, its about the same weight, and not a whole lot thinner.In any case, the nice big display screen shows crisp images.It has a cool continuous feature that takes multiple pictures in the event you are trying to capture a changing scene (like my baby daughter moving around).  But most of the pictures I've taken with it have come out blurry so far.Another cool feature is the subject tracking, which puts a target on your subject and keeps them in focus even as they are moving so you get a non-blurred picture.The zoom is pretty awesome, especially compared to my old Coolpix.  It really gets up close.As previously stated, the Flash is in the worst location possible.  I found it under my left index finger as I was about to take a picture and it tried to pop-up.  I can see how this will get annoying after a while.  In fact, I have missed a few great photo opportunities as a result.The Full HD video quality is amazing.  It's very crisp and clear, just like the still pictures. I can't imagine why anyone would need a home video camera if you have this camera.  It definitely beats out video cameras in terms of size and probably quality too.And don't forget, it doesn't come with a memory card, so if you don't have one, get one.  And probably a large capacity one for HD videos.Update:So we just checked the sound quality of the videos we took, and it's pretty poor.  You can hear the zooming mechanical sounds in the audio of the video when you zoom in and out.  That's very unfortunate.We are thinking about returning it, but still looking for a better option first.Final Update:So we ended up returning the S8100 and went with the Nikon Coolpix S6000 14.2MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver-primary).  The 720p HD looks just as good on my laptop as the Full HD of the S8100.  In fact, the full HD from the S8100 was acting a bit choppy even on my intel Core i5 brand new laptop!  It wouldn't work at all on my old Intel P4.The zoom is ok, but definitely needs plenty of light for a good shot.It's also a lighter weight and smaller camera which is a big plus for me.And the best part is that it's half the price of the S8100.  I was definitely not getting an additional $150 worth of value on the S8100.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Horrible!
Reviews.Author: amymrno
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother. She wanted a semi-professional camera for her Christmas Vacation to the Dominican Republic. I heard a lot of great reviews, and decided to buy it.My Mom is very careful of her things, and even with her being cautious of the camera, After 3 weeks, the shutter broke. She had to end the last days of her vacation taking pictures with lenses shadowing in the pictures.Also The White balance was horrible!!Everytime you would take pictures of somebody wearing white, there would be a white glow shining in the picture.Also, the fact that the flash was right under where you would put your fingers, made it longer to take pictures because sometimes the flash would pop out under the fingers and you would have to do a double take.That whole full HD video was not HD at all. You cant even film at night time. I wasted $74.00 on a HD memory card, because a regular memory card was not capable of filming it.This whole camera was a mess. It couldnt even do good recognition sometimes leaving the pictures blurry.I ended up using photoshop and picasa to edit the pictures to try and make it look "professional" something I didnt expect to do by purchasing this camera.Thankfully the store that I bought the camera was able to give me my Money Back.I ended up buying a Sony 14.0 MEGAMIXEL Cybershot DSC-H55. I had to buy an extra memory stick but it's worth it. Now this is a camera!Nikon needs to get it together, not only did I waste my time, Money, but I ended up with alot of bad pictures on one of the most memorable vacation trips my mother has had.I know this sony wont let me down.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but not what I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: Vada Morgan "Vada"
Reviews.Content: I ended up taking this camera back because I was looking for something with better image quality. The quality on these pictures were great, and usually never blurry, if you didn't crop the picture on the computer. Some pictures with around ISO 100 came out very clear, especially pictures taken in macro, and I could crop those about 50%, but I couldn't crop 90% of the normal shots without it getting fuzzy.The other thing that was weird was that the flash was super bright it seemed to wash out my pictures. I played with all the features and settings like changing the lighting (indoor, natural, etc.) and I ended up adjusting the brightness to where it was turned to a darker setting for taking all my pictures to even out the brightness of the flash.Overall I liked it a lot, and I do recommend it for casual picture taking, but I was wanting crisper clarity because I do a lot of cropping photos on the computer to get close-ups of my child's face (without sticking the camera in his face). The video was great though. Very clear and easy to use. The zoom was great too, especially for a compact. I ended up getting the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35.

Reviews.Title: Bad camera.....stay away
Reviews.Author: M. PORTER
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a little over a year and have had to send it to Nikon twice already. Once the motor in the lens had to be replaced. Now I get an errror on the screen that says "Mode dial not in the right position".The second time Nikon wants to charge me 106.03!Buy a Canon!

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: JerseyGuy
Reviews.Content: I purchased two brand new Nikon S8100 cameras and within 3 months they both broke and showed LENS ERROR on the display. Useless at this point. Nikon "repaired" them free of charge under the warranty but within a few months of being returned, they both displayed the same issues. Now Nikon wants to charge me for the repairs. I would stay VERY far away fro this model and maybe far away from all Nikons since they most likely use the same technology on all cameras.

Reviews.Title: electrobrand lies, gives 0 custromer service, they just don't care
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Fernandez de C L
Reviews.Content: i suppose the camera is ok, don't know, never got itthe purchase was made on june 13 th, paid 10 usd to have on time, and arrived at the hotel I was staying 5 days later, on the 26 of juneat electrobrand they lied to me, and told me if erase my review they would send anther one, wich never happendnever buy with them, be careful, they lie, don't care for the customer, and took my money

Reviews.Title: Nice pics, weak lens cover
Reviews.Author: A Shopper
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures - minor low light issues, but after 10 months the lens cover (plastic pieces slide over lens when closed, supposed to slide away when open), is no longer opening.  You have to physically spread the lens covers apart until they stay apart.  We will take it to local camera shop for repairs.  A snap on/off cover would be a better option for lens cap.

Reviews.Title: Built-In Obsolescence: I've been punked by Ashton Kutcher
Reviews.Author: Robert Jennings
Reviews.Content: Thirteen months after purchase, one month after warranty expiration, the still photo feature and telephoto zoom stopped.  No warning, no error messages.  Curiously, the video feature seems unaffected, as does the LCD display.  After having two Canon point & shoots that took beautiful photos suddenly stroke out on me (one also way too soon), I decided to go with the Nikon Coolpix S8100.  When it worked, it was a five-star performer that also took beautiful photos.  But for $274.97, I expected a much longer lifetime.  I've found nothing but horror stories about Nikon's customer service and camera repair that takes weeks and months to unfold -- even with their $$$$ pro cameras.  I'm not looking forward to writing my own horror story on a follow-up post.  At least one of my Canons lasted a few years.

Reviews.Title: Best camara by far!
Reviews.Author: Michael Dolinski
Reviews.Content: My brother bought two of these for christmas last year..one for me and one for my mom.So far...it is the best camera I've ever owned! It takes amazing pictures and videos!I am a new mom...and constantly take pictures and videos of my baby, and everyonecomplements on the quality of my pictures!My mom loves her camera too! And if she can use it with no problems...then you know its extemely user friendly!!!All of the digital camera's I've owned in the past don't compare to this one! I've used Cannon and Sony...and would always buy top of the line (best reviewed products).I cannot emphasize enough this product superceeds anything i've ever used by FAR!!!My brother has a fancy $2200 Nikon with different lens attachments...and people always ask if he had taken pictues of my baby with his camera..while all along i am usingmine :)

Reviews.Title: $149 best buy black friday special
Reviews.Author: Tom100 "Tom100"
Reviews.Content: Nov 25, 2011 Best Buy special is $149, can return until end of Dec. This is a pretty good deal, but still much more than various other 12mp point and shoots with 4x zoom and 720 video from $49-90.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error Killed This Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A Kwee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in June and I loved it.  Great picture quality and easy to use.  Unfortunately within a month of owning it, it started doing some quirky things.  I would turn the camera on and the lens would open, portrude, retract, and repeat several times.  Then it would says "Lens Error" and remain frozen.  It became more frequent until finally it just stopped working.  It's unfortunate because I really liked the camera for the one month I got to use it.  When I researched this problem online, I found that this is a frequent complaint associated with this camera.  People talked about returning it for a new one, only to have the same problem with the new camera.  I ended up returning it and buying the Canon Powershot SX130 IS.  I can't tell you much about that camera yet as I just got it today.  I would definitely NOT recommend buying the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix S8100
Reviews.Author: MichaelJ
Reviews.Content: Not a "professional" photographer so this review will be a lot less technical than most of the ones that I read prior to purchasing the Nikon CoolPix S8100 digital camera.  The automatic settings have worked well for me in most cases.  Taking away noise reduction for the HD video helped quite a bit with the sound quality.  The pictures look great but the video is even better!  The images are very clear, and good quality...take up a bit of space.  The video takes up a lot of space...even for a short video.  But got an entire video of about 25 minutes for the Dolphin show at SeaWorld Orlando, FL.  Looks very nice when hooked-up to the 42" Sharp Aquos.  Batteries last for about 200 images as advertised.  Purchased 4 batteries (two Nikon and two not), a case, two 16gb HDXC memory cards, quick charger and a tri-pod....total purchase (including camera) was around $350...excellent price for what you get!  Only three "complaints"....I have yet to figure out how to take photos of faster action (dancing at a wedding), how to take video with a flash (if possible) and the sticker that was on top of the flash came off so the surface is sticky (perhaps from the fact that the flash has to pop-up automatically and then be pushed back down after use.)  Lot of good comments when images were posted on FB.  Included SW takes out red-eye, etc. after the fact so good deal there also.  Excels taking outdoor photos (with the help of the Optical 10x zoom.)  Recommended purchase for any casual photographer.

Reviews.Title: My Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Long
Reviews.Content: After a recommendation from my Dad, who is a professional photgrapher, I picked this one.  I shopped for a couple of months to make sure it was THE ONE!  Love this camera!  The only thing I have had to get used to is not putting my finger where the flash is at.  It didn't take long for me to remember, and it was game on!  I took a leftover LCD screen cover for my cell phone, cut it, and placed it on the LCD screen to make cleaning it easier without worrying about scratching it.  Well worth the investment.  And my Dad likes it too!

Reviews.Title: the flash ruins most pics
Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: the video quality of the camera is excellent, but all of my photos using the flash are overexposed.  i'm really disappointed with the quality of the flash, but without it, the camera is good.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!
Reviews.Author: Houston2010
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a point and shoot camera for a long time. I ended up buying this camera about 2 months ago. I love it. I bought it bc I needed a good camera for my trip to Hawaii. I must say that the pictures came out great, even while moving, in the dark and the zoom is incredible! I also love the 5 frames per second, makes for great baby pics! I'm also impressed with the battery life, I was in Hawaii for 6 days, used my camera everyday, and only had to charge it once!The only downside is the pop up flash...makes for great pics, but you have to remember to put it down. Also, the camera is a little bulky, but with the great zoom it has, totally worth the weight.

Reviews.Title: Back lit CMOS, where have you been all my life?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera! I was not in need of a new point and shoot, but it was on a great deal and I had a gift card to burn up so I took a shot. Right on target! The lens has a great range to it, the wide angle is indispensable. Controls are easy and intuitive. I love the one button on and off for the video. The video itself is quite amazing. Full 1080p out of such an inexpensive and already feature packed camera with the quality it offers is amazing. There are only a couple of minute issues I have with it overall. The lens gets a little soft in the long end. The wide angle is so sharp, it rivals my DSLR. And for the video, if you leave it set to continuous AF, when you play it back you can hear the focus mechanism clicking over and over again to regain focus. Both issues are easy to deal with once you know they exist. Don't zoom to the full length and don't use C-AF. Problems solved! Every time I review the pictures from this great little camera, I am always amazed at how good this inexpensive point and shoot is.

Reviews.Title: Pretty impressive on the go
Reviews.Author: Pep Streebek
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 3 months ago to replace a 6 year old Canon Powershot 3.2 megapixel, as well a Sony HDD Handicam.  I also have a Canon DLSR.  The Canon Powershot's screen went black, and would no longer take pictures.  It was well used, and I feel that we got our money out of it. The Sony Handicam, however, was less than 3 years old, and rather expensive.  The only video it will shoot now is upside down and backwards.  Yep!  Not that that isn't hard to maneuver because everything is backwards when you tape, up is down, left is right...  Not to mention the image is flipped and everyone looks a bit odd.  There is an image flip feature on the software, (now I know why) but even then who can watch the video unless you are videotaping something in one place?  After a little research I found that both these cameras had the same sensor from a 3rd party, and they were known to go bad.  There was a window they would fix the Handicam, but mine last longer.  At  $300 to fix, I just decided not to fix it.That's where this little camera comes in.  I do not lug my SLR around everywhere, and I needed another camera to keep in my purse, and to take video.  I looked at a couple cheaper Kodak's and the color was awful and there was a lot of washout from the flash.  I couldn't decide between this on and the Canon SD1400 IS.  The Nixon has 10x zoom and 1080 video, and is a bit larger and sturdier feeling.  I paid $230 6 months ago (on sale) when they were $299 everywhere else. I purchased it from Walmart, simply because their warranty gives you an immediate trade in and they hassle with the manufacturer.  I think we have all been in that boat trying to get our stuff fixed or a replacement.  This is the first warranty I have bought in years because of an ill-deal with a stereo at Sears.The camera is sturdy, starts quickly, and you cannot beat the low light images.  A lot of my pictures are indoor functions, and this takes the Canon SLR on far away,  florescent lighting shots.  I like the 1080 video, the zoom, and the ability to takes pictures while taking video.Drawbacks:  I couldn't download to Zoombrowser (the Canon software) so I had to clog my computer with the Nikon software (which isn't bad, just don't need 2), which logs all my pictures again.  As said in other posts, the zoom is a bit noisy and slow, and the flash is in an odd spot.  The zoom also doesn't stop immediately.  While you can zoom while videotaping (many other cameras in this category cannot), I do not believe it is 1080 once you zoom.  These aren't deal breakers for me,  I learned to keep my finger in on the side and you can't hear the zoom over screaming kids at sporting events anyway.  The quickness of the autofocus once the zoom stops is outstanding.  There is also a little lag in between shots.  Pick your shot wellMy biggest complaint is the battery life!  Doesn't take much taping to suck it dry, and there is no warning!  Also it has to be charged in the camera.  I am buying a spare so I don't miss anything again.The pictures are clear and crisp, but the clarity and color cannot compete with the SLR, but I am sure it tops other cameras in its category. I would purchase this again!  Nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: It's lot better than I expected.
Reviews.Author: KKN
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Powershot which slipped in waters and stopped working and had to get a new camera. I love Canon cameras but wanted a change so looked at Sony and Nikon, got a Sony and returned it and then I got this 8100, I was planning to get coolpix 9100 but looking at cost and being new in the market I wanted to get something that has already there with enough reviews and costs less than newer ones.Except few complains like the location  of flash, scene selection etc, this one really impressed me, I have taken pictures indoor and outdoor, pictures are really great, great clarity and zoom is also good.LIKE IT.

Reviews.Title: Great camera that I`ve ever seen!
Reviews.Author: Debby
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera a long time ago, but I didn't know wich one to buy. I was looking for a camera with a great quality in the pictures and videos, pretty color and a camera that I could put in my purse.After a long research I think I did the BEST choice. This camera is AMAZING, my friends have other kind of cameras and all of them said that my camera is amazing and has a great quality! Totally true. I asked to one guy take a picture of us and he couldn`t believe how good was the camera and he asked me where I bought it.I went at Radio City Music Hall, in NYC, watching Madagascar Live, and I sat in the 3r floor, so far than stage, I put the zoom and I could see the face (all the details in their face) of the people and with my own eyes I couldn`t.I am really pround of my choice, this is more that I expected, but the camera is large and a little heavy comparing with the others, but I think is because the zoom.Anyway, I liked this camera, is a beautiful color (I have in red) and I am not professional but I can take good pictures with it.I bought this camera at amazon.com because was cheapper comparing with the other websites and you will receive a pretty cool case in leather for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...Still Too Slow For Sport Photography
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Diercks
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera for the price.  It is fast, especially in good light.I bought it for photographing my kids sports activities (volleyball and soccer) and I have found it to be too slow for indoor sports like volleyball. It wants to use a flash indoors and by the time the flash goes off, the play is long past.Soccer season is already over, but I imagine I will have more luck there since it is an outdoor sport.  I am also playing with turning off the flash at volleyball games to try to speed up the camera shutter speed.

Reviews.Title: Great night shots but washed out in bright daylight
Reviews.Author: alrtx
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for 4 months, taken it on 4 trips - 1 beach, 1 cruise, 1 city, 1 nature/camping.  I was replacing my Canon SD1000, which I loved.  I wanted a fast point-n-shoot camera.  This camera doesn't fully satisfy my needs and I'm overall a little disappointed.The camera takes great night pictures - I have had great luck at concerts and outdoors with the Night Landscape (more so than the Night Portrait which uses flash). I got some cool pictures of Carlsbad Caverns in NM which are minimally lit. It's also great for taking flashless pictures inside somewhere like an art gallery.  I'm not a photographic expert so I don't know what to call it when the camera enhances photos but it does a great job.I've also played with the Continuous and timer modes to get some amazing full moon pictures.However, issues (for me):- this camera is much bulkier than my Canon. I don't think they are even in the same class so maybe this isn't a fair criticism.  But it doesn't have a flat front profile.  So no putting this camera in the back pocket of tight jeans, which is something I want do often.- lag or hesitation where I try to take a picture quickly but it won't focus and therefore won't take the picture (usually after I just turned it on but sometimes randomly). This has caused me to lose some great shots.- battery must be charged in camera, which means attached to the cord.  WHY?  Why why why do they do this?  I suppose it's to be able to have a USB charger but for me this is really annoying.  For one thing, I like having 2 batteries that I can charge and swap.  And I like not having my camera precariously perched on a hotel window sill whilst charging.- takes pretty crappy pictures in bright sunlight. Once in a while I'll get a winner but more often than not, they look washed out. I've tried tweaking the settings a little bit and choosing various scenes but the pictures just look bad.  I don't want to have to tweak a point-n-shoot.  I want it to take good pictures for me.issue I should have known about:- The screen is amazing but I was so enamored with it that I didn't realize there was no viewfinder.  Consequently, it's very tough to take pictures in the sunlight.  Which I guess is OK because they turn out bad anyway ;-)Finally ... this is probably user-idiocy but I cannot figure out how to view/play images without the lens being engaged.  It's very awkward and I always worry about people touching it when I'm passing the camera around.  Eventually the power settings kick in and the lens retracts, but every other camera I've seen has a PLAY setting that doesn't engage the lens.  What the heck - can anyone give me some help here??I left on a trip after only having the camera for a week and hadn't really road tested it.  So I am stuck with it now.  I do appreciate the night pictures and the 12mp.  And I've played some with the video.  On the cruise I was less worried about packing light and cords and such so I brought both cameras and chose depending on the situation (Nikon at night, Canon on most excursions).  Bottom line is it cannot be my only point-n-shoot camera.  Therefore, it's a loser because carrying 2 cameras around sort of defeats the point of getting this kind of camera in the first place (IMO).  I will continue to use it at inside concerts and such but choose something else for my travel "go-to" camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: HubbieO
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer by any means.  I'm not even a hobbyist.  Heck, I'm barely a beginner even though I've owned lots of cameras (e.g. Minolta SLRs, Minolta compacts, Canon G9, Fuji F50fd).  My wife usually makes fun of my pictures and thinks they're generally pretty terrible.  I didn't think they were very good either.  Then, I bought this before my recent vacation, and I amazed myself (and my wife) with the quality of the pictures.  I have to admit I don't know what I'm doing, but somehow, the camera is smart enough to yield good pictures.Highly recommended!  Get a fast SDHC card though.  Cat 6 or higher.  I had no trouble using Trascend cards even though they're not on the recommended list.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Miller
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon S8100 after much research and review.  The best price was from Amazon!  I took the camera out of the box, charged the battery and started shooting photos right away.  It was so easy and the photos are absolutely fantastic.  I would definitely recommend this camera to new users, as well as those with much more photography experience.  It is compact, the shutter time is fast-- which has always been a problem with other cameras in the past, it is very user friendly, the results are as good as larger cameras used by professional photographers.  The only negative is the placement of the flash but I can definitely deal with that.  Just a small adjustment for a big improvement in point and shoot cameras.  This camera is the best in it's class.  Would I purchase this camera again from Amazon?  Absolutely, I am completely satisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Alternative To My DSLR
Reviews.Author: Auteur
Reviews.Content: I use this camera as an alternative to carrying my DSLR.  It's perfect for this use.  The S8100 is easy to use and the pictures are extraordinary.  The photos taken in low light are fantastic; much better than I would have imaged.  Designing the pop up flash on the left side of the camera you're the user tends to hold the camera, does not quite make sense to me; however, this was not a deal breaker to purchasing this camera.  After a few uses, you'll figure out exactly where you need to place our index finger so it does not infer with the flash.

Reviews.Title: Rating the 8100
Reviews.Author: Fr. Fr. "Will"
Reviews.Content: Delivery was on time as promised. The Nikon Coolpix S8100 has meet all the promises. It does operate in low light, produces pictures with great fidelity.The zoom works very well. Items to consider are: 1) the flash seems to be a problem since I normall locate one finger over the location of the flash. This has necessitated retaking some pictures where the flash was not fully up., 2)the camera is more bulky than I would have liked. Recognizing the features this does not seem to be a great problem. 3)to take low light pictures without flash I have had to use the continuous feature rather that the low light or party setting which both use flash. All in all it does allow low light photos.

Reviews.Title: Smart Camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Covington
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed with this camera.  This is the first Nikon camera I've bought - as I have owned a digital sony and cannon in the past.  But, based on the reviews from consumer reports Nikon was a top camera so I thought I would try it out.  So far, my experiences have been super.  The camera is so smart - is has a "Smile" feature that only when the subjects are smiling will it take!  And, with 3 kids - this is important because I waste a lot of shots.  The camera even recognizes how many people are in the frame by placing a square over each face to focus.....  It is sleek & easy to use.  I'm still trying to figure out the other features because there is so many. So far, it is the most impressive camera I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: redbaron666
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera and I have to say that I was blown away by the image quality. I have had other less expensive 12 megapixel cameras and they were horrible compared to this one. I was a little skeptical at first as to whether or not the video quality was going to be any good at all, but I must say the video quality is way better than anticipated. It's not as good as an actual hi-def camcorder, but for a point and shoot, it is among the best. It has taken excellent photos in both daytime and nighttime shots with authority. I have nothing really bad to say about this camera, except for the fact that it is going to take me some time to get used to the position of the flash. Most cameras have a stationery flash on the front of the body, but this one has a popup flash. I am used to holding the camera with both hands, and when I hold it at the corners, the flash cannot pop up. I will eventually get used to this and it won't happen as often, but this is not a reason to dislike the camera. It is just a nuissance, however, if you manually pop up the flash, this problem can be avoided. I don't know if popping it up manually will damage it or not, so it is up to you to decide.I also recommend getting at least an 8 gigabyte class 10 SDHC memory card. Since this camera is capable of taking 1080p hi-def photos and videos, any lower quality card is a waste of money. Since I have only had the camera for about a week, I don't know the exact length of battery life yet. I will keep using the camera and when I determine how long the battery lasts, I will update my review. I hope this review helps you so far. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have owned!
Reviews.Author: Yuriy N Bovkun
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever had! I had 2 Sony's, a Samsung tl225, and a canon on which I spent hundreds of dollars. But this is by far the best camera I have ever owned. The picture quality is awesome. The response of the camera is best. Batter life is good too. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: best long-zoom camera. fast response to lock focus
Reviews.Author: Tao Zhang
Reviews.Content: I have been using DLSR for a few years. That says how demanding I am on compact camera too. I have been watching this Nikon S8100 for quite a few months because of its sensor technology, nice lens for compact and macro capability. I bought this S8100 for my family and persuaded a friend to buy one too, after I played with one at BestBuy. It is very fast to lock focus. The scene recognition is pretty smart and the flash photo indoor is very decent quality. Not to mention the HD video capability. For this price, you cannot go wrong unless you are looking for smallest camera regardless of performance.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I'm a midrange amateur photographer, upgrading from an earlier Olympus 3mp digital.  The Olympus had nice features (8x optical zoom, manual capabilities and threaded lens barrel).So, why the strong rating for a point and shoot Nikon?1.  It feels good and solid.2.  The main operating features are very intuitive.3.  The mode dial is well thought out; the auto scene select mode is dynamite.  I like that it automatically goes to or from facial reconition to macro, etc.4.  I like having backlit as a mode dial option.5.  Battery life is good.6.  Video operation is straight forward and the finished product is great.Bottom line, this camera captures the image I want captured; every time, in stunning quality.  That's what I wanted and hoped for.  I haven't been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I never really thought that I could get such great quality out of a point and click type camera but this nikon is amazing. The photos are absolutely beautiful and I was completely surprised by the digital zoom on this camera, at full zoom it would take quality pictures like I was in optical zoom. The camera is light and feels good in your hand although the flash pop up is a little getting used to if you have never had a camera like that before. If you are on a budget and do not want to get into a higher end camera then this one will be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: Your Own Little Artist
Reviews.Author: Nucky
Reviews.Content: With the Nikon S8100, you have your own little artist to take anywhere.  The Auto mode on this camera will render excellent shots and the 10x optical zoom will bring everything up, close, and personal.  My brother gave me this camera for Christmas, and I am so grateful to him.I like the placement of the flash on the S8100 because having it elevated reduces red-eye vs. those cameras that have the flash embedded in the mechanism near the lens.  It makes common sense to have the flash elevated in order to alleviate red-eye.My photos are amazing.  I took a photo of the palm tree in my backyard with the 10x optical zoom and it looks 3-D.The start-up is like something from The Green Hornet.The colors are rich and vibrant.If anyone has a complaint about this camera, save that complaint for a camera that someone paid $2,000 because there will be flaws in that camera, too.  No camera is perfect.  There will always be those who look hard enough to find a flaw.  Who cares if Aunt Ida's dress comes out too orange in a photo?  That's nit-picking.And who wants to change a lens on a camera for a close-up?  You will miss out on an important photo with having to change a lens.  With the Nikon S8100, you have the means at your disposal to get that prized photo at any time.The Nikon S8100 will make you happy.  There are too many cameras out on the market that have too many complicated settings and you will be filled with worry because you don't know how to properly use them.  Don't  worry....be happy!  Get this camera and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: S8100 is a winner!!!
Reviews.Author: beach lover
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife, its really the first "better" camera we have owned. I decided to spend the money for a good one and this seems to be it.1. The camera operates very easy, if you have used a digital camera in the past this should be no different.2. It comes with its own rechargeable battery!!  Thats a plus in my book.3. The pictures we have taken so far are so crisp and clear it will blow you away.4. The face recognition system works really well, how did they get it to do that?5. The self timer and smile timer are great when you want a family shot without having to ask people to take your picture.6. The 1080p HD video is records is unbelievable, then plug the camera right into the TV via HDMI and watch video or view pictures.7. There are alot, I mean alot of variables you can do with this camera, but if all your interested in is point and shoot then it does that very well as thats all my wife is interested in. On the other hand I can make it do more complex things.8. The camera seems pretty well built, this is our first nikon, we have always had milnota or kodak in the past...as of now I'll never go back.I thought this camera was very well priced also. The picture quality is amazing!I hope they pay Ashton Kutcher alot for his advertising because thats what lead me to this camera.EDIT: 1-13-2011We took our camera to the colts/jets playoff game and got some great video before the game and some great pictures. The zoom on this is really good, even from the 20 yd line I was able to snap close up pics of the colts on the opposite end of the field. Color is great. Also I noticed no zoom motor noise while watching the video. We also took some shots outside after dark and this camera really excels at night. We have always had trouble getting good shots of the kids during school programs due to poor lighting, I dont think that will be the problem anymore after using this camera at night.

Reviews.Title: A Simple Review For The Simple User
Reviews.Author: Krewchips
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2 months now.  I can tell you it is by far the best point and shoot camera I have ever owned or seen.  This is including the cameras my friends have.  All I wanted out of my camera was that it took incredibly clear pictures at day or night with a good zoom.  This camera does just that.  The one thing that impressed me the most was how powerful the flash is. I took a couple of pictures in a pitch black room and they came out just perfect.Not only are the pictures great, but so are the videos.  They definitely do come out in HD quality.  The camera is heavy, but it has that feeling of being heavy for the right reasons.  The one thing I am still getting used to, is to hold it sideways since the flash pops up right where I was used to holding the camera.I read all the reviews on here and there are alot of nitpicky buyers.  Every products will have its small flaws, I am sure this camera has them, but they haven't been any that I had to deal with. Coming from an average user,in other words an average joe, I can tell you this is a great buy. Actually, there is one thing that I wasn't very happy about but its not a big deal, you have to charge the battery inside the camera.  I dont like that since during the charge, you run the risk of leaving the camera unattended and something happening to it.  I would much rather have a charger where I can plug in the battery.All in all, this is a great camera.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.  As a matter of fact, my brother was so impressed with the camera that he is also buying it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for great price!
Reviews.Author: Seymour L. Gordon
Reviews.Content: Even though I've bought camera as gift to other persons, this is my first camera that I decided to get for myself. After doing extensive research for a camera between $100 to $200 price range, it didn't take long before all could see it's this camera which fell a little over my range. After reading all the specs I was a bit skeptical of all the awesome features especially low light pics and HD video, but all my doubts was thrown away as soon as i started to play with this camera. It was awesome; other people even shove away their camera when they see the picture and camera quality.When it comes to cons, video maximum zoom can be a bit out of focus and I would advise to buy a camera case from Amazon as well as most stores won't have a case that can fit the camera.All in all: An excellent buy which will take great quality picture at even maximum zoom for any occasion. Video quality is great as well, but you may want to avoid maximum zoom.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ahmet Cetintas "Ahmet Cetintas"
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a compact digital camera for a long time. I am using DSLR but sometimes I really need a small and talented compact camera. I compare the Canon and sony cameras with S8100 and I can say that this is a clean win for Nikon. It has a good optic, nice 10x zoom, very sharp and detailed LCD, VR, wide angle lens and a perfect look. Also it has a very quality and good looking finish.I highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Dean & Jenny
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on cameras before purchasing this one. I wanted a DSLR, but didn't have the money for one. We just had a baby and wanted a good camera to capture memories, and we made the right choice! This takes amazing quality photos on auto mode, has lots of settings! The pop up flash hasn't been a problem for me, but I can see how it would irritate some people. The only thing is when we ask other people to take pictures of our family for us, the pop up flash can be hard if people don't know about it/aren't used to it. But otherwise, this camera is great! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Cumulus
Reviews.Content: Great camera, good price.  Very easy to use, features are intuitive, menus are simple but give you a lot of options if you want to get creative.  It takes excellent point & shoot pictures just using all the defaults (it seems to be smarter than I am).  We used it for my Mom's Christmas card photo and they turned out really nice.  Good color & contrast, even with piles of snow.  I also used it for night portraits and they turned out fine, too.  Only complaint is the weird little flash that pops up under your fingers, but that's not a big deal once it's open.  It seemed to recharge quickly using an electrical outlet but took a couple hours using the USB plugged into a laptop.  It's also easy to download photos - software was easy to install and easy to use.... again intuitive.I'm happy and I'd get it again!*******As an update nine months later... a friend got this same camera (from Best Buy) and it quit working properly within about a month.  The internal memory seems to be defective which makes it go wacky.  Mine is still fine and I've taken thousands of photos and some video.  I put in the extra memory chip, tho.

Reviews.Title: S8100
Reviews.Author: JTY
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Walmart because I was in need of it for Christmas and was out of town.  I bought this camera to replace my Sony Cybershot, which had a battery error (I did not know that it was common in Sonys) after only 2 years.I love the zoom and the pictures are very clear.  Excellent features for touch ups right in the camera and cropping.  It contains a quick start-up paper guide and a pdf CD book, which is easy to follow.  I have not tried the included photo CD yet.  I took pictures riding in the car and were clear many times.  This camera is very fast, too.  I have not tried the video mode yet.  It also has date stamp available.It does not have a battery meter until about 20-30 pictures are left on the battery.  The battery takes a long time to charge, but I used the camera right out of the box for the 30 pictures.It may be difficult for someone to use with larger hand because the silver bottom is both a wheel and contains click-able corners.  I do not have issues with my small hands at all.The screen is very large and pictures can be zoomed in on the camera.I would recommend trying features before going to an important event.  I was surprised that my lit tree in otherwise darkness was best on auto, but if a person is included Portrait is better to prevent overexposure.The box contains computer cord, charger, and TV cords.The camera is medium in size and is a bit large for many cases, but I recommend a solid one.I recommend this camera for anyone who enjoys taking picture and would like many features and scenes.  This is a bit pricey, but I think it exceeds all other cameras in class and next lowest class.  Someone should probably be comfortable with changing features.

Reviews.Title: s8100
Reviews.Author: Emily "Emily"
Reviews.Content: It was well worth the wait for my red camera. The pictures are coming out very nice. I love the micro zoom which allows me to take excellent detailed pictures of flowers and any small item. It is actually very light and came with a nice leather case. The flash comes up automatically but needs to be manually pressed down to be closed. I saw some reviews where this camera did not need a flash at all in dark environments. In my case, flash comes up whenever there is not enough light unless I turn it off. User manual is not printed, it is on a cd which is a bit of an inconvenience but saves trees :). Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Really Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Camera is pretty much as advertised.  Takes great pics, starts up quickly, easy to take stills or movies. A few problems; it eats batteries and shuts off without warning, having to charge the battery while in the camera is inconvenient, focus blurs sometimes when taking movies. Bought it for my daughter to take pics and movies of the grand kids. She has already taken some great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best compact I have seen on the markte
Reviews.Author: David M "freecain"
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing compact cameras prior to settling on this one.For a long time I've wanted to take the plunge, and get a DSLR, but between suddenly having to buy a new car, then a new computer, gas prices sky rocketing, and now a surprise trip to Switzerland coming up, the budget has been stretched too thin to drop 500+ bucks on a new camera. (maybe in a few years?)So, I wanted a camera that could deal with low light, shoot fast, start up fast, shoot again fast, and be around 200 bucks. This was the only camera I played with that met the criteria. And the more I play with it, the better it gets.First thing you'll notice - this camera can deal with low-light like no other compact camera. Sure, a DSLR (who's lens would cost more than this camera!) will do a better job... but I managed to get a clear picture at night with no light except for that from a tv on the opposite side of a large room. You can get crisp, beautiful pictures in low lit restaurants without flash (provided little movements on your subjects part) free hand!The fast shooting takes some getting used to. Read the manual, you'll learn a bit about the options (still have to figure what the 16 panel speed shot mode is about). The have some great options that allow you to shoot 1mp at 120 fps, or 12mp at a decent rate. There is even the (very useful) option of a slower continuous shot mode. Great for getting a quick series shot, instead of a burst of shots (good for getting a single shot of a quick moment).The start up time on this is amazing.
