You can have it up, running and zoomed in all the way in just about a second. Shooting won't take much more time. Recylce time for most modes is a bit slow, but if you leave your camera on continuous mode, you can get that second shot off almost instantly, provided you don't need the flash.The flash is the downside to this camera. At times its a bit bright (so you really have to play with settings). The location makes for awkward shooting (its right where everyone would hold the camera). However, having it raised, and over the lens does reduce red eye. And, if you don't want the flash on (I avoid using it on this camera), holding your finger over the flash means you'll never be surprised by the flash going off unintentionally.The other downside is the video: It does take good video quality, but the mic picks up the zoom and auto focus. If there is a lot of ambient noise, and you're careful about this, you won't notice. They also slowed the zoom speed down (to reduce noise?)... but I would rather have it be noisy and fast, just to have access. You can just not zoom, and lock the AF to fix this problem. Also, the set up for switching between high speed etc is not really intuitive, I'm still working on playing with that.Awesome lay out of buttons: record for video is a hard button that can be used in any mode. You can also shoot stills while recording. I don't know why the nav keys can both spin and be pressed.. I actually find it annoying, but got used to it quickly (now I just don't spin it all). Everything else is pretty standard.The lens protrudes a little, so this 'compact camera' is a bit bulkier (the lens also adds a bit of weight) than its peers, but for 10x zoom and the quality of pictures its a fair trade off.So, over all, best compact camera I've seen ... ever. For this price, I cannot complain. Sure, it has a few things that could be better (more control over continuous burst speed, slow down the shot speed on the 16 shot mode, better video setting controls, maybe put the flash 1/4 of an inch to over) but if they fixed all that, it would probably sell for 400 bucks.... and I'd be tempted to pay that much!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S8100 camera
Reviews.Author: Hamid M. Montazer "Ebay shopper"
Reviews.Content: This is a versitle camera and you can adjust the setting to take what ever kind of pictures you want. Drawbacks are as follows1- The HD movie you take its only good for downloading to PC and can only be watched in low definitation with direct cble to TV (no HDMI or component cable included). The only way to see your movie in High definition is to burn it into a Blueray DVD (expensive option).2- Lighting is not automatically set and after you take the picture you will find out if the brightness needs to be adjusted.3- Battery is charged through USB cable and if you get spare battery it requires swapping back and forth (Battery life is not good either)I am thinking of returning this camera eventhough I like Coolpix over Sony or Cannon but I think there are set backs on this one.

Reviews.Title: Broken cameras from 17th Street Photo
Reviews.Author: Jodina Simmons
Reviews.Content: This company sent me a broken camera and then would not take it back.  It was a $300 camera that I have never been able to use.  Unreal.  When I contacted them they would not do anything about it.  The camera does not focus even on auto.  It's supposed to be a point and shoot camera and at $300 bucks you expect this to be a decent camera.  I would never order from 17th Street Photo again.  Watch out as they don't do the right thing.

Reviews.Title: Random errors
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were very happy about buying this camera after doing our research. We purchased it at our local retailer and had a good experience with it. That is, until it started saying "Mode dial is not in the proper position." I'm not sure what this error means, but we couldn't use the camera. Of course this happened right after the warranty expired, and Nikon's website said they could fix it for a price. For $300 you'd think that the camera would last longer. Poor experience overall.

Reviews.Title: Best point-and-shoot ever!
Reviews.Author: TaraPaypir
Reviews.Content: I had never seen a point-and-shoot that took such clear, quality pictures until I found this one. I bought one several years ago, and liked it so much I just got another one to replace it. I used to carry around a DSLR, until I fell in love with this smaller camera. The video quality surprised me, too, with clear image and life-like sound. I've even used some video footage from this camera in several of my video productions. As a former photography studio owner, I can recommend this with confidence. Well done, Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Decent Images, EZ 2 Carry but 2 Negatives
Reviews.Author: T. Irwin "Tom Orange County CA"
Reviews.Content: Overall the S8100 is an easy to carry, do everything camera.  It captures images from wide angle to super-zoom (35mm equivalent of about 18mm-300mm).  It also captures very good video with stereo sound at 1080p.  It even does 60 fps @ 16x9 for slow motion playback and will shoot up to 240 fps and as slow as 15 fps for fast motion.  It comes with a belt-loop case and travels well. It's maximum f/3.5 aperture and small sensor limit low light performance but the pop-up flash makes up the difference.  Some of the Scene Modes offer shutter drag with flash to capture ambient light but you'll need a very steady hand or tripod to avoid blurring.Compared to a crop sensor DSLR its images lack color depth, richness and detail but for a carry-around camera it does a good job.Now for the negatives:1- A significant number of these cameras freeze with "LENS ERROR" messages rendering the cameras dead.  Despite the warranty Nikon is quick to tell the owner that the issue is user error and will try to charge you one hundred dollars for repair.  My first two S8100's died in this manner but were exchanged by the big-box superstore.  My third S8100 has been working for over two years.2- ORANGE- That is the omnipresent tint that affects all of its photos.  It does keep Anglo faces from looking overly pasty by emphasizing orange to warm them up.  Unfortunately it's not a Kodachrome warmth but a carrot-juice look that pervades all images.  The camera can not reproduce a strong red.  Everything is shifted to orange.  My less expensive Nikon L22 Point & Shoot produces much bolder reds and yellows.My primary camera is a Nikon D7000 DSLR with good to pro lenses that gets everything right.  Post processing in Lightroom 5 provides the color control to dial back the orange for more accurate color balance.  Control is limited, however, because the camera does not offer RAW image capture.Bottom line- Better than my HTC1 cell phone, excellent video, great zoom range and easy to carry but suffers from an orange cast on all images requiring correction in post processing.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: WC Williams "WCW"
Reviews.Content: The flash has to pop up to work, and half the time your finger will be on top of the flash to take pictures.  The flash is too bright, and the pictures are too blurry.  The camera is incredibly slow, and you miss half the shots you want to take.  Unfortunately, I'm spending money already to buy a different camera, less than a year from buying this one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon doesn't stand behind their warranty!
Reviews.Author: Joseph J Toner Jr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in December of 2010 along with Nikon's extended warranty and only sporatically used it until just recently. About a year ago I did notice that some of the pictures that I took were out of focus. Not being a complainer, I found that if I turned the camera off and then back on again the problem would clear up. About 3 months ago  the camera began over-exposing pictures on the automatic setting.. I'd take a picture and it would be totally over-exposed. I'd wait. Change nothing. Take another picture and it would be ok...This began to occur more frequently so I sent Nikon an email. They responded and told me to reset it back to the original factory settings. I did but the problem wasn't corrected. Just within the past 2 weeks I went to a concert and really used the zoom feature a lot.. After continued use it beagn to make a funny noise. (Please keep in mind that up to this point I hardly ever used this camera). The next day after the concert, I recharged the camera and turned it on and got a lens error message. The lens wouldn't extend. I came to the conclusion that the motor that operates the lens must have burnt out so I notified Nikon. My extended warranty was still good so I shipped the camera off to Nikon. In a few days they sent me back an email stating that the camera had back and front end damage and that it therefore wasn't covered under their warranty. Now I never dropped the camera. It was still working when I left the concert (I'm 65 and I am very responsible). I had to stop taking pictures because the battery needed to be recharged. I wouldn't buy another Nikon because of the above issues and if you decide to do so I recommend that you buy the other extended warranty(Square Trade) offered here which isn't through Nikon. I might add in closing that i have never sent in a review before to Amazon, however i felt that in this case I needed to alert others regarding Nikon. I might add that to replace this camera I purchased a Canon ELPH 110 and also an Olympus VR-340 for my wife! Good luck and happy picture taking. Let the buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: I've had it for a year...
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: I've had a heck of a time with this camera.  I got it a little over a year ago, and I should have returned it from the get-go.  I mostly use it for going out with friends and in casual settings (the occasional nature shot).  Here's my experience with it for the past year:The bad:-about 1/10 pictures in lower light areas would come out COMPLETELY whitewashed, no matter the setting I used-it was really difficult to focus it on up close things-it took forever to focus-I'm now getting lens error readings (and, like I said, I've had it for only a year)-it randomly deleted my graduation photos.  I was able to get them back by downloading a program on my computer and reading the card separately from my camera, but my god that sucked.-The pop-up flash was really inconvenient...telling people over and over again to "watch your finger because the flash pops up" got really old.  It's RIGHT where your finger goes for how you would naturally hold a camera-It's really heavy for a camera, so it's difficult to just throw it in a clutch or carry it around-It's oddly shaped, and I was never able to find a camera case for itThe good:-When you do manage to get a good shot, it's a REALLY good shot-It's great outdoors-The zoom is amazingOverall, I would not recommend this camera.  I'm about to resell mine and get a cute, cheap point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: DemocracyV3
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 6 months ago to have something more portable then my D-SLR, and it has went beyond my expectations for a point and shoot camera. This camera has survived 6 months in the harsh desert environment of Afghanistan, even survived getting blown up without any problems.The reason I gave it 4 stars is night shooting isn't what I would like it to be, the camera case sometimes opens up on the top, and the battery is very poor even more so if for any reason you use the flash I highly recommend getting a backup battery for it.A side note for the camera it does not work with SDXC cards, I tried my 64GB card and it would not register it, but a 16GB card works great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, however...
Reviews.Author: M. A. Rangel
Reviews.Content: As a photographer, I wanted to purchase a small point and shoot, instead of hauling my large slr around. I bought this Nikon model because I loved its low-light feature that produced great quality. If I may say it was AWESOME in low light!!! Macro shots were also amazing. The downside was that I felt the recycling time to take picture after picture was really really slow!!! I understand the flash needs to charge but I would miss a lot in those 5 secs. or so while it was finally ready to take another picture. So that part was a disappointment, also the white balance is really strange on this camera. It's either really blue or yellow, which translates onto the subjects skin..if that makes sense. The color is horrible. You can manually adjust it but it still looks gross. I might be pickier than the average shopper but that's because I love shopping for cameras and I know a great camera when I see one. Other than the bad white balance and recycling time between shots, this camera is really really great. If you hate flash like I do, this camera will blow you away with the images it produces in low light situations.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Stan Matofu
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. S8100 takes great or good enough photos. I've compared S8100 photos to other small sensor cameras, and I couldn't  find any other camera with noticeably better image and similar camera size. Of course, there are better image quality cameras with large sensors and large non-collapsible lenses, but they are significantly larger, heavier, and more expensive.2. Small. you can easily fit it in your pocket.3. Value for the money.Cons:1. Flash. You have to get used to its location. I would prefer to have some kind of manual/physical switch to turn the flash on or off.

Reviews.Title: nikon s8100
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love this camera so far!!i got it for christmas yesterday so i havent had the time to figure it out compltly yet but it takes absolutly amazong phots! It has a wonderful zoom i got pictures of horses that were miles away and yet on the camera it looks less than a mile away=] it has a great focus and it is FAST!!! my boyfriend hates pictures being taken of him but if my camera is on and i say " hey hun!" he will look and beforehe can turn away i have a good picture of him=]I will udate my review in like a month if i decide i hate it or something but so far i absolutly love this camera.it is rather annoying having to get used to the pop up flash but let me tell ya! it is soo worth the getting used to=] i saw a lot of reviews where the flash drowns out people but christmas morning my dad was practising useing it and took a pic of us and it turned out very clear. then i went to my boyfriends and it was kind of dim in the house and we zoomed in on wrapping paper, you could barely see it on the screen until we took the picture and you could see it perfectly=]i just love this camera and would never trade it in for anything!!=]

Reviews.Title: Best compact ever
Reviews.Author: M. Hartlein
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty incredible for the size.  The zoom is about the same as my DSLR camera and it fits in my pocket.  The S8100 is also very fast for a compact camera.  Good for taking pictures of children and pets.  The screen on the back is nice and bright and good image quality.  I can't say enough for the HD video it takes.  I went to a U2 concert and was able to zoom in on the stage and had an awesome video when I got back home.  Another cool thing is you can play it back on the TV with a HDMI cord in 1080p.  My friends with other compacts were so jealous of the pictures and video I had compared to there pictures in the same row.Con: Flash location is not ideal.  But after using for a couple months it is not a big deal anymore.

Reviews.Title: Keep the camera! Throw away the magnetic case!
Reviews.Author: David J. Geiger "BlessedRmeek"
Reviews.Content: I wanna go shoot something. With the camera that is. I have had it about 40 days and am still in love with it.  It feels great in my XL hands. The finish feels like it is rubberized or something. There is a thumb grip in the upper right hand corner to help not drop it. Dropping cameras is bad. That is why the instructions tell you to PUT THE STRAP ON YOUR CAMERA. IT'S FREE. DROPPING YOUR AXE IS NOT FREE!  (It came with a free small camera case in the package. BUT, it has a magnetic clasp. I NEVER allow magnets to come anywhere near my digital electronic gear.I suggest you do not either. My son was playing with a magnet and tried to stick it on the front of our Jenn Air stove. It erased the code in the circuitboard causing a $250 repair.)  Of course I love the 1080 video shooting, but it eats up alot of memory, so you will need a SDHC card or two. I'm using a 16GB Class 10 card.and I don't shoot much video.Besides, 720p video is plenty of resolution for me. 12 mp pictures will not fill up alot of space compared to 1080 video, so if you don't shoot video, the 4 GB card that came with it should be sufficient. In VIDEO mode the ZOOM is very gentle, like at 1/4 regular speed.The motor noise is hardly noticable. Some people want to complain about the noise. Hey Guys, The thing has a MOTOR that works the zoom.It isnt that loud. It makes you look like a PRO Videographer.  This camera does great with the flash off of grabbing the image better and with more detail than you can see with your eyes. I haven't done many people shots with flash yet , so I cannot comment of reports of the flash washing out subjects.If it washes out, Move Back,and Zoom In a little to Compensate.Photography has always been about compensating and adjusting. I have determined that if you use this camera in flash mode, you have to remember to open the flash before you shoot by depressing the shutter halfway, WHICH YOU SHOULD DO ANYWAY TO SET THE FOCUS. Once the flash is open, it's easy to remember where not to place your finger and cover the flash.Sometimes it is slow to focus in real dark scenes.If it cant focus it flashes a red parentheses around the subject and doesnt shoot.When it figures out the range the parentheses turns green.  The zoom is great, and the auto focus works better than any point and shoot that I've seen.  I love the great, awesome 3 inch 921,000 dot high resolution screen. So detailed as you review your work, I can even see how good my pictures are without having to use my laptop.BEFORE I removed the protective film on the screen, I used some Xylol with a Q tip to rub the lettering off, and left the film on. It didn't hurt anything, and left the protective film on the screen,quite invisible.  I was able to drag the manual off the CD ROM into a new file on my desktop, so I don't have to use the CD to read it. It wasn't hard to do, even for a non-techie.  The VIDEO EDITING  software that comes with it is very good.  Battery life seems to be very good as I have been using it. I bought an external charger with two batteries off EBAY for $10. so I can charge a battery without it being in the camera, which seems to be an issue with some users.I read some negative reviews about the service dept. and am optimistic that I won't be one that has to go that route.  Bottom line is I AM VERY HAPPY with this camera.The only thing I don't like is the case with the magnetic clasp. THROW THE CASE AWAY. PROTECT YOUR CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Only OK. Would shell out a few more dollars for better camera in hindsight
Reviews.Author: Spence
Reviews.Content: This camera is OK. Yes it is conveniently compact and has a high zoom lens - both features I love. But the focusing and light capture is just not what I would have hoped. In fact I believe this camera takes better pictures at night, with flash, than it does in full daylight. If you are not as concerned with capturing scenery this camera is good. In short, I would have gotten something like the Panasonic Lumix, which takes great pictures, over this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great in low light
Reviews.Author: Patty B. "Patty B."
Reviews.Content: I primarily bought this in order to take product photos in low-light settings. I was not disappointed! Love the fact that you can edit your photos in the camera even before dumping them onto your computer. Definite keeper.

Reviews.Title: Only worked for 6 months
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Runyon
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to purchase a "high-end" consumer class camera to take photos of my new daughter and all of her actions, but was dissapointed that this camera only lasted 6 months. After 6 months of light to medium use, the flash stopped firing and the focus mechanism stopped working almost completely. This resulted in such a drastic reduction in photo quality (from "thrilled" to "nigh-unusable") that I shelved it, and started using my 6 year old basic Casio point and shoot (which took decent quality pictures, and much, much better photos than after the flash/focus problems).I had heard only good things about Canon, and nearly all of my family members use them, but wanted to try a Nikon, for whatever reason. I was not thrilled with my investment, in that 6 months after my purchase, all of my family members are still taking beautiful photos with their cameras and I'm spending another Black Friday weekend looking for a good camera deal.I've sent the camera into Nikon for repair as a last effort, but the opinions that I've heard in person and online don't bode well for the camera being fixed for a reasonable amount of money (despite falling within the 1 year manufacturer warranty). I will update this review if it is found otherwise.I won't be buying another Nikon anytime soon, and will likely join the Canon bandwagon. I can't afford to spend $200+ on a camera that takes great photos for only 6 months.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: necksis1
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It takes low-light pictures very well. It turns on fast, and takes pictures fast; though i wish it had an infinity focus option. I also wish it had an exposure time setting like Kodak cameras. Regardless of which, it still takes pictures with really good quality even in low light. The pop-up flash is very cool and fancy. The video recording is great with great sound. I like the ability to zoom in while recording, I just wish it would have better focus while zooming, but I won't complain too much on that. I also wish there was an infinity focus option for video recording. The zoom is amazing on this camera. I can see things I can't even see with my own eyes. The slow motion feature is also very cool. It slows down what you've captured but you don't lose any frames per second on the video you watch. It looks just like a normal recording, but slowed down. The camera is a little thick though, but I'm sure that was necessary to incorporate the 10x zoom. The screen is also very clear. I call this a semi-professional camera, because it seems like it is between a point-and-shoot and an SLR. Overall, this is a great camera, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Love the Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Raffin
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S8100 has more features than I need. But being well within my price range, I couldn't resist buying it. It's everything it promises. Very thin and light. Great telescoping lense, big viewing screen, compensates beautifully for movement and has easy to understand settings. I love how easily I can switch from stills to movie mode. Be aware it does NOT come with a removeable memory card. Though the internal memory did allow me to take 22 pictures and a 15 second video before running out of space, so there's plenty of room to try it out before investing in a memory card. As with any small camera, holding it without interfering with flash etc. takes a little practice for those of us used to larger cameras. But the grip bars on the front of this model help. A buying tip: If you are attracted to the latest, greatest model in a line of cameras but it's beyond the budget or has more features than you know you need, check out earlier versions of that model. Not only will the price be better, but you might find the earlier model still has all the features you want. Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Spend three times the price and maybe it might be better. Maybe
Reviews.Author: dikw
Reviews.Content: Nikon S8100This camera is a pleasure to review and I can't say enough to describe what a superb instrument it is to use.  As kind of a hobby, and to get out of the house for a little exercise for my 78 year old frame, I go to a number of stores to shop on a daily basis, mostly 7 days per week.  This explains why I can say I traveled to at least 15 stores over several months to demonstrate, test and fondle, easily, 50 cameras.  I narrowed the choices between the following; Olympus VR2, Sony''', Samsung""", Nikon S8100, Cannon'''. (And that was the narrowed part)The Olympus had all the right specs...great very wide and long angle telephoto lens....it didn't feel particularly sturdy, the screen images were not crisp as I thought they should be, too many negative write-ups by people that were expert in the field (which I am not). Good price....came close on this one.  Sony had great (most important to me) wide angle lens, good telephoto and the very great sweep panorama feature, pretty good screen images, BUT I was astounded how cheap and toy-like the unit felt to me in my hand......maybe because it is all plastic......anyway, I could not get passed it.  I thought not having the great very wide angle lens and the sweep panorama was ending my photography career.. I was wrong.  I liked the Samsung touch screen a lot but I have been hearing about far too many problems with touch screen camera so this one went down the tube after a short short.  The Cannon was OK but lacked some of the items of interest...so I passed on it...Then came the S8100 Nikon ; Built like a brick, ...it appears it would survive a truck driving over it.....all metal, but light enough and sized right to slip into a shirt pocket. You will know it is there, but it is not bothersome. Attractive and nicely finished, plus the weight and heft in general is perfect for me as it lets me know I have something in my hand that I can control.  The lens and screen are clear as a bell, the telescopic movement is swift, the video is marvelously simple to start and stop, viewing the video is clear and the sound is super.....The panorama assist is great and provides a better scene than the sweep panoramas I tested.....the panorama photos are flawlessly stitched and consistent due in part to the Panorama 5 software that comes with the camera.....Low light shots were surprisingly clear and sharp as well.........Some of the picky reviews I read tells me these guys are clueless operators or have a malfunctioning unit (It happens to the best)I admit it took me some head-scratching to understand both of the photo programs that arrived in the camera box for loading into the computer.....I got it now though........I was also perplexed at the menu manipulation and understanding what the camera was telling me it could do.....once the light went off in the brain it became a very simple task; however; I did think that all was lost the first time around...Now as I operate everything I can't understand what it was that was so complicated for me.....I printed out the online manual which yielded 204 pages....this should give you an idea of the capabilities of the camera....The manual is excellent and well constructed.....SO in the end, would I buy again?....Absolutely.  My mechanically deficient wife is using it so much that I believe I will have to get another for myself...hard to go wrong with this machine......I hope this long winded review was of some help.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: G. Myers
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a refurbished item at a really good price. Am totally happy with it. Was just out in Colorado for 2 weeks and took lots of pictures. They all came out superb. Easy to set up and use. Very portable.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of NIKON. I bought Coolpix 6400 several years ago. So S8100 doesn't make me disappointed. Less professional than 6400 but definately higher than general camera, plus it improves the speed of focus which really annoyed me at earlier camera. It's  commerical price is 299, but really great deal in Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for filming HD Video
Reviews.Author: Spore
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a camera for filming video because camcorders are too bulky and I prefer the low-profile style of a camera. I rarely take pictures at all, I only wanted it for video.Man, this thing takes some really nice video! The 1080p video is really crisp and clear and looks fantastic. The microphone is also very nice and the wind-reduction feature actually works!I did not have the autofocus issue that many people are talking about. This thing autofocuses really fast and there is no problem with it.Battery life is great, easily lasts 2 or more hours filming HD video.Pictures come out great too but that isn't really important to me. Flash is nice and you can even change the hue, brightness, and vividness while taking a photo.Overall I really love this camera!

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Lizzy
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but I have a problem with the location of the flash. When you hold the camera to take pictures you have no comfortable place to hold it because you always want to put your finger at the top to have a good grip and you find yourselfholding the flash down.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace our three year old one . Very nice and compact with the easy of use for features but almost all picture were blurry when used on stand or taken by camera in hand.  We bought the same brand and one of a lesser model and all was very good must have just have been this one camera out of the bunch .

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!!
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything we expected it to be plus plus!!  You can't miss a shot even if you are on a moving train and targeting a running moose!!  We just returned from Alaska and took over 1,000 pictures in two weeks with this camera, many of which would have been impossible with another camera.  Great product at a great price!!

Reviews.Title: Seems like a great camera after six months
Reviews.Author: Privacy "Privacy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Canon Sureshot with 5X zoom, which I dropped.  I really liked the idea of 10X, and now that I have it, it's really fun and useful.  Other features I like about this camera: really sharp image quality; fast shooting; a square shape so that when you leave it on a table for a timer shot, it stays in place; rechargable battery rather than ones you have to buy each time; reasonably compact given the zoom capability.  There were some reviews that expressed concern about battery life -- I have used this for a whole day, with over 100 shots, and had no problem.  I do miss the viewfinder, but I guess you can't have everything in such a small package. I think I've become a Nikon person -- as long as this holds up for another couple years.

Reviews.Title: Nikon compact camera
Reviews.Author: Bee
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and takes high quality photos.  The photo editing software that is included with it is also outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: mannyandlily
Reviews.Content: This Nikon s8100 was a replacement for an old pocket camera and we are very pleased with it. Great HD videos and zoom photos. The only minor drawback is the flash pops up from the top left side of the camera where I tend to place my left index finger, which has prevented the flash from fully deploying. Still, a great camera at a great price. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Cool pix camera
Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera small will fit in my pocket. It takes great pictures. My last camera had the switch for videos in bad place was always taking videos when I just wanted to take pictures. This camera the video is in a much better place.it is a greatpoint and shoot camera.amazon was fast in sending it pronto.

Reviews.Title: Fast startup and focus
Reviews.Author: William Mark "Bald One"
Reviews.Content: Great camera if you want something with a lot of the features of a more expensive camera but want to keep the size of a pocket. Fast startup.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera! It is fast and has an amazing zoom. I got some great shots of my daughter jumping off a rock at the beach and I actual caught it while she was in the air! I have never spent more than $150 on a camera so this is pretty special and I would say, its worth the money.Kate

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: frannyv
Reviews.Content: I spent a considerable amount of time looking for a camera that I needed for a special use.  After going to 4 stores, comparing cameras and prices, I decided to go on Amazon.  The price was much lower than the retail stores.  More importantly, the camera suits my needs perfectly, takes great pictures. The flash works beautifully, the red eye feature is good, the pictures are very sharp and clear.  I received my Nikon quickly, well packaged and exactly as advertised. Very satisfied with the camera and the transaction with Amazon!

Reviews.Title: A lot of Goodies in a small box
Reviews.Author: M. Woodend "woody"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take on vacation to the UK, I have a Nikon Digital SLR with various lenses which can be a bit cumbersome for vacations. I can only say that the results with the Coolpix was fantastic. May leave the SLR at home more often now

Reviews.Title: Finally! After buying and returning 7 cameras, this is IT!
Reviews.Author: quadmaster "quadmaster"
Reviews.Content: My wife is so picky I've been through 7 cameras, from a large DSLR (too complicated and sometimes slow), to superzooms (still too bulky and slow) to ultracompacts (bad low light photo quality). This is the one we're KEEPING! Great photo and video quality, great response time, and great low light photos! And the picture quality is pristine. Just buy it!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: Pree S
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures. I bought this prior to a trip to the Amazon and the quality of the pictures are great for a mega-zoom. The best feature is that I never have a blurry picture even if I am moving! It takes 3 pictures every time you hit the shot button so then it blends it to create a great picture. Also the skin softening feature makes you look great in every pic! The flash is in the way but you get used to it fast! The panoramic software that comes with this camera is really cool. It stiches the photos perfectly. Overall I am very pleased with this megazoom especially after I swore that I only like Canons!

Reviews.Title: Love It !
Reviews.Author: Mad4Mod
Reviews.Content: I am an "average Joe" looking for a camera that takes decent photos on vacation, family parites and what not-  this is the 4th camera I've tried in the last 2 years.  I've had it for a few days, and so far I'm satisfied with the quality of the photos. I previously had a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W370 (14.1 mega pixels) and hate it, played around with it for six months and never did get a decent photo with it.  I've had the Nikon Coolpix S8100 for 2 days and I'm happy with the quality- I think it's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: what an improvement
Reviews.Author: Woody Carver "glk"
Reviews.Content: A fantastic camera.  Large viewing window is so much better than the one on my old Nikon.--Picture quality is multiple times better than my old Nikon.--Flash pictures have less glare than on my old Nikon and remain very clear.--Size of the camera is large enough to make it easy to handle the camera.--Attaching to my computer is easy.--I am an iMac user and find the photo software to be very nice in its presentation but a bit strange to manage photos compared to the iPhoto software.  But once I get used to it I may like it better.  Doesn't seem to be much there in the form of photo editing but could be wrong...I need to find the documentation and read up on it.--I don't use the camera for video so can't comment on that feature.--So much better overall than my old Nikon that broke.  The battery latch on the old one broke under the intense pressure from the battery, I guess.--Battery insertion is so much better and none of the difficulty getting the battery cover slid back in...no pressure from the battery at all.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera!
Reviews.Author: FlyBoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very pleased with this compact camera. It takes excellent photos, easy to use, great zoom, and fast. It compliments my Nikon D5000 nicely. Exactly what we were looking for in a reasonably priced high quality compact camera.FlyBoy Seal of Approval

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: Cali girl
Reviews.Content: What a great compact camera!  Im very happy with this purchase. I bought a kodak camera which I returned because it was terrible and this nikon has been a wonderful replacement. Read all the reviews on cnet and it's definitely recommended. It takes great pictures in low light areas and has a stabilization mobilizer.

I researched a ton of cameras and read reviews and here it is:TWO WORST THINGS ABOUT IT:1. If you keep the movie focus mode on AF-S you won't hear a clicking noise in the video, but it also won't auto focus as it should once you get to a certain close distance and beyond. You HAVE to put it on AF-continous to get the auto focus movie feature, but there is a terrible clicking noise that is also continuous while it finds focus all the way though your footage. At first I hoped that I was only hearing it from outside the camera and that it wouldn't pick up on the actual video...WRONG! It's worse on the video than just hearing it while you shoot! I don't just mean that it's a little quite click every now and then...I mean a clicking that you absolutely can't ignore and is totally audible in your footage. THIS IS WHY I SENT IT BACK...THE ONE AND ONLY REASON. **Believe it or not, I found in the manual (which isn't a booklet version, but PDF only) that Nikon actually states in the manual that you will hear a clicking noise while the mode is in AF-continuous! Really????? Yes, really. I guess they had to put that because you simply can't ignore the fact that it does it! I've been a pro Nikon user for 9 years and this is the first time I've been disappointed in them, I'm sad to say. Wish their point and shoots were as good as their SLRs! WATCH THE VIDEO! This is how much I feel everyone should hear it. It's short and it's random, but you can't miss the clicking noise!2. The flash definitely is in the most random spot...directly under your finger. Think you don't hold the camera there and it won't be an issue? I doubt it. I kept trying to remember that it was there and hold it differently, but it is rather annoying every time it pops up under where you're holding it. Honestly, I still would have kept the camera if this were the only thing wrong with it. I could get past the bad placement of the flash, but I simply could not get past or ignore the continual, loud clicking in my videos.Everything else about the camera I really liked! The images were sharp even in low light and the video would have been fine (not as great in low light as you'll see in the sample video) if it hadn't been for the above issues.If you don't mind the clicking or won't be doing much video, it may be worth it to you, but check out the video and decide for yourself./Applications/Nikon Software

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Weekend mechanic
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't it would be great to have a compact camera that could to shoot both high quality still photos along with 1080p HD video. Up until recently that camera didn't exist, but there are several cameras on the market now that will do just that. What I like best about the S8100 is the super sharp, easy to see outdoors, 3" LCD Display along with the 10X Zoom lens. I recently attended a Winter Carnival in my home town, the temperture was in the mid 20's and I shot video's and still pictures of Ice sculptors working on their creations. In addition, there were snowmobile races I recorded video of. When I returned home I combined the video segments into a HD mini movie with sound, using the software included with the camera. I was impressed with how sharp the picture was when I played it on my HD TV. The camera does have it's faults. As other's have mentioned the pop up flash is located under where many people would place the index finger of their left hand. It's not that difficult to move your finger back a little and if you forget, the camera will let you know. I suppose the reason is to try and locate the flash as far from the lens as possible to minimize Red Eye. The Wheel on the top of the camera that allows you to select various shooting modes is diffucult to get a hold of as about 2/3 of it is only partially exposed. On the positive side, the camera can be used on fully automatic or you can chose from a number of shooting modes programed for various lighting situations. All in all I think this is a great little camera to take on vacation or use for family events as it's small and easy to carry. At least it fills the bill for me!

Reviews.Title: My first Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: I've had my eye on Nikon's Compact Digital Cameras for a couple of years. Reviewing several cameras on Nikon's website, testing them at stores, checking prices, etc. Even though I was looking for a more compact camera; the Nikon Coolpix S8100 caught my eye because of its features and size. I even checked other sites, but nobody beat it at the time, not even after two months. I am very please with the product, and Amazon's service and deal.

Reviews.Title: More picture crispness and continuous video experience desired..
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie
Reviews.Content: It has been close to a month that I have this camera. So granted that I am yet to fully explore all the features and knobs on the camera and I am no expert when it comes to adjusting settings on cameras i.e DSLRs are too costly to experiment for my budget; this one had met all my criteria when I bought it. Thus far I have only used the basic picture and video recording functions on the camera. Here are my reactions:Wrt pictures: Mixed. Some have turned out to be awesome and some leave the crispness that you'd expect out of a Nikon 12.1MP camera to be desired. Like I stated above - do not know as yet if I could control that by changing some settings..WIP. Night pictures, if the flash is on and if taken with patience - turn out nice.Wrt video: While the 1080p quality is amazing - any zoom in/out during recording causes the video to break into the obviously noticeable frames i.e the continuity of the video is broken. I have seen that with all the videos that I recorded and uploaded and watched on my computer. I still need to check if I witness that same behavior if I connect the camera directly to my HDTV (probably will?). When zoom feature is not used - the video quality is great.As I use this camera more and figure things out - will update my review, if relevant.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera but it is just a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Oscar Pozos Saldivar "Oscar_Pozos"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S8100 is a nice camera but remember that it is a point and shoot only. Some times the camera reacts very slowly and take a few seconds to either focus or even take the picture.I sold my Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS3 because I was looking for a camera that took 1080p Video but guess what? Even when the Panasonic was only 720p, it is a much better camera than Nikon so if you are a Nikon fan you need to be patient to take great pictures, just wait for the camera to focus and shoot. It can take great pictures with low or no light but you need a tripod and when taking pictures to people, you will have to ask them to stand still for 10 seconds!Something that I didn't like from this camera at all is that the zoom lens motor is noisy and when you are taking a video with low or no sound at all, the camera will record that noise coming from the lens when you're zooming!I've read most of the reviews and my main advise is: Read the manual to learn the main tricks about how to use this camera properly.

Reviews.Title: fine little camera
Reviews.Author: Terry McCammon
Reviews.Content: I selected this as a gift for my wife based on size, performance and reputation.  It is a great camera for its size, the display is really the selling point, amazing.  Works like a charm.In a related but not the camera's fault note, the case sponsored and highlighted with this camera at the time of purchase is just about .1" too small.  The camera does fit, but only by very careful and exacting placement.  I fail to see why it is so hard to offer the correct case.

Reviews.Title: Talk about Cool . . . pix . . .
Reviews.Author: Music Lovers
Reviews.Content: The time spent researching which camera to buy was well worth it, and for a relatively small digital camera, you just can't do any better - this camera is just great.  I especially like the features of being able to zoom during video, and also being able to snap photos during video as well.  This thing takes great photos, regardless of what I throw at it, low light, which thing to focus on, it's automatic mode rarely guesses wrong.  The colors are so true that I almost never need to touch them up.  The super sharp large monitor is great, too!  Definitely would highly recommend for both the amateur and more serious photographer!

Reviews.Title: I love this camara
Reviews.Author: Len the Glassman
Reviews.Content: I started using this camera before I read the instructions, that's how easy it is to use. I love the way you can crop pictures on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff T. Klipp "Jeff K"
Reviews.Content: I was using A Casio EX-Z250A (9.1mp) & it was a fine camera. But when I purchased the Nikon S8100 (12.1mp) it had major differences. The S8100 was a little bigger & heavier. I was able to zoom whem shooting a full HD video. It has a 10X zoom. Only drawback is a little noise when zooming in video mode(you can hear it in the playback). Records in stereo when shooting video. Picture quality is great & almost no lapse from picture to picture (very fast between shots). The flash was a little getting used to. It pops up on top  & thats where I like to keep my fingers. Video connects directly to HD TV with patch cord(not supplied). I bought a 8GB card for this camera(about 2400 pics.). An extra battery is about $24, allot less than $50 for my Casio battery. About 200 pictures between charging battery. USB downloads pictures & videos to computer. Comes with Nikon programs you download. I find it's easier to use my own reader to download all. Easy camera for beginners & a nice upgrade for people who take their camera everywhere.I would suggest this camera to all. And not a bad price either at $239.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100 P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric A James
Reviews.Content: This camera takes crisp quality pictures.  As compared to other point and shoot cameras, the quality and detail is hands down better. This is probably due to the actual number of lenses and distance the lenses are able to extend from the camera itself.While reviewing the camera prior to purchase, I noted other people mentioned the placement of the flash.  I too would have to agree it is annoying and I often forget to move my fingers as I am not quite used to its location.  With that being said, the quality of pictures taken with the flash down are so that a little color/contrast editing bring the pictures back to top quality (sometimes better than other P&S; cameras with a flash).  This also has some bearing on the night or low light pictures taken with the S8100.  No issues in this department.  Although, if Nikon decides to add a night vision capability to this camera, sign me up.The LCD is crisp and clear but is mounted flush.  Being in the military and deployed, this bothers me as I have to continually make a conscious effort to keep the screen from being damaged.  The internal memory is descent with about 50 pictures worth of space.  Not sure how much video space that is as I have not taken any video yet (therefore have not rated the video in this review).As of this writing I have only had the camera for about three weeks. With this said, I am impressed at the quality of photo from this camera.  Bottom line is you will not be discouraged with this purchase.  Well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: must have camera
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: I hate having a big bulkie camera.  The Nikon Coolpix S8100 is the greatest.  It is small but works like a big camera.  It is so handy to just put in your pocket and not have to carry a big camera bag.  Used mine during Christmas watching the kids play in the snow.  It is fast action so all my prints turned out great.  Highly recomment this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome small Nikon
Reviews.Author: ilene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have a D300 and a D700 SLR and now are the proud owners of an S8100.  This camera is unbelievable.  It produces smooth images, both flash and available light.  Took a couple pics in a big box store with available light and was very impressed with the quality in the lowlights and highlights.  Flash shots are not blown out, just great fill light.  Would highly recommend it for every day shooting.

Reviews.Title: Be sure to spend some time with the instructions.
Reviews.Author: Austinnewbee
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  There are so many features, it can be difficult to figure out the one you want to use on the fly.  The unit is small, compact, light, with a great picture quality.  I have been using my new camera to photograph action scenes of my new invention, The FlashBak Rear bike light.  Sample photos will soon be available on our web site: [...] This camera is a quality product and I bought it despite, or because of the Ashton Kutcher commercials(I'm not too sure).

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Nana
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the reviews on this camera, so I purchased the Nikon 8100 for my daughter for x-mas.  I gave it to her on the first day of our family vacation so she would have the  option of continuing to use her expensive/bulky Canon camera or I would give her 'cash' (and I would keep the camera).  Darn...she fell in love with it's size, quality and ease of use.  She took the camera to the slopes, snowmobiling and all around town.  After a week in Pagosa Springs, she had taken over 150 pictures that we viewed on the tv on our last day of our vacation. Nice camera...great pictures...we all loved it!

Reviews.Title: This is a nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: sumit kumar gupta
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because the picture quality was very good. Firstly I returned this camera and ordered for Nikon P100 because in almost same price range I was getting the 26x zoom and more,But I found the picture quality is more sharp in this and I am going to get this camera back again. I am not a advance photographer and for my limited range of photography it has a good quality picture. It doesn't have manual mode but auto and scene mode are really nice. 10x zoom is good and able to produce nice image.

Reviews.Title: just that goood
Reviews.Author: mnmfong
Reviews.Content: Best point and shoot I've ever had and this is my first Nikon. EZ to use and great pix and video in stereo. Flash is a little too bright in close quarters, but works outside well. Would prefer a non pop-up flash, or one in a different position(left finger gets the way). Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 -- Out of the box ease of use
Reviews.Author: SmokeJumper "Outspoken"
Reviews.Content: Needing a camera immediately, I had but a short time to choose which one to purchase. While I did not anticipate needing one with 1080p video capabilities, it was nice to find that the S8100 had this very easy to use option. With only the abbreviated version of an 'Owners Manual' I was able to shoot night time photos, full sun, inside with and without flash and a very acceptable video. Naturally I could have done better with the video if I had a tripod available, but for a "try it now" situation, hand held, the results were amazing. Video inside a fairly well illuminated room, with windows as a background and no alternate position from which to shoot - everyone who viewed the results was amazed. Photos, both with and without flash were great as well. BATTERY LIFE was really great since I shot over 35 minutes of video and 225 high-resolution photos and still had no sign of  the battery being severely diminished.There are certainly cameras with more advanced features, however, for a good solid camera with easy to use top-mounted controls, this is a great buy.The one "con"? I had to take care to not block the pop-up flash which is mounted on the upper LH of the camera. After a hand-full of photo opportunities being lost due my fingers, I soon remembered to alter my grip and when I did so - the flash was superb.Strongly recommend this camera. I am really glad I decided to give it a try -- my rush effort to decide produced a GREAT VALUE and even more importantly -- GREAT PHOTOS AND VIDEO!

Reviews.Title: poor zoom
Reviews.Author: user friendly "easy d"
Reviews.Content: purchased this camera because of the 10x zoom.  Problem is the zoomed photos come out terrible.  Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Best Amateur Camera Ever -- Fantastic Family Shots and HD Movies
Reviews.Author: Who Let the Dogs Out?
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a more expensive Casio that filmed in slow motion.  How surprised I was this camera outperforms the more expensive bulky one by a large margin.Quality of the HD movies is amazing.  And slow motion filming is great for sports events.The battery is recharagable and actually lasts for 6 to 8 hours of HD movie filming.You can't beat this camera for family shots.  It's light, easy to carry around and convenient to whip out and photograph on impulse.  If you've got children, don't leave home without it.  You won't be dissappointed with the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very, Very Good Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Shane "InTheRough"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera only days before my wife and I flew to Barcelona to begin a 21-day cruise mostly around the eastern Mediterranean. The package arrived just in time for me to become familiar with the new camera before committing to NOT taking my bulky Nikon SLR.The camera did a great job and I would have awarded 5 stars except I do not like using the rear screen to aim, but would have preferred having an additional simple view finder. I'm a former professional photographer and am spoiled by the SLR format.Except for turning off the flash when it was not permitted, I operated the camera in full automatic mode. After each day's excursion, I used the included cable to transfer the photos to a notebook computer. I then used Picasa for a little editing and then the ship's WiFi to post to my Facebook account so family could track our long trip. I never needed the extra battery. The camera shoots video too, but I did not do much of that.My SLR might have produced better photos, but I would not have been willing to carry it everywhere. There are smaller cameras around, but they are difficult to manipulate. The S8100 fits nicely in a small belly pack.

Reviews.Title: Poor camera choice, stick to cannon, kodak, or sony
Reviews.Author: cmp2007
Reviews.Content: After doing much research I picked this camera to replace my kodak easy share that I got in 2008. The image quality is not good at all if there is any kind of motion in the picture. The focal point looks okay but anyone around it who is even moving ever so slightly, will appear blurry. I would not recommend this camera. I plan on exchanging it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Video
Reviews.Author: Xybot
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because Consumer Reports gave the previous model (S8000) good marks.  The still image quality is great; however, the video is essentially useless unless you are outdoors (i.e., high light conditions).  Indoors the video is so dark it is basically not worth viewing.  I have an older Fuji camera that took much better video.  This is kind of an expensive camera for what is does.  I would not buy it again and I am disappointed I own it.

Reviews.Title: Bad company!!!
Reviews.Author: mothership2000
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!!! Nikon "warrenty" is very limited- shortly after purchase the cover over my lens became wiggly and sometimes did not open/ close all of the way.  Nikon insists that I damaged the camera and they will not cover the repairs.  I have owned Canons for the last 10 years and have never had problems with the cameras.  8 months with this Nikon and my camera is ready to be thrown away.  The customer service dept at Nikon also jerked me around for two weeks before someone could explain why they would not repair my camera.  A huge waste of my time and money...I will be ordering another Canon today.

Reviews.Title: I couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: J. Lucas
Reviews.Content: I needed a high quality field camera that was compact but took superior photos.  This camera is it.  Low light photos was a must for me and I'm impressed.  I try never to use the flash and the photos are detailed and the color true.  I need to identify birds and often I can not get close enough to see them through my bios.  I regularly use this camera on zoom to take their photo in the far distance and then zoom up to I.D. them.  Fabulous!  It also takes high quality close ups of plants and insects.  Lovely for scenery, too.  I've been thinking about purchasing another one just for back up.  I've banged this one around a bit and it's still working great.  But really... how much can technology handle me?  Maybe a lot more - this camera sure has!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: crl "crl"
Reviews.Content: Researched cameras before deciding to buy this one, and expected a lot. Unfortunately I was very disappointed in the photo quality. Poor color accuracy, just average sharpness. I have a 5-year-old Canon that cost a third as much as this NIkon, but gives me better photos. Lots of bells and whistles, but lacking in photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Very bad for video
Reviews.Author: efra33
Reviews.Content: I bought  this camera for the convenience of the video, but has been a dissapointment so far, I have sent it twice for repair (for me is a defect of this model, but check it out before you buy). It takes good pictures, but when recording video, it goes out of focus as soon as the focus is moving (in or out), and in a lot of cases it will not regain focus, the service department has giving me excuses and do not admit that the camera has a problem, that's why I recomend to check more reviews in regards of video before buying it, if you just want to take pictures, get a cheaper camera with the same capabilities as this one, you'll save alot.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: EmC
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital point and shoot that I could use in the place of my bulky Canon SLR.  Being a brand loyalist, I started with a Canon Powershot SX130IS.  It was terrible.  I had read the reviews for this camera on several websites and the only negative thing I read about was the zoom sound in videos.  Since I was not going to be using this for videos, I decided to try it.  This camera is awesome!  I was able to use it to capture my 2 year old son opening Christmas presents, and almost NONE of the photos are blurry, despite the fact that he was moving constantly.  The photos are clear and beautiful and the different options are great.  Night Photo is amazing. This Nikon has completely changed my mind about the brand and I will be a Nikon loyalist from now on :)

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot..crystal clear photos
Reviews.Author: Digi
Reviews.Content: All is good with this camera except for the usb, battery and hdmi outlets. The plastic cover for these outlets is very flimsy and feels like it's going to break off everytime they are moved to plug a cable in. Minor cosmetic flaw that does not affect the performance of this great digi cam.

Reviews.Title: Top Camera
Reviews.Author: Earle Williams
Reviews.Content: My wife enjoys taking videos when we travel. The Nikon Coolpix S8000 we have is a bit limited for that use. We got the S8100, and she now gets amazing videos, with which we both are pleased.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Price
Reviews.Author: Milan M. Andreides "Andy"
Reviews.Content: As the right up explained - Just like new - It actually exceeded my expectations. I had one and I dropped it. The repairer is a flat fee that exceeded your purchase price...

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: snappingrandma
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the pictures and the ease of use. The photos are superb for the subjects, wildlife, birds and fish.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot with pizazz!
Reviews.Author: Missoula woodworker
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes quality pictures and has enough flexibility and features to satisfy most photographers. At times, as the more avid "shooter" in our family, I wish it had a higher zoom, but it's so convenient to carry that my Canon 20-D stays home now more often than not. I do have a gripe with this camera, however. The flash pops up from the top left, a location that seems to beg for a left forefinger when taking a shot. That's OK when the flash is not necessary, but when it decides that flash is called for, one has to readjust the grip before taking the picture, possibly causing an opportunity for the shot to pass by. Aside from that, however, the photos taken have been quite satisfactory with enough "pixel power" to allow for cropping while still leaving sufficient resolution for a pleasing effect.

Reviews.Title: the instruction sheet is in very fine print
Reviews.Author: harold m.
Reviews.Content: i have not got around to reading the instructions, the fine print is hard to see,i have a  best friend that has one so will get him to get me started

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Iglika Georgieva
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Makes great pictures and it is easy to use. I have it from 3 years and I still love it! Great product. The battery is fine, long life,but if you like to make a looot of pictures, like 200-300 a day may be you should order another battery in case. This is what I did and I never had problems!

Reviews.Title: Battery Shorted Out.
Reviews.Author: NatR
Reviews.Content: My mother and I both own this camera. I got it as a graduation gift, used a few times then the battery shorted it out. The same thing happen with my moms. we now have two nonworking cameras. very disappointing for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: Great for extreme conditions!
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Boyer
Reviews.Content: I use this camera in my job on job sites in power plants where dust and dirt are everywhere.  It takes great pics and lasts about 3 years in this environment, then I buy another one.  Usually the lens cover fails from the dirt but this camera is used in extreme conditions--it would last almost forever in ordinary home conditions.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: can you say warranty
Reviews.Author: joe agachinski
Reviews.Content: lens error came up within a week cant use camera n have to send back to nikon . very disappointing bday present for my wife

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rcadianne"
Reviews.Content: I got a picture of a bald eagle, sitting on a telephone pole, on the other side of the Yellow River, must have been 60-70 yards away. Looks like I am standing right next to him! Great pictures, not fuzzy, no distortion, even when I've zoomed it to the max!

Reviews.Title: The S8100 is a PHENOMENAL Point and Shoot Camera - FIVE Stars
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY recommend this camera.  I initially was planning to buy the S9100, but after reading the reviews on Amazon about the S8100, I decided to try it, instead of the S9100, and I have been nothing but very, very impressed the awesome quality of the thousands of exposures that I have captured with it.  I have compared my pictures with the pictures taken from other Nikon Point and Shoot cameras, and my pictures are always more vibrant, and sharp.  I paid less than $200 for my S8100, and I'm not sure what it is selling for now, but I HIGHLY recommend looking into, and eventually purchasing this camera.  It is very easy to use, and it takes superb pictures for a Point and Shoot camera.  A solid Five star product.

Reviews.Title: Broke and did not last long
Reviews.Author: Shawn Kaplan
Reviews.Content: I think this is an excellent camera, but after only having it only for a few months it broke on the 5th day of our cruise - not good.  They sent a replacement, and overall it's an excellent camra, and now after having it for about two years, it's broken again and has a light clicking sound, and can't take video with the zoom feature because it shakes too much.

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: Joyce E. Hodges "jehodges"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos.  The only problem that has occurred over time is that the icons on the dial have worn off and it is a trick to know where the various setting are.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Debra Wagner
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot camera.It has many features and digital video recording at 1080.Pictures look great on big flat screen TV's.It comes loaded with goodies. And has more than enough settings to capture the image in many differnt lights and you can edit on the camera.Great Value

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Ivins
Reviews.Content: This little camera is simple, easy to use and take great pictures. No unnecessary gadgets just point and shoot. Took this to Alaska and it worked like a charm. Both landscape and inside were great.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: Works nice and takes video also. Easy to use. easy to upload and print photos. I added a memory card and can switch from internal to external memory depending on my memory needs.

Reviews.Title: Did not hold up well at all!
Reviews.Author: Ron Cate
Reviews.Content: Took great pics when it works. After just a couple months, the lens began to bind up when extending. I would have to remove and then replace the battery to get it reset. It finally just quit working. I will replace it with Canon. It's really too bad because it takes great pics but failed prematurely.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: nicole sullivan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I did a lot of research before I bought it.  It was highly rated and true to the reviews.  Great quality and the pictures are clear and it has a fast shutter speed to catch  my 18mo old son.  Only draw back is its not water proof so now I have to get another after dropping it in the ocean. lol.  My fault but I will be getting another.

Reviews.Title: It malfunctioned on day 4 and I mailed it back
Reviews.Author: V. Knott
Reviews.Content: I had one of these camera and I broke it. My fault. I ordered an exact one as I liked it. But day 4 on a vacation it stopped working so I mailed it back and have not had one replaced.

Reviews.Title: ..."Lens Error"
Reviews.Author: lezooki
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this camera. I'm one of those people who just have bad luck when it comes to owning a digital camera longer than a year and a half though. I loved the quality of the pictures this Nikon took and everything about it. I took it out of my purse one day (which I probably shouldn't have been keeping it in anyway, even if it was in a case) and the lens wouldn't extend properly. It clicked a lot when trying to open and when it finally did, it was blurry and wouldn't zoom. I had to manually help it retract when I turned the camera off, and it hasn't gotten any better since. The "lens error" message comes on a lot and is still not usable the way it was intended. I have to manually zoom it and retract the lens every time I want to use the camera now. I didn't do anything to it that I know of, and of course it's out of warranty.Because I liked the camera so much in the first place, I really would like to purchase another Nikon, preferably in the S series again, but I'm a little hesitant when it comes to the lens issue again. It is very frustrating and I'm tired of buying a camera every other year!

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: David Ferreira
Reviews.Content: this is a good item, i gave it 5 starts, it works well, i would buy this again as needed

Reviews.Title: Great compact and effective
Reviews.Author: burhan gunaydin
Reviews.Content: Lens quality is amazing and a nice wide angle minimum focal length..Pictures come out so clean and clear even in the dark lighting (zero light) at night.

Reviews.Title: The best camera
Reviews.Author: Jose A, Garcia
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying that it was an excellent transaction, great communication, super fast shipping and much better camera than any other I have owned before and after, that is, including the most recent one I just bought.

Reviews.Title: Nikon does it again.
Reviews.Author: Samuel F. Favata
Reviews.Content: Pro:Great camera right out of the box.Great zoom lens.Great pictures.Great for vacation and trips.Good options in manual mode.Nice camera to bring if you don't want to lug your SLR around.Con:Hard to get around in manual mode and find what you want.Seems a bit slow at times for action shooting.  But remember;it's not a SLR.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: works good. second one i bought.. needed mine, wife had it when i needed it.. takes good pictures for what i needed it for.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: William McGuire
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pictures.  The close up mode is great.  I highly recommend it and would definitely purchase another if lost or broken.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Bruce in Texas
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Much easier to use than my old film-version Nikon of technology from the ancient past.  The video that can be taken with this camera is amazingly good, as well as the still photos.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: nikon camera  review
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: nikon coolpic S8100 12.1 cmos digital camera ,recieved it promptly, works great, good shape we like it !!!  thank you

Reviews.Title: Simple, TRUE Point-and-shoot with great results!(MOSTLY in auto mode to this point)
Reviews.Author: Kyle Sturz
Reviews.Content: So far, I love it!  For someone that doesn't like to make, or understand all the manual adjustments needed to capture a great picture - THIS is YOUR camera!  Outstanding performance in low light conditions.  Took pic. of dog with backlight coming through window behind - extremely dark turnout.  Switched to the back-light mode and it was picture perfect.  Since it is the 1st non-cheapo camera that I have purchased, I am still experimenting with the differant modes offered and will repost if I experience issues - though I don't REALLY expect any to this point.  So far, a TRUE point-and-shoot

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: dee
Reviews.Content: This is the second Nikon camera i bought in the past 6 months. The first was the L810, I didn't like that one because my images were getting scrambled when i used the review function so I was pissed but decided to give Nikon a second chance and bought the S8100. owned this camera for roughly 3 months and now its not working I keep getting a lens error and the camera has never been dropped. Sometimes it comes on and won't even show anything on the screen. Straight garbage i won't buy another Nikon product any time soon.

Reviews.Title: nixon great camera
Reviews.Author: philip  haase
Reviews.Content: camera serves the purpose well. was discribed well,and had a good price Would be a little better with longer battery life

Reviews.Title: Worked great until the telescoping lens broke.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Paine
Reviews.Content: Worked great until the telescoping lens broke. The camera turns on easily and was turned on my pocket several times. It doesn't have a pressure release, so it broke in my pocket. However, I am still able to manual telescope the lens.Pictures are of high quality, but the interface is not well designed.

Reviews.Title: Good Photo Quality
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Camera takes very nice photos.  The gold color is perfect.  Charge lasts a long time.  The only thing I absolutely do not like is the flash.  The placement is very awkward.  I always end up placing my finger on top it.  Otherwise, it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: Rose Altman
Reviews.Content: Even though bought as refurbished from highly reputable online camera store, camera pooped out at 1 year. Took really nice pictures, but with the Nikon reputation, should have been better. I have a second hand Canon Powershot A570IS that is still going, so something this high tech should have been better. I definitely will let Nikon know about this. Personally, I would buy a Canon instead of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Faulty Camera
Reviews.Author: karen t carter
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera, however after owning the camera less tha a month  the battery woul not recharge, thinking the battery was faulty I purchased a new one after a few uses the fattery failed and would not recharge. I ended up sending the camera back to Nikon. Needles to say I am not any to pleased

Reviews.Title: Dissappointed
Reviews.Author: nonnie
Reviews.Content: I ordered a new Nikon S8100 and received a used one! Beware!!! Not in original box and screen is smuged!

Reviews.Title: Buy something else
Reviews.Author: P-Town Mama
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a year.  The size is nice.  Beyond that, I can't say anything particularly good about it.  The flash makes the pictures have too much white light.  It makes skin look yellow or white.  My biggest complaint is that it just won't take pictures... I push the button and it's so busy looking for something to focus on, it won't take the shot.  Especially if someone is moving.  This is impossible for me because I have small kids (they are always moving).  I had a Cannon Powershot before this and it was 10x better.  I received this as a gift and will be looking for a new camera soon.  I do like the video function, the sound is pretty good, and the picture is better than my cell phone (not much of a comparison).  It's helpful for taking short videos.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: María Belén Alonso
Reviews.Content: It's a really good camera, and the price is awesome. But the one I bought has some worn buttones, so I don't know if it's refurbiched. Hope not.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ao
Reviews.Content: The only place I could find this camera was on Amazon.  Wanted RED, who doesn't???  Found it here and love, love, love this camera.  Love Nikon!  Convenient, easy to carry, good photos.  Works for a basic need.

Reviews.Title: Really great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Knauf
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife one after she lost her camera somewhere.  We both liked it so much that I bought another one for myself.  Small, easy-to-use, takes great photos and is relatively easy to transfer to a PC.  We love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles H Jarrett
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement of one just like it someone dropped while trying to take our picture.  Love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary E. Long
Reviews.Content: A Great Camera! Great Price! I thought I was always going to be a Cannon guy, but found out differently.

Reviews.Title: Did not last long
Reviews.Author: Michael Penney
Reviews.Content: This was an ok camera while it lasted,  but 6 months after the warrantee expired the lens stopped focusing.While it worked it did a reasonably good job of taking photos, some really nice ones. The menu system was slow to use and the macro never seemed to work.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Maureen Altavilla
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Looked at plenty of them and this was the winner. Nice price for it too. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Another lens failure...
Reviews.Author: Felix Buzzard "Bad Bird"
Reviews.Content: While it lasted, it was a great little camera. Great for pictures as well as for taking movies on the fly.I like to carry a camera with me at all times and this one was perfect.But it did not last very long before I got the dreaded "lens malfunction". The equivalent of a "Blue Screen of Death" on Windows operating systems.The lens comes out but I can't take pictures or movies. The camera is useless.Judging from other reviewers, and many of them mentionned the same problem, it is not worth getting the camera fixed.From my research on the Web, this seems to be a common problem with Nikon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera/value
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes quality pictures for its price point.  It's lightweight and easy to carry around, and the controls & setup are easy to navigate.  A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this awesome camera a little over a year & a half ago and it is by far the best digital camera I have purchased by far. Once I play with the settings just right it takes amazing pictures. It is a bit on the heavy, bulky side but I don't mind it much. I can't give it a full 5 stars since the battery life could be better. The flash really drains the battery life quickly. I've only dropped this digital camera once within the year & half I had it & it is still working perfectly like it did day one plus no dings or scratches either. The 10x zoom is more then enough, I mainly use this camera to take everyday family pictures so the zoom does not get used much. Although there are some modes I am still trying to get a hang off which come off a bit difficult to use. Aside from that it is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Linda Van den akker
Reviews.Content: When I first bought this camera, I loved it. It took great pictures, the video was easy to use and I was very happy with my purchase. THEN, a year ago, the plastic shutter stopped working correctly right in the middle of my son's college graduation party. I blew on the lens and eventually, after some tinkering, it worked. All was OK until a year ago on a trip to Spain when the lens kept going in and out and wouldn't stop. I kept getting  "lens error" in the view finder. Doubt very much that I will buy another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: rooster6758 "pinolero50"
