Reviews.Content: Handy little camera with lots of quality features. Cons: Flash unit pops up out of an inconvenient location, no manual settings option, flimsy mini-HDMI cover. Pros: Great picture quality, multiple auto-settings, strong flash, handy shirt pocket size, under $200.00.

Reviews.Title: The camera is good but not durable
Reviews.Author: Stephen Staedtler
Reviews.Content: I use this camera primarily at night for taking pictures of reptiles and amphibians.  It takes good photos at night compared to most cameras, but only average in the day and sometimes has trouble focusing.  It's very easy to use.  The biggest problem is that now I have gone through 2 cameras in 6 months.  You drop this camera by accident, forget it.  It doesn't take much for you to start getting lens error messages.  I've also had the corners of my pictures in black, so I have to crop everything now.  I love the photos that this camera takes, but how many times can I dish out $200 for a camera that has terrible durability?  Video is also below average.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: F. W. Stanton
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera, I have wanted to buy this camera for some time (my son has one), finally it came down to my price range. Great HD movies, great pictures even at the lower pixels. and does very well in low light

Reviews.Title: Too much money, battery is a joke!!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Anthony "Patrick"
Reviews.Content: Iv'e had this camara less than two yrs now. Yes it takes good pics and all. Others have said that the lens would not come out and thats happened once, thankfully. What really irritated me most was the battery. I had to buy a new one and it wasn't nikons. I bought another brand name. nikon has got enouph money from me. Despite there claim of warnings to only use nikon replacement batteries is bull. I've never had to replace a battery for any of my products that fast, junk! That said, I'll buy a Canon or Minolta next time.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S8100 Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Brian Burke "blueoak"
Reviews.Content: I have the Coolpix S8100 and have had an irrevocable problem with a defective lens. Great camera until it fails and then the failure is catastrophic.

Reviews.Title: TERRIFIC Value
Reviews.Author: VulcanJedi "transcender"
Reviews.Content: I had not thought this model on my first choice however a colleague suggested it. It was actually older model than available and price negligible.  I took this camera abroad along w/ a DSLR. Ended up taking more photos w/ this due to portability.The image stabalization is SUPERB. One handed still shots no problem.Bought a high speed SD card. Capture rate was good.The 1080p is fantastic as well. Menu / UI intuitive and easy to use. the photo modes are great and night mode does a nice job.Good form factor and easy to use the screen location makes it a bit unintuitive at first to take a 2 handed shot but once you know you understand and as I mentioned taking single handed shots is effortless.the lens is a bit offset so sometimes 2 handed shots you need to be a bit less careless to get a finger in the view but performance wise this was a outstanding purchase of a versatile digital P/S camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery is Useless
Reviews.Author: A. Tremain
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this purchase at first.  I have had it less than a year though and the battery is shot.  In previous cameras I have owned the battery has lasted much longer.  I don't know what the deal is but it makes me want to try a different manufacturer next time.

Reviews.Title: This camera works well for us
Reviews.Author: UnbiasedReviewer
Reviews.Content: This is my second digital camera.  It replaced and Olympus 3.1 megapixel camera that still worked adequately.  Once I got used to not holding my finger where the pop-up flash pops out, I didn't find anything too objectionable about the camera.  It is wonderful for still photos.  I use it for work and wanted something compact, but substantial enough for my hand to firmly grasp.  It comes in a bit on the small side, with no real grip.  The Olympus it replaced was more substantial.Prior to buying, I read a lot of reviews on Amazon and possibly other places.  I've had the camere for a year and used it a lot.  Battery life has been fine.  I don't remember it ever running low, even after taking several flash photos.  I don't use it for more than 20 pictures at a time on average, and it gets plugged in to download the pictures often.  My opinion is that picture quality is tremendous.For video, I am sure you can hear the lens zooming in the audio, but I didn't purchase the camera for video, and what video I've taken, I am pleased with.  The sound was also good when recording my 87 year old mother playing the piano she sent to us from her home.  Low light photos (and I believe video) by candle light came out nicely.The camera came as part of a kit with a tight fitting elastic case.  The case is small and protects it really well from scratches.  It has elastic that stretches to accept the camera and get it back out.  The case also has a velcro flap.  The simple case is wonderful.  I highly recommend such.  The old Olympus I had got scratched by the plug on a battery charger that was also in a bigger bag with it.The lcd display is big, bright, and clear.  I wish the cameras still came with a range finder viewer.SLRs are a big thing now, but having been an amateur photographer and blessed to lug around a Hasselblad about 20 years ago as well as Olympus SLRs, I appreciate the compact simplicity and high quality of a camera like this.  Digital is incredible.  I don't miss going into the darkroom to develop things, and I don't need a whole bunch of lenses or a bulky SLRs to take great pictures.  Being able to shoot and shoot and shoot and not spend for film is great for developing your eye for photos.  I never got great at that, but on a trip with the Olympus digital camera was able to take about 1,000 pictures, and for the first time, I saw how I was getting better at seeing things and really seeing the picture I was taking as well as thinking about what I was really getting.  Being unencumbered is freeing, and this camera can free you to be creative with your eyes and mind.If video is extremely important, I recommend investing in a camera just for that, but if amateur home movie type video is plenty good (a bit shaky, with a little whirring from the zoom lens), then the quality of the video from this is wonderful (HD looks gread on the computer).  A tripod helps with shake.  Sound from the zoom lens probably cannot be avoided.You get what you pay for and for the price, I am really happy and give it a full 5 stars.The particular vendor mine came from sent me a gold one twice, when I thought I'd ordered black.  It was very frustrating to deal with that two times, but finally they got it right.  I don't think they were an Amazon vendor.  To their credit, they put the nice case together with it and sold it with some other minor items as a kit.

Reviews.Title: Dust inside Lens?
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and liked what I discovered for both the image and video capture.  After  having the camera for about 3 months, I am really disappointed with the fact that there is considerable dust inside the lens.  This is not dust you can wipe off.  It is substantial dust inside the lens visible from the front.  I carry the camera around in my pocket but don't use it in unusual environments.  I'm not happy about that and from what I've read in Nikon forums, other people are having the same problem in time and the only suggestion is sending it back to Nikon.  I suspect they can't do anything for it as this is probably a design flaw.  Lens should be sealed.  Never had that problem with my old Canon Powershot A95.  There are other models of Nikon which are having similar problems.  Wouldn't have bought it if I new this would happen.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: Nikon does it again the S8100 is very user friendly small but takes great pictures. Zoom lens is out of this world but you do need a tripod for very long shots. I have had this about 9 months and take it with every where try you will like it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Control, Lousy Customer Service
Reviews.Author: gr
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for Christmas.  Camera began to scroll, erratically, at about day 100. Problem continued; contacted Nikon at about day 110. Sent camera to Nikon, Nikon claims camera is `damaged'(100 images, maybe, max, since holiday...). Nikon will not cover under warranty, wants $100 to repair a $200 camera, that's approx 4 months old. DON'T BUY ONE. This is NOT your father's/grandfather's camera/camera company.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Unhappy
Reviews.Content: This camera has some very nice features but the negatives are enough to stay away.  It takes a lot of blurry photos and the flash washes everything out.  We also got the ever so common lens error with our camera just before the 1 year warranty ran out.  However, the camera was dropped about a month after owning it.  We never had a problem with the camera's functioning after the drop but one day while turning it off, I got a lens error.  It seems that almost everyone of these cameras get this lens error.  Ours was not covered by the warranty because it was dropped so many months earlier.  This seems like a cheap way for Nikon to get out of their warranty.  It cost us $100 to fix, almost half the original price.  The customer service was also terrible.  When I made a complaint about the warranty not being fulfilled and asked for a manager, I was hung up on.  It also takes 20 mintues to get a hold of someone.  I would not buy from Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Fits what I need it for
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Sprigler
Reviews.Content: I picked this up to replace my Olympus DSLR.  I no longer really needed the Olympus as my fiance had an arguably better Canon 60D.  I wasn't thrilled with being camera-less myself though so I went for a more pocketable point and shoot.  It's been a nice camera and does a serviceable job.  It keeps a charge and takes pretty good pictures.  The only downside is on full auto it still requires tweaking the exposure compensation to get the best picture.  If you want a purely auto hands off point and shoot that takes great pictures this might not be the camera for you, but if you don't mind tweaking things here and there it's a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: When It Works, it's great....Back to Canon....
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Moon "ESLBruce"
Reviews.Content: I have owned two of these, in black and chrome/platinum colors. I took one to China with me in 2010 for a short Thanksgiving trip. I loved the 12x zoom and image stabilization for taking the corners of buildings like the Forbidden Palace. The short videos were excellent quality and meant I didn't need to lug my video camera along.In 2011, I returned for a 45 day trip. Before leaving, I had some trouble with the lens cover closing, probably because of dirt. My more mechanical wife managed to get it closed and I left with the camera. Some time in this process the camera got scratched and glare spots appeared on pictures where light hit the lens. I looked into getting it repaired in China but the prices approached those of a new  camera and the expert shops said they couldn't get the part since it was made for the American market. I limped a long with the camera, taking once in a lifetime pictures with a lens that made it look like the camera had a cataract. I was meeting up with friends in Guangdong so I had my wife buy another of the same model. Once I got it, everything went great for the remainder of the trip. I was very pleased with the results.I went to New Mexico for New Year's. The camera served me well for about 2/3 of the trip, but then the lens started to not close and the display showed a lens error. I can get it to reclose by taking the battery out and in, saying voodoo and sometimes, out of desperation, pushing the lens physically.I haven't dropped or mistreated the cameras, as far as I know. The mechanism does seem very sensitive to dust. I have had a few Canon point and shoots that still operate fine and have never given me any problem. I know Nikon has a reputation for doing better in low light; I found that wasn't the case unless I used the night setting or museum (too slow for children). When it worked, I loved the S8100. However, I can't go halfway around the world and lose priceless memories to a camera that somehow easily gets scratched or won't operate without doing voodoo. I am looking for another megazoom; it will probably be a Canon. I know it won't be a Nikon. The one I have is still under warranty, but after reading other people's experiences with Nikon service, I don't know if it is worth digging up the receipt and trying to get a replacement.You will find a lot of my S8100 pictures at [...] An example of it at its best is the Oregon Coast pictures at [...]and the scratched lens pictures, many of which were still OK, are at [...]

Reviews.Title: Slippery!
Reviews.Author: kenders
Reviews.Content: Being a Nikon DSLR owner, I wanted a small camera for my pocket and all the research/blogs/reviews brought me to this camera.  I wasn't prepared for how light and smooth the camera would be.Needless to say, and much to my "I knew better", I charged it and turned it on without first using the wrist strap.  The moment I turned it on, I dropped it...onto my hardwood floor and damaged the extended lens beyond repair.  I have had my large Nikons for decades and never one drop...I wasn't ready for the exterior casing of the smaller cameras, I guess.Moral of my review:  it is very slick and should be handled with care.I still believe in the camera and will send to Nikon for repair (non-warranty, of course).  I have self-adhesive grip tape that I will but on side and bottom to help avoid future accidents!

Reviews.Title: Worked well until it broke
Reviews.Author: William Peart "Bill"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I liked this camera for 6 months until it stopped working. Even though it has a 1 year warranty NIKON wanted $129 to repair saying we had mistreated it somehow. We had not! My suggestion is buy a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100, I love it!
Reviews.Author: AndSan714
Reviews.Content: So take my review for what its worth.I am not a photo genius, but i definitley have learned a lot more since i recieved it 2 months ago.Pros:-Takes amazing pictures, crystal clear even when zoomed out.-I can control all the options i need to as a rookie.-Powers up and is ready to shoot at the blink of an eye.-Durable enough for me.-Takes amazing panoramas.-Battery Life lasts me about 2 weeks, and ever patrol i go on i am taking pictures, my job requires it.-Comes with some rad software to help with editing.-CMOS is AWESOME!Cons if you call them that:-I am still worried that the lens is going to stick out, but i clean it daily and it hasnt stuck yet.-Sometimes it takes a while focus when its in AUTO mode (only during lower light conditions).-The flash is in a funny spot, but i dont get upset about it.-Yes the power on button is small, but i can always get it turned on even when i have tactical gloves on.Granted, i am currently deployed in Afghanistan where dust is always a problem. Having a nice case is key too.. I did a lot of research and bought the Case-Logic case, which is perfect for the camera, and an extra battery or soft bristled brush to dust off the lens housing before stowing it away. I bought a camera the day i left the States to come out here, and it didnt even last 2 days... the screen cracked and couldnt turn it on...I can honestly say i am very satisfied with this purchase. I did buy it before all the cameras went on sale for Christmas, and i was bummed i didnt wait.But after a gorgeous sunset that i caputred with 7 shots and fitted to a panorama... that picture alone made the camera worth it...Definitley puts my buddies cameras to shame, and they all paid in the same price range.Crossing my fingers the lens doesnt start acting up, i will update my review if anything goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: Nikon s8100
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Schmitt
Reviews.Content: I really loved the camera... My photos are getting incredible...  It's easy to make the photos... the photos looks very natural...

Reviews.Title: Lot of research
Reviews.Author: gman
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Great in low light.  10x zoom is great for shooting the types of photo's I need to shoot.  Easy interface and quick response.  Right between the 35mm and the pocket cameras

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Balam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last March.  I'm still very happy with it.  It is a little bit challenging to take a photo when focusing on something far away, but it is a matte of getting developing a technique.

Reviews.Title: Choppy Video
Reviews.Author: Hub City Ham
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is outstanding! Still learning the functions.Do not expect quality video. Video is very "choppy" when previewed with NX2.Very hard to beat as a carry anywhere camera

Reviews.Title: Good photo quality, nice zoom
Reviews.Author: DW
Reviews.Content: We've had this for almost a year now and the photo quality has been very good. Have been using it for wildlife and birds recently and the zoom makes for some great photos. Very easy to operate for someone with dexterity issues or large hands.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot, with 1 star removing flaw
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes EXCELLENT photos for a point and shoot.  The shots out of this rival in color and sharpness that of my DSLR (when the dslr is shooting in .jpg format), unfortunately when shooting against a dslr  with this in .jpg and the dslr shooting .raw, this still won't touch a dslr BUT this probably has the best looking point and shoot photos i've seen across many brands (sony, kodak, pentax, canon, and olympus).  Unfortunately this camera seriously lacks in one major category that is important to certain people..its continuous shooting mode.The continuous shooting mode is as fast as they describe, but the flaw is that it doesn't work like other cameras.  With other cameras you hold down the button and it starts shooting (at whatever its shooting speed is such as 2.5fps) and doesn't stop until you release the button. With this camera it is much different, you hit the button once and it shoots 5 incredibly fast frames, then the whole camera locks itself up for 30seconds or so while it tries to process those images.  Its awful.  We tried to shoot various live action sports with it and it does its 5 shots in the first second or so of pushing the button, then we are stuck again for another minute, at which point if we didn't get the shot in the first 5 shots, your screwed.  I've had many cameras and this is by far the ABSOLUTE WORST implementation of continuous shooting I have ever seen.  It would be better have a slower FPS that sits and shoots 1 frame/second (like my old cannon p&s;) but a least you can hold it down for an entire sports sequence and hopefully get some of the action.BOTTOM LINE: BEAUTIFUL PICTURES AND GREAT FOR STILLS, BUT IF YOU PLAN ON TRYING TO SHOOT ANY MOVING OBJECTS FORGET ABOUT THIS CAMERA.Oh, of note, the 'so called' manual settings on this camera are very poor.  this is somewhat of a neutral thing because some people love them and others hate them.

Reviews.Title: Great pics
Reviews.Author: joevinnie
Reviews.Content: This is my second Nikon 8100.  The first one lasted about a year.  The photo quality is great. The zoom is great. I like the easy of using the various features. Even though my first one quit working (card read error) I decided  although not as durable as I would like, I could not find anything a liked more.  Hope this one lasts a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: Perfect camera with a 10X zoom. Still small enough to fit into your pocket. The quality of the pictures are great! Glad I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Solid choice for amateur photographer
Reviews.Author: hivon
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a picky photographer.  I point and shoot.  I want a camera that's easy to carry to my kids' events and all over the world.  I bought this camera simply for better zoom than my old Canon before a trip to Africa.  After about an hour with the manual, I have good enough overview of the settings.  The 10X zoom is just right, and noticeably so much better than 3X or 4X in smaller cameras.  I experimented a bit with the different megapixel settings and different built in scene settings.  To be honest, I never see a huge difference, but changing the settings is easy to master.  The menus are intuitive.  The transfer software is easy to use.  All in all, I am happy with the choice.You do have to get used to the flash popping up and putting it back down.  Not a big deal.  I like that there is a good spot for your right thumb at top of back where you are not accidentally hitting buttons.  This was definitely a problem with some Canons I looked at in the store.  It is a bit heavier and larger than back pocket size (which is where my old Canon lived at most events), but that's the tradeoff for better zoom and lens.The video quality is not exceptional but acceptable.  I'll still be taking a HD camcorder to big events.  But I use the still camera video a fair amount on trips where I will not carry a second camcorder.The battery lasted very well--better than I expected for mostly still shots.  A whole day on safari in Africa shooting right and left.By the way, I bought a cheap second battery and charger that works great so far (admittedly I have only used the second battery once, but it charged the original Nikon battery just fine for multiple uses).  [...]

Reviews.Title: Newly acquired
Reviews.Author: dancdebbie
Reviews.Content: Just recently purchased this camera and was excited about using it but had problems with this at my daughters wedding. Sometimes the camera would be able to show me my existing pictures and other times it would not. Too early to fully rate this camera yet but a little dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: Picturetastic!
Reviews.Author: Emily A. Wager "Emily W"
Reviews.Content: well worth the money! Comes with multiple settings already programed and easy enough to play with other settings. It took beautiful photos when I was out west in Wyoming.

Reviews.Title: Coopix s8100
Reviews.Author: Rm
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely not a professional photographer, people have however told me I take nice photos and they have gotten nicer since I started using my s8100. it is easy to use & has more features than I will ever use. It has a nice zoom for a camera it's size and will fit in your pocket. Has several burst modes & an awesome macro mode that takes sharp crisp photos with the lens nearly setting on the subject. Constuction and durability  seems nice. I'm hoping it will last longer than the last camera (panasonic lumix) that I bought which only lasted a 14 months before it quit working.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for a non-techie
Reviews.Author: Nancy O
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mom, who wanted a quality camera that she could handle with ease. She loves the size, the large viewscreen on the back, and how simple it is for her to operate. Takes amazing pictures and my mom can handle getting photos onto her computer and printed readily at Costco. Would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a good product for the price.  I researched point and shoot cameras and this one seemed to have a lot of good features with a good zoom without being too bulky.  Someone recommended not getting more than a 10X zoom on a point and shoot and Nikon is a respected name in cameras.  I'm pleased with the performance even though I haven't printed any pictures on photo paper yet.  My only complaint so far is that the flash is a little bit of a pain because sometimes it's not automatic, but you get used to it.  I would recommend buying this camera at about $250 or so.  I also picked up an accessory pack for about $30.

Reviews.Title: Best camera out there for the money!
Reviews.Author: Marshall O.
Reviews.Content: With the S8200 now being sold, we purchased the S8100 for $204 shipped...what a deal! This camera has all the features you look for in a compact camera, and the 10X zoom is great. The pictures came out very clear; I was impressed. The video looks great, but haven't watched them on the TV yet. The main purpose is the camera, so the video is just a bonus anyways. As stated, you will not be able to beat this camera for the price. Get one now before they are all gone!

Reviews.Title: Not a bad camera!
Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Nowak "Prophotoman"
Reviews.Content: I rated this 4 stars on the overall quality of the images and camera at this price point.  I've been a photographer since 1970 and graduated from the Navy Shool of Photography in Pensacola that year.  My wife at first did not share my interest in photography. However since we were getting ready for a two week trip to Venice, Italy, I wanted to get rid of her 5 year old P&S; digital camera.  This one seemed to fit the bill... especially at just a little over $200!  We returned from Venice this past Thursday night.  NOW she has a much greater interest in photography! Granted, this camera is no match for my Nikon D700 and my professional lenses... but it takes VERY decent images that print well at up to 8 x 10 inches. The main features that I wish this camera had was the ability to use manual aperture and shutter speed settings, or at least an aperture and shutter speed priority setting.  It would also be nice to shoot in RAW mode, but hey... this is a point-&-shoot!I worked with her on improving image composition (using the Rule of Thirds and the use of leading lines, symmetrical and asymetrical balance in her photos... she learned FAST!  She also loves the video mode!  I explained to her about how to use exposure compensation... she's got it down pat!  After we returned the other evening, I went over the images she shot. She did very well, but is still learning.  I discovered that image sharpness on this model is partially dependent on her optical zoom setting.  Still, the images are sharp enough to make sharp 5 x 7 and very slightly soft 8 x 10 prints.  The color quality is VERY good.  So if your special someone has no interest in a much more expensive DSLR camera, but does want a good camera, this is a good compromise. A very good camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Harley01
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Easy to use.  Light to carry.  Big 3.0 inch view.  Photos have nice clarity.  Simple to use the camera's many functions.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: This camera is in every way awesome! I couldnt have purchased a better one! The pictures come out remarkable. We were looking at purchasing the S9000 camera, but this one had better reviews and now I know why!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: adil farooqi
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. Takes great pictures and videos. It is definitely better than other high-end cameras that I have owned. It records great videos with stereo sound. The menu is very intuitive and user friendly.

Reviews.Title: good all-around point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: JoePark "joeparker"
Reviews.Content: Vibration reduction works pretty well.The stock battery runs out roughly after 300 shots.It's worth a spare battery if you expect to go beyond that for the day.HD video works great with 720p. But 1080p looks choppy and floaty (as it can't keep up with the pace of data stream at that limit of hardware strength).For a compact and quick picture capture, it's worth the price. Especially when you see those in the tourist sites with huge dSLRs hung around their necks:)

Reviews.Title: Great Features but flash pictures are HORRIBLE.
Reviews.Author: Edmund W. Cheung
Reviews.Content: I have gone through over 10 different point and shoot cameras over the past 13 years. I probably bought the first Sony digital camera that recorded on floppy discs for $500 in 1997.  It weighed 2 pounds but had a beautiful lens.  NOT even 1080 x 800 resolution...This Nikon S8100 is great camera and does great 1080P videos in every aspect except for 2:1) the FLASH photos shots are almost ALL overexposed and look HORRIBLE.2) the controls are NOT intuitive and are semi difficult to useI bought this camera in December 2010 and if I had to decide again, I would have / should have bought the more intuitive Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Everything incl 10x zoom and a large viewer in a small package
Reviews.Author: janet g hull
Reviews.Content: coolpix 8100 is unbelievable for size,10x zoom ,large viewer,ease of use and finished photo. I couldn't ask for more and it all fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 is totally cool
Reviews.Author: Deadwood
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)Great features and amazing flexibility. HD makes it a step above many others along with facial recognition and low light/nighttime controls. 10X zoom is wonderful.No suggestions for improvement.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed before I even got to use it
Reviews.Author: rlala
Reviews.Content: I only had the camera for a few days.  Unfortunately I noticed 2 pixels were out on the LCD display.  Sent it right back!  Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: butterflylover1
Reviews.Content: Great correspondence, prompt service. We have ordered 3 of these camera's. They give great photo quality, it has everything you would need for a great photo!

Reviews.Title: After Six Months
Reviews.Author: R. B. Daniel "bdaniel5"
Reviews.Content: After owning the 8100 for six months I really like this camera. It takes great pictures and having a mode dial is much faster than changing the mode in the menu.I also like the high speed video mode that shoots slow motion video for a few seconds. The HD video quality is great, although autofocus doesn't work well all the time for video mode. (It works perfectly for Camera mode, even for sports)I really like the compact size, it fits comfortably in my pocket.Like all compacts there is still a slight shutter delay, but it's much better than my previous compact camera, a Sony which died after about 4 years.. (BTW: my 26 year old Nikon film camera is still going strong)Here is a shot taken with the camera at June Mtn. California.It was a tough shot in that there was a mix of shadows and bright spots, I think the 8100 did a great job.[...]

Reviews.Title: BEST Digital handy!
Reviews.Author: Christian X
Reviews.Content: Hey, guess what?! the only point and shoot that satisfy your photography! I got this for my road trip, and it's fabulouuuusss! Yep, TRUE.. the HD is so TRUE [used it for almost anything] The built in mic is no good, but with external mic, you'll get an awesome video in HD..No other point and shoot can top this camera! Get it and you won't be sorry.. Oh, get it from Amazon too bc it's way cheaper! ;)

Reviews.Title: Good for getting that quick shot
Reviews.Author: MikeB "MB"
Reviews.Content: The camera has a very quick start up-to-first shot time. Also, the time between shots is very quick. Both take about a second. The flash does pop up where you normally hold it but if your finger is in the way, it tell you about it and can still take the picture. You just get use to holding the camera slightly differently. It is not a big change and not a deal breaker by any means. Overall, a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera so far!
Reviews.Author: D. Derenzo
Reviews.Content: I have owned quite a few digital cameras over the last ten years. All have taken nice pictures in well lit situations. The challenge has always been low light and indoors. So far the camera has been fantastic! I first bought the Sony WX9 which had very similar specs but was cheaper and smaller. I was extremely disappointed. I don't know if it was defective, but all I know is all indoor shots came out horrible! I also found the controls annoying, but would have lived with it if it took good pics. I then looked at this camera. It's a bit bulky, but I like how it feels in my hands. The LCD screen is amazing. The zoom is great. It takes fantastic indoor pics. Low light is very good for a compact, but don't expect miracles! You can get great deals on this camera since the 9100 came out which is basically the same camera with more zoom. I haven't tried video yet. I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: R. David Stephens
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera. The price from J&R; Music and Computer World through Amazon was amazing. Don't hesitate to buy this item.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Sandeep A. Pawar
Reviews.Content: It's a very good camera. The picture quality is good. The only cos is:- Macro does not work. It won't focus at all. Dont purchase the camera if you need to take close-up shotsOverall nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy to use
Reviews.Author: MrGPS
Reviews.Content: Pro: Great pictures.  Not much lagging times between shots.  Good for night time shots. Easy to look up the menu.Con:Thumbwheel for changing mode is cumbersome to use.

Reviews.Title: great camera,cant load pix onto win7..
Reviews.Author: Kenn Glenn "hightech lover"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera,does a great job on macro and just regular fast pictures,inside and out.Just got a new computer and for some reason it wont show the nikon when attached via the usb port,it shows it charging but cant load pictures on it. I have win7 pro loaded,any ideas what to do here? Device doesn't show in lower right ,or in computer or device manager. Not the camera's fault but really need to get this working as it did before last puter fried last week.

Reviews.Title: FOOL PROOF
Reviews.Author: waddy
Reviews.Content: the only thing i can say about my new s8100 is wow.  it is very easy to use.  a little small for a mans hands but i'm adjusting.  i take many pics of airplanes in flight and the zoom is amazing.  i love it after using 35mm yashica manual for the last 40 years.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is a cool camera
Reviews.Author: New Nikon user
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a month; it is really nice.  I like the (1) sharpness of the pictures (2) camera helps me to know when I have a good shot -- blue indicator around the person's face  (3) camera indicating when someone may have blinked so that I can retake the picture (4) camera decides when the flash is needed.  Thanks for all the favorable reviews of this camera; that is what conviced me to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money and good image quality
Reviews.Author: Jack Tup
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise to the western caribbean. I have Nikon DSLRs but wanted something that was small enough to fit in a pocket with good image quality.I would not compare IQ to any DSLR but it comes close enough for me in the sharpness category. Dead center is spot on sharp with some softness in the corners. I am completely happy with that since I use the DSLR for serious shots. The zoom is quite good and tops out at 300mm 35mm equiv. Startup time is fairly quick for its class. The ED lens helps with chromatic abberations seen with most cameras at this level. I took many shots with this camera and 90 percent came out without any post editing work needed. The meter is good, the screen is awesome and the form factor is a great fit for my hand and my wife's. The Canon-like control dial on the back is nice too. It rotates nicely to move through menus.The video is wicked cool for such a small device. I don't use it much but it works well. We had a Canon SD1400 IS that I got rid of because it was too small and the IQ was horrible. It might be fine for drunk college girls but not for vacation use.What I would like to see in this camera:Apeture Priority, Shutter Priority and RAW NEF. And maybe a Manual mode. Regardless, the Auto setting does a great job. The nightshot scene setting is ok. It seems to really bump up the ISO so it gets a bit grainy. Use a tripod for good results.Everyone seems to complain about the flash position on this camera. I found it odd at first but just learned to not put my hand over the flash area. Simple enough.Great camera for the money. Reliable and if it gets dropped you don't lose thousands of dollars on equipment.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cyn15790
Reviews.Content: I have only had it a couple days but I love it.  Easy to work.  I've taken several videos with it and it was simple to do.  It shipped fast.  Only thing I'm not to happy about it the cover for where you plug in the cord for charging.  It seems kind of flimsy and probably will not last.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: T. Triol
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this camera. It takes pictures without a delay, which was my wife's biggest complaint about our old one. The pictures are extremely sharpand the videos are great. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: looks nice, works OK
Reviews.Author: dorydan
Reviews.Content: I have used the Nikon S8100 for 3 months.  It could be a GREAT camera with the following: variable speed zoom, manual aperatue and manual shutter speed, and a viewfinder for those sunny days.  Instead, it is a nice looking but fairly vanilla point and shoot.  The zoom is nice.  I don't mind the slighly large size.  I don't mind the flash position that everyone seems to dislike.  The macro is fantastic in camera and movie mode and I would say that plus the zoom are the camera's best features. Come on -- please --somebody build a high quality small format for the days the SLR can't go!  Today, I am sending to repair shop - lens will not retract!?!?

Reviews.Title: Wooo Hooo!!!
Reviews.Author: WheatBread TastyJam
Reviews.Content: Ok so I had a Sony SLR camera which was very big and bulky to carry around to parties and various events.  So I wanted a camera that was compact and could take great pictures quickly without being overly complicated to operate. Its great for the "Oh my girlfriend is looking hot next to those dancers...giggady!!" (SNAP) or "Awww this is such a precious moment!!" (SNAP)This camera pretty much answered the call.  Picture quality is superb (High MGPX).  There are times however that it can act a liiiiittle fuzzy when taking portraits or if you're not still enough.  I'm still getting a handle on it.  It's not quite as fast as I would have liked but if your a casual shooter then this is perfect.  The video quality is also very good, catches the sound pretty good too.  Haven't tried the HDMI out yet though (sorry folks)...The camera handles well in low light situations and there are enough controls that you can get the right effect if you want and take the time to learn and experiment.The casing is good quality and handles well. The camera is a little on the heavier side but that because it's quality baby!! The only part I don't like is the flash is placed in a position where your finger would intuitively hold the camera...VERY ANNOYING.  It's one of those pop-up flashes (like are you serious?).  The usability engineer should've screamed on that design flaw.  Other than that I really love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great compromise
Reviews.Author: Charles Thompson
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced photographer and normally use a full-size DSLR (D300s, D200, etc.) when shooting special projects, but often don't want to take all that gear along when I travel. A couple of years ago I bought a small point-and-shoot (S230) which worked very well when outdoors in good light and was very, very portable, fitting easily into any pocket I had. However, I was unhappy with pictures taken in low-light. Even when I kept the ISO from climbing above 200 and held the camera reasonably steady, low-light pics were usually fairly grainy and/or blurred somewhat due to motion. So when the S8100 came along I decided to try it and am very glad that I did. Performance is exceptional compared to my earlier point-and-shoot (although the sensor size is identical), daylight pics are great, and the low-light problems that I was experiencing with the older S230 have disappeared. The compromise is that it is a little larger but still fits into the front pocket of my Levis (it will fit in my shirt pocket also, but its weight makes it a little uncomfortable there). Although I am primarily a still photographer, I have tried the video on several occasions and find that works well also. It all depends what you're looking for, of course, but if you want something that takes very, very good pictures but for whatever reason you can't handle the weight and size of the DLSR, this camera is an excellent compromise.

Reviews.Title: Love my new nikon coolpix s8100
Reviews.Author: stedder
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera, its easy to use and takes awesome pictures ! I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Our first good camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Walikainen
Reviews.Content: It's been a great purchase. Super photos on a recent trip. The flash pops up where you put your finger, but you get used to it. I highly recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: grama
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Easy to use.  Got this camera the day before we left on vacation.  So simple and we got fantastic pictures in San Diego.  My husband thought I was getting way to much confidence in the zoom, but my pictures turned out great especially for a point and shoot. My husband who has never been a picture taker even started taking the camera from me.  He took great shots.  So happy with the low light pictures too.  Wish it had a view finder, but most point and shoots don't.  So hard to find the perfect camera, but am real happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: The BEST
Reviews.Author: fikir
Reviews.Content: I have few digital cameras, but this one is the best ever. It is very easy to use and very compact with professional quality pictures. I love it, LOVE IT. I bought it very cheap from AMAZON.COM.  I have 16 months old son who i took the best pictures of him with this incredible camera. I recommend this camera for everybody who wants to capture best pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is a fairly good camera for the price. The only complain I have is that the camera is not suitable for fast moving objects like sports. Other than that, I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Not an Expert, But an Enthusiast
Reviews.Author: J. Abbott "[lollirotti]"
Reviews.Content: I love taking photos. This camera makes it simple. I enjoy all the options and the zoom is spectacular. The pictures are crisp. Truly happy with my camera.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: lexo
Reviews.Content: Great all around camera. Nice picture and video. Very fast in low light. Only negative is the pop-up flash but I'll get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic point & shoot !
Reviews.Author: D. Osborne "C D Osborne"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 3 months now and so far it is the best point & shoot camera I have owned and I have owned several !The picture quality is fantastic.  The low light shooting is great for a point & shoot.  You just need to learn about the camera and what the different scenes and adjustments do.  The LCD screen is one of the best I have ever seen and is of high quality.The 10x zoom is very good although I would like to have seen from a 12 to 15, but then the picture quality may have suffered.  The build quality is great !  It feels like a high end camera and doesn't have that cheap plastic feel.  I also like the fact it has a HDMI port.The video is very good although not great.  The biggest problem with the video is that you can hear the noise of the zoom when you zoom in & out during video shooting.  It's not a deal breaker and it's not that bad, but just be aware that you can hear the zoom.  The other 2 things that I'm not happy with, is the charging system and no manual mode.There are plenty of adjustments to get great pictures and I guess if you want more adjustments then maybe you should think about a DSLR.  The charging system means you have to leave the battery in the camera to charge it.  Why Nikon didn't include a stand a lone charger with this camera is beyond me. But I found a charger with a car adapter and a 2nd Nikon battery for only $26 here on Amazon so that takes care of that.I've read where some were having problems with blurry pictures...........I have had no problems with that at all !  Again, the picture quality is fantastic for a compact point & shoot !It starts up quick and is very quick between shots.  Which is a result of the CMOS sensor it has which is also why it is good in low light conditions.I highly recommend this camera if you are looking for a point & shoot that takes fantastic pictures, and has pretty good video capabilities with a good zoom, and is well built that will fit in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable low-light performance
Reviews.Author: Frederick Koehler "Causual Kite Flyer"
Reviews.Content: So far, so good.  Reasonable size (fits in pocket). Happy with photos -- noted bright, deep colors.  Excellent features for low-light photography -- including a double-exposure mode to capture that great sunset with your foreground subjects illuminated with flash.  Basic features are intuitive and easily within reach. With extreme shots, only very minor chromatic aberration and have not noted issues blooming. Time from power-on to first shot is good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera if youre looking for a hybrid between DSLR and Compact
Reviews.Author: Hilltoptx
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas and love it! It is really nice and pretty compact for the amount of zoom it offers. It is also really quick (start up and shutter speed). It takes excellent pictures and the video quality is really stunning. Uploading them to the computer is a breeze too. The black is a matte color and personally I like the feel and look. It doesn't show finger prints all over it due to there being no glossy areas to put your fingers on other than the screen. I couldn't find a camera case to fit it (I read in quite a few places that most places, even Nikon, adverstising that their case fit the S8100 when it actually didnt). So I went to Best Buy, only because I had a coupon!, and bought a lowepro case designed for larger cameras and it fit perfectly with room leftover for my memory cards and USB cable.One of my biggest concerns in the flash on the camera. It flips up, but it is in a spot where you put your left index finger, so it takes some time to get used to leaving your index finger just barely on the camera. But other than that, its wonderful.For those who want a slim and easy to carry camera, this isn't particularly the one you should look at since it is slightly larger volume wise. But for those looking for a pretty compact camera with exceptional shutter speed, picture/video quality, and a quality product, this is the camera for you. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: An excellent versatile point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: William Lee Bynum
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little camera.  I've used it in a variety of settings (candelit concert in a church, snow, coffehouse) and it invariably produces sharp, crisp images.  The camera has a number of built in photo environments (Museum, Night Portrait, Snow, Food, etc), but the Auto mode seems to work pretty well in most situations.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: This is the best point and shoot camera. This is my third camera,all different brands,but this is great in low light and great if you have a shakie hand.Picture quality is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money-close ups with flash it too much some times
Reviews.Author: anderson
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the 8100, we had an 8000 and it was great also.  Great pictures and easy to use.  Auto settings work well.  Will make good pictures in low light situations and in total darkness if necessary. In real estate we make pictures in vacant houses with no power and this is a great asset.  On very close up shots, we have experienced almost too much light.  Flash pop up is new but getting use to it.  We have 2 yr old Grandson who enjoys having his picture made as much an any 2 yr old.  It grabs a quick picture when we need it.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: nat
Reviews.Content: very easy to start using.  battery already had some charge in it.  didn't have to do a thing to take my first pictures.  so far i've only used it for family photos, so no opportunity to use some of the features for landscape photos (my reason for getting the 10x zoom).  only complaint is the pop up flash, i have a tendancy to rest my balancing fingers over it, and have had to retake several photos due to no flash.  other than that, pretty compact and excellent quality.  would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Abhilash
Reviews.Content: The package didnt contain the leather pouch or 4GD SDHC card as promised at the checkout.But, the product was intact, brand new and with all other packaging items. Image quality is superb and one will love it..

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Camera
Reviews.Author: D E N "D-man"
Reviews.Content: This camera is well worth the price. excellent pictures and video. I used it (for 1st time) at my son's college graduation with excellent results. This camera is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great portable camera w/ awesome video
Reviews.Author: E. Jahner "E."
Reviews.Content: I had a larger more professional 7mp camera in the past and found myself leaving it behind when I went places with my wife and kids.  This camera does the trick at portability and takes great pictures for a hand-held pocket sized camera.  My wife likes the point and shoot without thinking part and I feel it has enough shooting modes and settings that I can take professional quality pictures.The camera starts up fast and is quick from shot to shot.  The screen is bright and clear and the movie feature is easy to use and takes awesome video.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: bbe
Reviews.Content: HD video OK, quality of images better thn waited, it's a great camera, good size, good value. I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: fun new camera
Reviews.Author: K. B. O'Connor "loves  2  read"
Reviews.Content: really like this camera. Takes great night time pics, people and xmas lights. Really good party pics. haven't used it for panoramic views but will update. Only drawback is the pop up flash. what were they thinking? I'm sure I'll get used to this but it is inconvenient and annoying. haven't tried the video part.

Reviews.Title: Love it!  So much better than my other cameras!
Reviews.Author: acrawfords2
Reviews.Content: I have had 3 different cameras since the beginning of the digital camera age, and this one is by far the best!  I can take pictures so much faster than before and don't have to wait to look at the picture or for it it process.  It is not as small as my last camera but definitely more compact than my first.  The zoom is phenomenal!  I sat in my kitchen and took a picture of one ornament on the tree in the family room, and I could see the clarity as if I were right in front of it!  The continuous shots I took were a little blurry, but I think with some practice, this may improve.  As stated in some other reviews, the flash comes up where your finger typically rests, but I have just learned to move my finger out of the way.  Just something to get used to.  After reading the reviews on several different sites and looking at ratings, this camera is well worth the money!  I am just glad I can have a compact camera that takes next to SLR pictures.  Perfect in every way!Update 10/28/11:  Still love it, but I ran over it with my van!  It still took pictures, but I had no clue what I was taking pictures of.  Needless to say, I am buying my second one right now!  Maybe I will buy red this time, just for the fun of it!

Reviews.Title: Can do away with my video camera!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This is what the video and photo cameras are coming to.  This camera takes great pictures and video in HD 1080p looks good too.  Loaded it to my computer and did a quick edit on my Pinnacle 14 looks great in HD.

Reviews.Title: Tough to beat
Reviews.Author: Fureinku
Reviews.Content: I typically carry a Canon 40D and a 1DmkII but i wanted something smaller to carry around. Something I wouldnt have to make an insurance claim on if it were lost or stolen.  For the features, this camera is hard to beat, the automatic scenes do what they are supposed to quick, and easy. Even the burst shots, HDR and the lowlight shots are quick, you dont even notice how many shots the camera has taken until they process and merge for the final product. Image quality is top notch for a point and shoot. It doesnt have any manual controls so if you are looking for pro features this isnt for you. But if you already have a 4/3rds, or DSLR.. this makes a great pocket camera!My only complaint, which ill agree with someone else on.. is the flash placement. You wouldnt think it would get in the way, but i find my self often seeing the error "flash not fully raised" because my finger is blocking it.

Reviews.Title: Just in Time for Christmas!
Reviews.Author: Peter M. Mastrola "Peter M."
Reviews.Content: We received the camera "on time" for Christmas and took a lot of photos and videos.  The camera is very user friendly and took great pictures.  The small size and powerful optical / digital zooms are great features.  Excellent quality and value.  We can't wait to go on vacation with it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: SomeGuy2 "SomeGuy"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Nikon S3000 which I had bought in July 2010 with the S8100 Dec 2010. This unit is all that I hoped it would be. Sold my S3000 for $50 and glad to be rid of it. This is my fourth digtal camera and third Nikon.Still haven't read the S8100 instruction booklet and getting am awsome results regardless. Some over exposure on closeups in dim light but otherwise one fantastic camera ! No complaints EXCEPT my left finger stopping the flash window from raising now and then. I hope Nikon figures out how to move the flash gizmo elsewhere.All in all a must have / buy compact camera !

Reviews.Title: I like this camera
Reviews.Author: Karine
Reviews.Content: The camera has a great zoom, takes a very good photos and I like it because the photos are very sharp

Reviews.Title: Great camera, except for ergonomics.
Reviews.Author: jroybean
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this camera overall.  Two things I would redesign.  The popup flash can easily and inadvertently be held down by the left hand without the user realizing what has happened.  This problem could have easily be avoided by eliminating the popup feature.  Second, the battery compartment lid seems very cheap and has a awkward latch.Beware the free Kingston 4GB flash card offered by some merchants.  That brand is not approved by Nikon for use in this camera according to their customer service representative and the handbook.  Could be a problem if warranty issues arise.All-in-all, would not hesitate to buy again.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera, mediocre image quality, poor controls
Reviews.Author: Bigbillyt "A Consumer"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S8100 is an okay little camera. For me it was not worthwhile due to two simple factors. The controls were poor and very simplistic. Also the image quality was very sub-par. In many instances just to make simple exposure tweaks you have to go several levels deep in the menu system. I could forgive the lack of control if the image quality was spectacular, but it is far from it. Low light performance was particularly dissapointing, and white balance was very eratic. Again, I don't mind relying on auto and scene modes on a point and shoot but those modes have to do at least a decent job of interpreting the scene.Sorry Nikon, going back to canon brand.

Reviews.Title: what a dissapointment
Reviews.Author: C. Shearer
Reviews.Content: First, i realized that your finger gets in the way when you hold the camera, so your flash wont pop up. I read that in other reviews but thought it would be worth it if I was careful. Then the flash cover (plastic) fell off because it is only glued on, and in Mass we have humidity and heat... the glue simply didnt hold. I delt with it because the shots were good and I spent 250.00... 3rd, the lens opening would get stuck on occation... I tapped it and shut it on and off tapping the lens cover several times and it would unstick. I delt with it... Then I went to go use it, and no screen. nothing. camera done. 250.00 less than a year, so many issues OMG really? I have had cheapos from walmart lasting 20 years, I also own $2000 cameras and never an issue, btw they are canon's, but wanted a small light weight camera and nikon was suppose to be good. going back to canon. im so disgusted and after reading nikon help center reviews I now know not to bother even calling. I also looked at the newer model just out of curiousity... ugly to boot.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Justin Giaquinto
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera exactly a year ago and it last about 3 months before the lens gets all tangled up because it's waaaaaay too intricate. I sent it to get fixed within the warranty and had the worst customer service dealing with Nikon. They actually sent the camera back completely smashed wrapped in paper towels and rubber bands in worse condition than it was. I did finally receive a new camera (I think) in February (two months after I initially sent it in). Now it's June and the same problem with the lens is happening again. So, I'm trashing this camera and going to stick with an iphone or something for taking pictures. Sorry Ashton Kutcher.Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: This is a good camera
Reviews.Author: sparky1 "sparky1"
Reviews.Content: We just needed an every day digital camera that wasn't so bulky you don't want to cary it. I'm not a professional photographer, just an average Joe looking for a decent camera. This works for just that reason. I've had it for a few weeks now and don't have any complaints. The menu's are simple and there are enough options on it to do what I need but not so many that I can't operate it. Plus the camera is light and slim.

Reviews.Title: Amazing 1080HD video clips
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small point and shoot camera with more than usual zoom, the bonus with this camera is the 1080HD video. I had been using a Canon S5IS 8mp camera with a 12x optical zoom. I liked it, but was looking for a purse/pocket sized camera with similar features minus the bulk. My daughter has this Nikon Coolpix S8100 and I was impressed with her pictures for the size of her camera. Hers was a gift from her husband, an engineer, who does his homework before opening his wallet. This Nikon camera has 12.1mp, and 10x optical zoom, but what cinched this for me was the 1080, not 720 HD video clips. Also, you can zoom while taking clips. For the price you get so much more than other point and shoot cameras. I don't have the patience to read the software and I don't like that cameras only come with a quick start book and the details are in the software, but I had no problems taking pictures right out of the box. I'm having a little problem figuring out the flash. Sometimes the flash pops up when I want to use existing light. I'm sure there's a way to do this, but I just haven't figured it out yet. I'm still in the learning process and, as I said, I'm not very patient. I have had some blurry pictures, but that's most likely the fault of the photographer, not the camera. I just take lots of pictures and delete the duds. Battery life hasn't been a problem. My other cameras operated on NiCad batteries and I was leary of lithium batteries, but I bought a backup battery. I'm very satisfied with this camera with so many features for the money. I chose the gold color so I can recognize my camera quickly at gatherings where all of the black cameras are sitting on a table. My daughter has the red one. ;) This would have been a perfect camera if it had an optical view finder. Unfortunately that little feature seems to be obsolete and the lcd view finder is hard to see on a sunny day. I'm getting used to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Niveadog
Reviews.Content: Got my Nikon for trip to England. It was everything i hoped it would be.  The 10x zoom provides great versatility.

Reviews.Title: Great thing to buy
Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: I'm just an average user, hoping to find a digital camera with characters such as big LCD screen, good image and video quality, light, good-looking and easy-use. If your preferences are similar to mine, this is definitely the digital camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: my first Nikon
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Bond "Hello Winslow"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Nikon and first CMOS camera. I am very pleased with the low light results. I shoot a lot of concerts and so far I am getting much better results than with my Fujis1800. The zoom is okay, and I have gotten the lens error a couple of times, but I think the humidity may have played a part in that this past weekend. Uploading is a snap-I haven't quite got the hang of all the functions yet, still learning. Not sure if I will miss all the manual settings I had with my Fuji, probably not. The HD video is really good and is easy to edit and polish up with the new Windows Live Movie Maker that comes with Windows 7.Another good plus for this camera is that the size is deceiving, so I can bring this into venues where I couldn't bring my Fuji because security would confuse the Fuji with professional SLRs and at a glance they think the Nikon is a simple point and shoot with minimal zoom. I love the gold color I selected as well.sample of some shots-[...][...][...]

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: jesse gray
Reviews.Content: I was very dissatisfied when I started playing with this camera.  When I used the flash, all my pictures where washed out.  So I turned off the flash and all my pictures where blurry.  I then adjusted the ISO, like some others suggested, but then the image quality became very poor.  When taking pictures with the flash I noticed many times that my finger was in the way of the flash popping up.  I bought this camera because the reviews said this camera had low shutter lag, however I did not find this to be true.  It took between 1/2 second and 2 seconds to focus and take a picture.  I would not recommend this camera to anyone that wants to take pictures of little kids or pictures in low light.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100 Don't lend it out.
Reviews.Author: alphabear
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I am very happy with most aspects of the camera although I haven't had time to thoroughly evaluate it.  My friend enjoys the shake reduction which saves her quite a few pictures.  Viewfinder image very crisp.  Pictures excellent.  Only flaw is that I tend to hold the camera with my left fingers on the top of the case, but that prevents the flash from popping up.Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)I had considered a DSLR, but thought that this model would probably do almost anything I wanted.  However, I may have to buy another camera anyway as my friend doesn't want to part with the S8100.  This is also the reason that I haven't explored all the features of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Windi.G
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before going on an 11-day cruise with my husband.  It was perfect!  It's small enough to fit in my purse or my husband's pockets, the resolution is great for pictures and video, and it has just enough zoom.  We bought an extra battery, just in case we would need a spare, but we never did.  The flash can be a little bit of a pain until you get used to it, but it wasn't a big deal for us.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Full features in a small size
Reviews.Author: Lisa SS "Javapie3"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few weeks now and I do agree with most of the reviews except for the video portion.  I haven't tried to shoot video with the camera yet and really wouldn't except for a quick clip here and there.  So far I've found the picture quality to be excellent, but do agree the flash does pop up where your fingers are naturally place when holding.  I've also notice the flash is too bright and will wash out your subject as previously mentioned in some situations so you need to either play with the exposure or change your setting to compensate.  Otherwise I find the camera excellent in the other features, size, and portability.  This is why I give this camera a 4 of 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: Great "Multipurpose" and  Small Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Carlos Garcia CCS-400097
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, I don't even qualify as an "aficionado". However, like many people I like to take pictures during family and social events. Besides that, I found out a while ago that taking pictures of what is registered in whiteboards during consulting work sessions is an important part of my preferred method to "get the picture". In both cases, I was getting tired of the poor quality of the pictures taken (and the associated difficulties for the working purpose) with my old point and shoot digital camera (low resolution and poor optical zoom, among other things). So I decided to upgrade, not to a professional camera, but to a better one. I look for it in Amazon marketplace and the Nikon S8100 is it. I have already received it and, so  far, I am getting great results for both purposes, familiy and work. Very intuitive, great functionality and better yet great quality pictures. Not bad for a non professional or aficionado with a "multipurpose" digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: BDC
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was supposed to be fast and take good low light pictures. It failed at both! I went back to the Cannon SX130IS which is a much better camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: Gary Cooper
Reviews.Content: Have been disappointed with this camera.  First Nikon S8100 camera had a defective lens and was replaced by Amazon.  Second Nikon S8100 camera takes no better pictures than the Pentax Optio S45 camera that I already have. The Nikon S8100 should come with a written operator's manual rather than a software C/D that has to be viewed on a computer screen.  I don't like the battery and battery charger set-up either.  Battery life is too short and the battery has to be in the camera for it to recharge.  On a scale of 1 to 10,  I would give Amazon a 10 and the Nikon S8100 about a 3.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Starowicz
Reviews.Content: I have never owened a better camera. The battery life is great, the picture quality is great, it is a complete package. I will never buy another brand again. I have used cannon and kodak and I have to say this camera is by far the easiest to use. I am no professional photographer so I am happy I can get a grat picture with the touch of a button and I don't have to play with the settings or anything.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera. Pop up Flash is Designed in Wrong Place
Reviews.Author: R. Feenstra
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, compact camera.  The pictures turn our relatively clear. The video works well, although it has trouble focusing at times.  The flash popup design is flawed, however.  The flash pop up is right where you naturally place your finger to take a shot.  I eventually got used to it, but every time I had someone else take a photo, inevitably their finger would inhibit the flash from popping up.

Reviews.Title: I tried to be positive, but...
Reviews.Author: E. Gurel
Reviews.Content: Overall, a wonderful camera with excellent quality photos, great zoom, good size, CMOS chip allows for awesome night shots (for better visibility only.  Beware!  See comment number 4 below!!) I also like the separate video button, rather than having to select "video" on the dial then press record.Critiques:1) Flash is in a weird spot - placed right where I would steady the camera with my non-dominant hand.  But I quickly got used to it and trained myself to place my hand elsewhere.2) Flash can easily wash out the subject if you are too close.3) Have to change the battery IN the camera.  So the camera becomes unavailable during that time.  I understand you can buy a separate battery-charger...for more $$$ of course.  Or if you are on vacation and wish to use it every day, just prepare ahead of time by buying a spare battery and make sure both are charged every night so that you have fresh fully-charged batteries come morning.4) BIGGEST COMPLAINT BY FAR:  Although the camera takes great pictures in in dimly lit rooms in terms of visibility (awesome nightshot of an old town street in exas - looks like it was still dusk), but the camera is a horrific disaster when it comes to clarity!!!! Blur blur blur blur blur.  I've gotten used to grainy pictures in dimily lit rooms (and ironically this camera does a wonderful job at improving that, so that it's usually a non-issue.) But that benefit is completely eliminated by the fact that the pictures are blurry.  Not soft...blurry!  Did I mention the pictures in a dimly-lit room come out blurry?  I had to return it.  Don't care how good the pictures are when you use the camera in the sun.  I cherish all shots in all locations at all times, and the camera's inability to take even relatively-clear pictures has made the camera useless to me.FYI: I've read reviews that some were able to pseudo-compensate via manual controls, but when the moment is there, you want to capture it quick...right?  Also, some may "gently" suggest that I quit whining and splurge on a DSLR or something - and I would agree - but I've seen pictures from a point-n-shoot Canon SX120 of kids in dimly lit rooms and they came out sharp every time!

Reviews.Title: A fine camera if you don't zoom while recording video
Reviews.Author: Nhan Ho
Reviews.Content: I like this camera's size, look, touch and feel, and features. Its recorded video is not bad.  However the camera  will record noise from your zooming action. Also its USB connection is at the bottom of the camera so it cannot stand upright while being charged or connected to a TV or computer.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but shop around for deals
Reviews.Author: LMM
Reviews.Content: This camera is not inexpensive, and I mistakenly assumed it would come with accessories. It came with a cable to attach to my computer and a battery. It did not come with a case, or a charger (my last camera did so I did not even think about it). Now I have to buy a case, a charger and another battery as the one it came with did not hold a charge for long. After looking around on this site I now see that there are several companies that sell packages with the accessories - for less than what I paid for the camera alone.The camera itself is larger than I expected, and the placement of the flash is awkward - you have to retrain yourself to cradle the camera and not hold the top left corner where the flash pops up. The pictures and features so far are very nice.

Reviews.Title: S8100,not perfect
Reviews.Author: Robinson
Reviews.Content: This is my first Nikon camera.Actually,I have been using several Canons.I tried two Nikon cameras but felt no good.This time,I was attracted by the outlooking of S8100 and the amazing LCD.Today I receive it but I also find its problem only after half day:(.Sometimes,it is difficult to focus well especially when using around 10X lens!I don't know why!Begain to regret and think about returning it ot Amazon--------

Reviews.Title: Not Up To The Hype
Reviews.Author: t&c; mom
Reviews.Content: Not thrilled with the camera.  The video so far is awful,  anything indoors is too dark to be viewable.  Pix are only so-so.  I had a little refurbished cheapo camera casio exilim that died and tried to replace it with this-BIG disappointment. Also when i read about the bad positioning of the flash i didn't pay that much attention to it but I can't believe it made it out the door designed like that!  Not worth it in my opinion.  Try something else.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressive & Overpriced
Reviews.Author: rooster_ranch
Reviews.Content: For [...], you would think this would be a phenomenal camera.  It's not.  We used it over Thanksgiving, many shots had to be retaken because of orange hues, fuzziness, red eyes, not true to color, weird white spots on people's clothes and in the background, too low of light, then the flash can be too bright and wash out faces, etc.  Also it's bulky and heavy.  Worst of all the flash button is on the top left-hand corner and it pops up for some reason when the picture is being taken, (instead of being flush on the front like most modern cameras).  The spot the flash button is in, it is always being covered by the finger of whoever is holding the camera getting ready to take the picture.  Then the picture has to be retaken b/c the flash didn't go off. Also the 5 in a row shot feature isn't great because it doesn't use a flash and the sequence of five pictures just turn out blurry like cell phone pics.  We really wanted to like this camera but we will be returning it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: What a waste!
Reviews.Author: D. Angle
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research to replace our 6 year old Fujifilm, this looked to be a great replacement.  I couldn't have been more wrong. I bought it in Jan. and  used it for our son's birthday party. I had taken then card out right before we left for the party to download and delete the pictures on it. I completely forgot about it and left it in the computer at home and ended up buying one on the way. It wasn't until the very end, and after taking 100 pictures that the camera told me the card needed to be formatted.  I don't know why it let us take so many pictures - I've never had a camera do that. EVER. We had no pictures from the party...I was so, so disappointed.So, I formatted the card.We then took it to Disney for our vacation in February and was really disappointed in the quality of pictures. They were all out of focus!  ALL OF THEM!  I was so irritated.  To get some decent pictures from our vacation I order the Disney photos, which could have paid for a new camera. :(I just recently sent it in, after I dropped it and the lens wouldn't retract.  If I never see it again, I won't be disappointed.  If they do fix it, I'll give it to my kids and let them play with it. It's just not worth it.  I'm just disappointed that it was hyped so much and it doesn't hold up to its name.  I think I'll stick to Canon's from now on (my two Canon SLRs (film and digital)still work beautifully).

Reviews.Title: Don't like
Reviews.Author: Moni
Reviews.Content: A very regular camera, from time to time the flash damage, send to the factory and tell me that is worth under more than worth the camera, not like me or the camera, or the brand and especially the service the factory, different from canon that damage to a display I changed it and the cost was very low, so if it was good service.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Control on Packaging
Reviews.Author: Ricky D
Reviews.Content: Looked forward to receiving this Camera as my old Sony has problems. Consumer Reports had a good rating for this Camera. Unfortunately although the Camera was received on time and the shipping carton was intact...the Camera Box itself sustained damage..crushed corner and top of box had a large hole... so there was no way of determining whether the Camera itself was also damaged in some way as it was not tested. Amazon was nice enough to process a replacement and refund but only time will tell if this Camera was worth the wait. There is some concern that a damaged Camera box would be shipped that way. There should be absolutely no reason to ship an item and its contents in and with a damaged box. It all points to very poor quality control. A followup review of the Camera itself will be forthing.

Reviews.Title: High Expectations? It's a Dud
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy my Nikon Coolpix S8100 from Amazon, but I wanted to review the product, yet found it strange how it isn't anywhere online to be purchased except for here on Amazon. I'm an aspiring/learning photographer, and I don't have the money to get a bigger or more professional camera, so I have to settle for digital point-and-shoots. I try not to be nit-picky about the camera, but there are instances where the quirks and defects really get on my last nerve.At first, the camera was okay, but within the first week, I noticed some problems; one was the focusing in the video. I was filming horses at the WA State Horse Expo and the camera's focus was going berserk, the blur getting so bad that you couldn't make out anything. Also, if I play the video back, I can hear an irate, intense clicking or ticking sound INSIDE the camera, and it gets so loud, you can barely here anything going on in the video itself.As far as taking pictures, it's okay, I suppose. The quality is fine, but again some focus issues interfere every now and then, often for no reason at all. I've lost count how many times I've tried to capture macro shots of flowers or even spiders, and the shot would always be blurry and out of focus, and here I'd be pointing my camera only centimeters away from a bug or spider, and it still wouldn't focus, even with the lens being clean!In the advertisements on TV, the camera is hailed as working so well in low light, no flash is necessary; oh sure, if you hold the camera impossibly, inhumanly still, the picture will turn out okay in low-light, but 99% of the time, the picture will be deluded with glows and shaky blurs. No matter what format you put the camera in, there are some things that are IMPOSSIBLE to take clear pictures of--such as anything in an arena or any other such enclosure, anything in low-light, anything moving too fast, the moon or any nighttime photography, and don't even get me started on fireworks! Even in the "Fireworks" format, the pictures turn out like crap; the shutter speed is nowhere near fast enough to catch an exploding firework without distorting it and making it look ridiculous (though I will admit, despite the distortion and messiness, I've had some interesting and almost cool pictures come out of trying to capture fireworks). Oh, another thing this camera was praised for was its high-zoom ability. Yeah, it can zoom in quite a ways, but at a certain point, the picture becomes awfully grainy and pixelated.
