I wasn't too pleased when the pictures I took of some distant bull elk turned out blurry and grainy because I zoomed in as close as I could.The good things about this camera? It's relatively easy to use. Although it isn't very dynamic to meet a photographer's needs, it does take decent pictures. There are times the camera even surprises me; I've managed to take some good pictures of sunsets and structures even from a moving car (as long as it wasn't at night and the window was clean or down). I suppose it's an alright camera for someone who isn't into photography as a hobby, but all-in-all, it's just a dud. Totally not worth the $290 I paid for it. >.<

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: svin AZ
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 12/24/10.  I was happy with the picture quality the few times I used it (probably half a dozen times, it mostly sat in a drawer).  When I went to use it a couple weeks ago it wouldn't turn on.  I ordered 2 new batteries & still nothing.  I sent it to Nikon and was informed it would cost $105.24 to repair It's not like I wore it out, or dropped it, it just died.  They didn't even say what was wrong with it, just a "Rank B2" repair.  It appears from other reviews that this camera has some serious defects.  Shame on Nikon for not offering a cheaper fix.  This camera cost us $220.  WHY ON EARTH would I throw another $100 at this camera? I was upgrading when I purchased it & Nikon had a good reputation.  The camera it replaced had been dropped & the hinge on the door that held the SD card broke.  It still worked though!  In fact EVERY CAMERA I have ever owned STILL WORKS except for this one.  Since Nikon doesn't care about customer satisfaction, the only recourse I have is to let others know about my experience....which I intend to do through every social media outlet available to me.  I just ordered a new camera with similar options for less than they wanted for the repair and I will have another year warranty.  DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CAMERA unless you intend it to be a disposable one.  I will never buy another Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA EVER!
Reviews.Author: Francisco Perez
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera about 6 months ago. The camera stopped focusing after 1 week. Returned it to Amazon and got a replacement. The same problem appeared with the replacement after a few months. Now the Amazon guarantee is not in effect, and when returned to Nikon, they replied that this is not covered under their guarantee (surely, because this problem happens so often to their cameras that it wouldn't be worth it). In sum, better buy another brand!!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: KB "kelvin"
Reviews.Content: I don't usually leave any review, especially a negative one.  With this camera, I feel I have to because it is very bad.One reason I purchased this camera was its price and features (if they ever worked).  Second of all, I own a Nikon D90 for about 3 years and love it.  I figured I shall get a smaller one for the family so they can carry it and take pictures anywhere.  But I was very disappointed.The color reproduction was very bad, especially in low light condition with the flash on.  I needed to reduce the exposure 3 steps in order to reduce white out condition.  The colors in both the still pictures and video were not good at all.  The blue hue always seemed to be missing.The other problem was the mechanical lense.  Sometimes the camera would not focus.  "Lense Error" started occurring a couple months after we bought it.  The lense would jam at the extended position.  We had to shut down the camera and let it recycle itself to retract the lense.  The frequency of this failure started to increase as time went by.  Ten months later, the lense refused to retract and permanently stuck in the full extend position.  It is completely broken!!I replaced it with a Panasonic Lumix SZ7 and it is 100 times better!!I am very disappointed in the point and shoot Nikon and vow not to get another one again!  They must improve the quaility in their point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Extreme focusing problems, imposible to shot a decent video
Reviews.Author: Neo
Reviews.Content: Title speaks enough. Imposible to take videos. Even when taking photo it is really hard to focus, takes long time. No flexibility on any option. But takes amazing macro shots. it is even posible to see a pixel with all the green blue and red parts of it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S8100
Reviews.Author: R. Varnum
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but it really stinks that I had to print off 220 pages of the manual.  It's bulky and irritating to use.  I've always liked the small manuals that come with cameras so I can easily carry it with me for quick reference. THis is a real pain.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: blevins
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes great pictures, is a good size, and works quickly.  The battery has great endurance.  I dont mind how the flash needs to pop up, it was an easy adjustment to make.  Very happy with this purchase, especially for $200.

Reviews.Title: High Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: K. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and operation of this camera were just what I was looking for.  It has a quick shutter, pictures are clear.  Another positive is not having to remove the battery for charging. Battery life has been great as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase/Excellent Seller
Reviews.Author: Dorothea Sharp
Reviews.Content: At first, I was concerned that this little camera would be what I was looking for to use. However, after having been using it often and seeing such wonderful results, I am very satisfied and happy! It was recommended by a friend for the type of photographer that I am and it is exactly as described. The seller had it to me very quickly and I am extremely satisfied with their packaging and quality of product!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Liana
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera (Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP)and found it excellent. Photos taken at night look incredibly bright! The image is very good. And the camera is light! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: SUCH a great camera!
Reviews.Author: campphotog
Reviews.Content: Photo and screen quality are amazing, zoom is impressive for a compact camera, the navigation wheel is very handy and startup is quick! I get a lot of complements on this camera and questions of "where can I get one?" and it got only a tiny chip when it fell four feet onto concrete. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Steve Cowan
Reviews.Content: Good product, video easy to use, only negatives are the flash is on the lt side and awkward to hold it when taking pixes, also no small view finder or cover for the screen- my Canon has both and I miss that.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Janine Thompson "J.Thompson"
Reviews.Content: This is the best investment in a digital camera that I ever made.  Went to an outdoor concert and was not up close but my pictures sure looked like I was on top of the stage.  They were awesome.  From shot to shot the camera is quick, I no longer have to wait inbetween pictures.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.  Very easy to use.  Battery stays charged forever...Thank you Nikon & Amazon.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: brandon
Reviews.Content: Well, as the title suggests, so far so good. No problems getting started and no problems with the photo software that came with it. Takes some really killer macro photos and zoomed photos and thus far I am impressed. Flash location is a bit off, but I'll get used to holding it a little closer to the edges. Battery has lasted well over 200 pics in a variety of conditions (flash/no flash) but i am still ordered a backup for those long days of photographing things and people and stuff. I am impressed and cant wait to get more comfortable with it.

Reviews.Title: Still getting used to it...
Reviews.Author: SMBLUVSNKOTB
Reviews.Content: This camera purchase was a really hard one for me.  I've had my Kodak Z650 for probably 6 years or more and have LOVED it.  I'd been having problems with it, but had hesitated to let it go.  I'd been casually looking at cameras for a while and eventually chose this one.  Overall it's a fine camera.  I love the way the pics look on the screen, but it just operates differently than I am used to.  I do a lot of concert shooting and was hoping that the CMOS sensor would help with this.  It's been really hit or miss in this aspect.  I have a lot more blur with this camera than I did with my other camera (my Z650 pics got a lot of compliments in regards to my concert pics).  This one I feel less satisfied with the pics than my other camera.In a non-concert setting, I've liked it overall, but have used on a lesser scale.  My heart may warm up to it, but I still find myself comparing it to my Z650.  It's not a bad camera, actually nice, but oddly, I feel it lacks to my 6mp...lol!

Reviews.Title: Still learning some things...
Reviews.Author: DannyA3579
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before deciding to purchase this camera. There were certain features I knew I wanted but didn't know if I could get them all in the same camera...at a price I could afford. This camera has it ALL and more. It wouldn't be fair of me to leave a "full" product review yet since I'm still learning about some of the features on the camera. I can tell you that the 1080p video is amazing. The photo quality is excellent. I can't wait to take it off of "Auto" mode and try some of the other settings. It's not the smallest camera in the world so don't expect to go unnoticed if you put it in your pocket.Long story short - I am supremely happy that I bought this camera. Nikon does have a newer model out (Coolpix S9100) but I didn't see the point in spending the extra money, especially since the differences between the 2 models are minimal.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Not up to the mark
Reviews.Author: Kkvasu
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as the last one was from Nikon and still works fine. The S8100 is not up to the mark, the shutter cover stopped closing just after two months, the built quality is poor, The flash has been kept  at a place that will annoy you every time you take a photo where the flash is required, The video quality is fine but all the video is in fast forward mode, can't find how to fix this issue. Just a lesson that if the previous model was good, does not mean the future model would be better.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Sassylily
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to purchase a digital camera because I like things simple and straight to the point.  I had been using a point and shoot Olympia (with film) and I was so embarrassed when my son called me on it last March on a visit with his family.  So I broke-down and purchase this Nikon Coolpix S8100.  I read the instructions and I was surprised at how easy it was to understand the instruction to set it up and use it.  I did it all on my own.  I love it!  I hate technology.  I am one who would rather write than type and I would rather use the library than use the computer.  But like everyone in the world today, I must move with the changes or I'll be left behind.  I feel so smart with this new camera because I can even find the photos after I shoot them.  They are sharp, the lighting is automatically set for me in each picture and I haven't had a problem with it yet.  I recommend it.  It is my first digital camera. Thanks Nikon!  And Thanks Amazon for having it cheaper than anyone else...

Reviews.Title: Delighted
Reviews.Author: antennahawk
Reviews.Content: I've purchased two of these cameras for gifts and the recipients were delighted.  Great camera with excellent features and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I love the camera
Reviews.Author: Lynnette M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: It is just the right size for my purse and the zoom is GREAT!!!  Takes great quality pictures. I go to alot of sporting events and have been totally satisfied with this camera.  Best one I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Best P&C; Ever But No Case
Reviews.Author: russm8
Reviews.Content: This is the best Point & Click Camera I've ever had.Great menu structure, great pictures.I've looked everywhere and haven't been able to find a case or pouch that fits it though.Even the Nikon Leather pouch that's supposed to fit it is slightly too small.

Reviews.Title: A Beginners Dream Camera
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great entry level point and shoot camera with many advanced features then you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Best Compact Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: F. Troxell
Reviews.Content: By far the Nikon Coolpix S8100 is the best compact point and shoot I have ever used.  I have had Canon and Olympus products and they do not even compare.  The automatic mode does it all. It is so easy to use, my wife doesn't have to even think about what to do.  She points and shoots and it is perfect, from outdoor action shots to indoor birthday parties in low light.

Reviews.Title: In general a very good camera
Reviews.Author: K. Galka
Reviews.Content: In general a very good camera; nevertheless, I had to return it due to a clicking noise the camera was making when I turned it on.

Reviews.Title: Not really great....
Reviews.Author: BeastMD "beastmd"
Reviews.Content: Not very good. The camera has significant focusing issues while shooting video especially if you go from a bright area to a shaded area of vice versa. Also zooming and focusing sounds can be heard very loudly in any shot video. It almost makes the video useless. Also seems to have issues focusing sometimes at the end of the zoom. Really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Zoom
Reviews.Author: balletgirl
Reviews.Content: Really bought this model because I wanted the 10x zoom feature. I'm struggling with the lever that zooms the lens. It doesn't respond as quickly as I expected and am missing some good shots. Will keep working with it but don't think this should have to happen.

Reviews.Title: Could be good, but too slow
Reviews.Author: Sean Loy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas.  After charging and taking out of the box, I was immediately disappointed with the autofocus speed of the camera.  We bought to the camera to take pictures of our kids and waiting on autofocus is not in the cards.  After the autofocus, there is a .5 second lag to take a picture.  In this time, we've totally lost the pose with the kids.  The final deal breaker was the location of the flash.  Popping up where it's natural to put your fingers makes no sense.On the plus side, the pictures looked good and well focused once it took a picture.  In the end, I'll be returning this.  I was hoping to avoid buying a DSLR, but for the type of pictures I want of our kids, that's the only one that'll be a solid winner.  Sony A55 here we come.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: Carol Redman
Reviews.Content: Received 5/4/11 & returned 5/5/11. Would not function right out of the box. Got the dreaded "Lens Error" message and it would not work. Tried the "Trouble Shooting" suggestions...still zippo. Will try another brand next time. Enough said!

Reviews.Title: Junk !!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Hartkorn
Reviews.Content: takes good photos on tripod, image stabilization does not work well, very hard to down load photos can't just plug in card.I will try to sell this one and find one that is user friendly

Reviews.Title: Problem with edges
Reviews.Author: Barneyjane
Reviews.Content: Does anyone else have a problem with edges.  For example, I took a picture our of a car window, and the edges of the side view mirror (integral to the picture) have lines across them.  Same with the gutters on a neighbor's house, and the dashboard of a small airplane.  Help!!Blueberry with Nikon S8100

Reviews.Title: as expected
Reviews.Author: brian t. brown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a fair amount of research and we kept arriving at this particular camera--point and shoot w/ more than adequate zoom,mp's, and it takes a photo quickly--the major problem w/ old camera.  Neither of us cared for the necessity of charging the battery in the camera and preferred an immediately replaceable battery but it turns out most better quality cameras are of this species so we bought an extra batt to solve that issue.

Reviews.Title: I thought it was just ok
Reviews.Author: SacEagle
Reviews.Content: Photo quality seemed average.  I thought my old Canon A560 did a lot better job.  However, this one was better to take photos against the sun.  Did not meet my expectations and so returned it. I bought Canon S95 and it is great!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera for non-commercial use
Reviews.Author: Marian
Reviews.Content: I haven't thried the video function yet, but the rest of this camera exceeds my expectations.  Easy to use, high quality pictures, "smart" auto functions.

Reviews.Title: Software Defect
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: 12-1-10:  The S8001 has a defect in the firmware.  Nikon has an update (version 1.1) for it on their website, but you have to buy a SD card reader/writer and implement the fix with a computer yourself.  I consider this a major inconvenience that prospective buyers should be aware of.  I am told by Nikon that cameras currently being manufactured will have the new updated firmware, but that those on the market now will need the fix.

Reviews.Title: As they say "...there's an app for that..."
Reviews.Author: Peter A. Bergman "Peter B."
Reviews.Content: This a great camera that is what it is:  still just a point and shoot camera with a few features that the user can use to alter the camera's settings slightly. It takes beautiful, sharp, grain free photos. But, about that "app":  for the reviewer that commented on putting the camera in his pocket and was concerned about protecting the lens: Nikon makes a leather case designed for the S8100, which is too big to fit in the standard leather case that other Coolpix cameras fit in. It has a belt loop if you want to put it on your belt.  Also, there are plenty of generic cases available that it will fit in, especially neoprene cases .  In fact, NIkon sells a neprene case with the "Nikon Coolpix" metal namplate displayed on it, also with a belt loop. I bought the neoprene case at Target and ordered the leather case over the internet.

Reviews.Title: IT WOULD HAVE BEEN AN EXCELLENT CAMERA BUT...
Reviews.Author: mrq
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, when recording video and using the zoom, the microphone picks up the sound of the zoom motor.  When you play it back, you can't miss the sound unless your taking video with lots of very loud noise.  Very disappointing for what would otherwise have been an absolute winner.  Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: CoolPix Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Marcy
Reviews.Content: So far I love it.  I'm still learning all the in's and out's, but so far so good.  I really love the zoom!!

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed.
Reviews.Author: TexasJohn
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera again, so after having had Canon, I decided to give Nikon a spin. I wish I had stuck with Canon. The S8100 is fine if you're taking photos of something now moving any faster than 3 miles an hour, if that. I took it to an airshow and shot 112 pics, of which maybe 15 are decent. I used the tracking subject setting for the aircraft but zooming in made them blurred, so I had to go with no zoom and hope they'll be big enough to recognize. The flash is in the worst place in the world, then I miss shots because "flash is not fully extended". Low light...forget it. At least you can play with some of the brightness, vivid, and tint controls manually. Over all, for the price I paid for this, it's overpriced. I can't wait to get rid of it and go with Canon again. Nikon's best days are behind them.

Reviews.Title: I was in love but now I am not!
Reviews.Author: Gabriela Vega "Gabriela"
Reviews.Content: Two cameras ago I had a Nikon coolpix that was a very good camera (this was about 6-7 years ago).  It ran on batteries so after taking about 1100 pics on a trip around the world I passed it on to a friend who is still using it.  I then bought a Panasonic that I used a lot and really liked but after 4 years I thought I could get a better camera.I read this camera's review and I though it was a no-brainer.  I then went to test it and even though your fingers get in the way of the flash every time you need the flash I thought it was something that I could get used to and make work.Here are the two biggest dissapointements with this camera:1) At the end of May the flash starting popping out for some bizarre reason - I have not dropped or misused the camera in any way so I have no idea why this is happening now.  It is pretty annoying and I'm thinking that pretty soon the flash is going to fall off the camera or break.2) I did not realize soon enough that this camera does not have the option to take black/white pictures or much less sepia, or any other tones.  It does not provide you that option on the menu and it does not have.  To add insult to injury the software the camera comes with does not offer that either.  WTF???Cannot believe Nikon came out with such a bad product.I will say in their favor that the pics are extremely good but the two items above make my experience go sour.

Reviews.Title: CAUTION
Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: This camera has MANY great features and DOES take great pictures. BUT, the flash "pops-up" in the EXACT location your left hand holds the camera. So Any time you give someone the camera to take a picture, you have to spend 2 minutes explaining NOT to put their fingers there...and most of the time, they do anyway, and it becomes VERY frustrating. It's ashame Nikon didn't put the flash in the center instead on the side ....if they had done that, it would be exceptional - especially for the price.In addition, I had my camera for less than one month, used it twice. Never dropped it. Took great care of it, and it stopped working. Had to return it. I opted for a refund rather than a replacement because the flash became that much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: Prerelease like
Reviews.Author: Panoramabob "Panoramabob"
Reviews.Content: I found the S8100 is in some ways better than the Canon, Sony, Panasonic, Samsung, and Kodak cameras that I compared in the spring.  I've taken many comparison shots with the Nikon S8100 and the Canon SD1400.  I give the Nikon the edge in IQ for still images taken in good light.  The Canon focused faster and more reliably, especially in dim light. The Nikon's focus  and exposure were horrible when taken in dim light.  The Canon did far better.  All of the images were taken in auto mode at each cameras widest lens setting. Image stabilization was turned on. Continuous focus was used for video. I'm very surprised by the results, especially in video where I did a retake and checked the camera settings. I'm returning the S8100.  It is unusable in any low light video situation.  I will watch to see if Nikon releases a firmware fix for it's focus and exposure problems.  If so, I will probably order another one.Two other cameras that I considered but rejected for my use were the Canon SD4500 and the Sony DSC-WX5.  I do not understand why Canon would use a lens now  that starts at 36mm.  The Sony's  controls were just too small.  It was difficult to turn on even with my fingernail.

Reviews.Title: Bought it, returned it!
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: After hours of research I had high hopes for this camera. I have always had Canon's for a pocket sized camera but really thought this one was it. Boy was I wrong. First of all... BELIEVE WHAT YOU READ ABOUT THE FLASH!!!! The placement is absurd. When the camera detects a flash is needed, it automatically pops up... right where your left finger holds the camera. This resulted in "red" pictures as the shutter fired while the flash, impeded by my finger, only popped up part way and so didn't actually illuminate anything! Picture quality on auto and scene was marginal. I have never shot so many blurry pictures in a 1 week span before. I am used to pulling out my camera, hitting the on button and shooting quickly... not so much here. A steady hand is required at all times or forget it. Since you need to be mindful of the flash placement, holding this camera is awkward further exasperating the issue. I could go on but suffice to say, I was very unhappy. Thank you to Amazon for undoing my mistake!I wound up with a Sony... yes, a Sony... DSCX-HX5V - which I LOVE! If you want a flexible, easy, point and shoot... this IS the one.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't buy again!
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use on a trip..1st day there I dropped it trying to move my hand out of the way for the flash to pop up...When It dropped the LCD shattered...I called the company that it was shipped from, since I was in the town where it came from.. They said " If it was within 7 days they would've given me a new camera..but beacause it was on the 8th day..no help at all"  Needless to say I will never order anything that comes from this camera shop again...I used the consumer reports to choose this camera..and I am very dissapointed with the ratings.. it did warn me about the pop up flash..but it doesn't pop up fast enough and the moment is gone by the time it does.. Also, It is very awkward to hold the camera in a way that will allow it to maybe or maybe not pop up.  Also, I used the Auto settings while inside and all the photos were a little dark...nothing that I can't change when editing myself, but it's one more step that I didn't want to have to take!

Reviews.Title: Blah camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Night "Do to others as you would have ...
Reviews.Content: Okay, here's what I hate about this camera:Pros:1) When it takes a good shot it takes a good shot. It's really high rez.2) Much better in low light than a $100 cheaper camera I bought.3) High video resolution.4) It is a battery eater.5) I can't get the battery to last more than 35 minutes. Second, it doesn't come with a separate battery charger, so, if you have a spare battery, you have to use the camera to charge it, which is not as convenient.6) It labels videos as "images" so that when you want to replay or delete them, it's confusing, and you might accidentally delete a video thinking it's an image.7) There is no battery bar on the screen nor in the menu, I've yet to see it after using this cam many times. It doesn't even give you a numerical percentage anywhere. All you get is a fleeting warning before the battery dies. I'm guessing they did this on purpose so people wouldn't realize what a battery hog this thing is.8) As for "plenty of options", a cheap FUJI cam had more options than this thing. It didn't have white balance meter, but still much more versatile than this thing.9) The resolution at high zoom and ability to take pictures in low light is excellent, BUT, unfortunately, if you want a clear picture in low light, you have to hold it pretty still, so the image stabilization is still weak. Also, it uses a high powered light to gauge the target apparently, so it's not stealthy. And another thing about stealth:10) This is a noisy camera, and there is no option to lower the volume of the beeping or turn it off. And when u record video in low light, it makes a movie shutter sound, which can lead to it breaking bcuz I hit it  repeatedly thinking something was jammed.11) Garbage autofocus in video mode, I think pressing the take a photo button brings it in to focus though, sorry I forgot the name of that thing, strange, I know.If they worked these problems out, gave it 30 more minutes of life, and gave it an infrared or radio remote, this would be a great camera, sadly though, I can only recommend it as a great starting camera for kids, or as a high resolution backup camera with video capability.As for the kit, Cameta ripped me off: the little tripod reeks this nasty WD40 smell I've smelt in many cheap electronics which causes headaches and nausea, STRONG nausea, the cheap secondary battery died in days, and they wouldn't give me a return shipping label. If u can get this kit cheap, or camera, like for $170, then yeah u have yourself a deal.

Reviews.Title: Video Was Choppy & Buggy on my XP PC's
Reviews.Author: Jay-T
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera - the still picture quality was excellent- but unfortunately I couldn't get the video to display correctly on my PC's. I run Windows XP on both and maybe it is on my end- but after waiting for 3 weeks for an answer from Nikon's Tech Support (with no solution) I returned my Nikon S8100 for another brand. The HD video now runs fine on both my PC's using a different camera brand. Another downer was the flash popping up right where my left finger was holding the camera. I got used to it quickly- but whenever I handed the camera to someone else to take our picture the flash always got blocked down my their left finger- even after I warned them...I hope the camera works out for others!Cheers

Reviews.Title: Very bad picture quality
Reviews.Author: Sanjay S. Melinamani "Sanjay"
Reviews.Content: I owned it for about 40 days and the indoor picture quality was very very bad in good light settings. Luckily, I had bought it from costco and returned it.Don't even try this camera...

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: sbayer
Reviews.Content: i did not like this camera whatsoever. returned it after a few weeks as it was hard to operate, took horible pictures and was overall bulky.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressive & Overpriced
Reviews.Author: rooster_ranch
Reviews.Content: For $[...], you would think this would be a phenomenal camera. It's not. We used it over Thanksgiving, many shots had to be retaken because of orange hues, fuzziness, red eyes, not true to color, weird white spots on people's clothes and in the background, too low of light, then the flash can be too bright and wash out faces, etc. Also it's bulky and heavy. Worst of all the flash button is on the top left-hand corner and it pops up for some reason when the picture is being taken, (instead of being flush on the front like most modern cameras). The spot the flash button is in, it is always being covered by the finger of whoever is holding the camera getting ready to take the picture. Then the picture has to be retaken b/c the flash didn't go off. Also the 5 in a row shot feature isn't great because it doesn't use a flash and the sequence of five pictures just turn out blurry like cell phone pics. We really wanted to like this camera but we will be returning it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressive & Overpriced
Reviews.Author: rooster_ranch
Reviews.Content: For $300, you would think this would be a phenomenal camera. It's not. We used it over Thanksgiving, many shots had to be retaken because of orange hues, fuzziness, red eyes, not true to color, weird white spots on people's clothes and in the background, too low of light, then the flash can be too bright and wash out faces, etc. Also it's bulky and heavy. Worst of all the flash button is on the top left-hand corner and it pops up for some reason when the picture is being taken, (instead of being flush on the front like most modern cameras). The spot the flash button is in, it is always being covered by the finger of whoever is holding the camera getting ready to take the picture. Then the picture has to be retaken b/c the flash didn't go off. Also the 5 in a row shot feature isn't great because it doesn't use a flash and the sequence of five pictures just turn out blurry like cell phone pics. We really wanted to like this camera but we will be returning it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: L. Hopkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my old Kodak CX7430. I did extensive comparison photo shoot and was surprised that consistently my old Kodak photos came out clearly superior to Nikon's S8100 in terms of image sharpness and color.  Nikon images were blurry in comparison, the colors were either washed out or unrealistically bright when flash was used. (by the way, the flash is most inconveniently placed). The night photos were totally unacceptable - all blurry.  The camera is cheaply made - the USB rubber port cover does not stay in place and is ready to fall off all together. I must say I was extremely disappointed with this product and Nikon. Of course I returned the camera, and I don't think I will consider buying a Nikon any time soon.  Nikon Coolpix S8100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: How Stupid!
Reviews.Author: Gerald
Reviews.Content: You can't preview the pictures WITHOUT the lens being open and extended.Passing around the camera to share your photos on the nice big high resolution screen would be really nerve racking.The one star was for being so stupid.The S8100 does most everything else very well though.Edit- I was told wrong by the Nikon rep.You can view your pictures without the lens being extended.This camera is awesome and deserves a 5+ star rating.

Reviews.Title: so UPSET!
Reviews.Author: Trayce
Reviews.Content: I waited forever to get this camera and finally got it for Christmas! I was excited about being able to take multiple shots of my daughter playing softball and I only got to use it 1 time! My husband uploaded the pics to the computer and when we went to use it again it says "this card cannot be read" well that is a issue as there is no card in it! This error does not allow you to use the camera at all! We continue to email about the problem and no one seems to care. Spent way to much money on this to consider it a one time use disposable camera!

Reviews.Title: Can't get it shipped!
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and accessories on the 1st and chose the free shipping because the camera was shown as "in stock" at Amazon.com. The camera did not ship and most of the accessories already have. I don't understand why an in stock item did not ship. In stock items shipped free always arrive in less than 5 days but since this one did not ship I may not see it until next week. Very disappointing, not what I was used to from Amazon.com
